en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are those whom when they spend their wealth do not go to the limit of extravagance in their spending, nor do they restrict their spending to only those whom they have to spend on such as themselves and others, but their spending is balanced between wastefulness and niggardliness.

translation: Who do not invoke any god apart from God, who do not take a life which God has forbidden except for a cause that is just, and do not fornicate -- and any one who does so will be punished for the crime,
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّفْسَ ٱلَّتِى حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who do not call on any other deity besides Allah, may He be glorified, nor kill any person, whose killing Allah has prohibited except for that which Allah has allowed such as the killing of a murderer, renegade or a married adulterer, nor commit adultery. Whoever does these major sins will face the punishment for the sin he has committed on the Day of Judgement.

translation: Whose punishment will be doubled on the Day of Judgement, and he will live for ever in disgrace,
sentence: يُضَٰعَفْ لَهُ ٱلْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِۦ مُهَانًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Judgement, and he will remain in the punishment, disgraced and humiliated.

translation: Except those who repent and come to believe and do the right, for whom God will turn evil into goodness, for God is forgiving and kind.
sentence: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَٰلِحًا فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ ٱللَّهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ حَسَنَٰتٍ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But those who repent to Allah and do good deeds that indicate the sincerity of their repentance, then Allah will change the evil deeds of such people into good ones. Allah is Forgiving of the sins of those of His servants who repent and He is Merciful towards them.

translation: Whosoever repents and does the right, will have turned back to God by way of repentance;
sentence: وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحًا فَإِنَّهُۥ يَتُوبُ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ مَتَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who repent to Allah and prove the sincerity of their repentance by doing good deeds and giving up sins, their repentance is one that is accepted.

translation: And those who do not give false evidence, and if they come across unbecoming talk ignore it and pass by in a sedate way;
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ ٱلزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِٱللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا۟ كِرَامًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who do not attend falsehood, such as places of sins and prohibited amusement, and when they pass by futile statements and actions they pass by quickly, keeping the dignity of their souls by staying away from becoming involved in these things.

translation: Who, when reminded of their Lord's revelations, do not fall for them like the deaf and blind;
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا۟ عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who, when reminded of Allah’s signs that are heard and seen, do not turn a deaf ear to the signs that are heard and do not turn a blind eye to the signs that are seen.

translation: And those who say: "O Lord, give us comfort in our spouses and children, and make us paragons of those who follow the straight path."
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّٰتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَٱجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who say in their prayer to their Lord: Our Lord, give us from our spouses and offspring those who will be the coolness of our eyes due to their piety and steadfastness on the truth. Make us leaders in truth who are emulated by those who are mindful of You.

translation: They will be rewarded for their perseverance with lofty mansions in empyrean where they will be received with greetings of peace and salutations,
sentence: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ ٱلْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَٰمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who possess those attributes will be rewarded with lofty chambers in the highest stage of Paradise for their steadfastness in following Allah. There they will be met by the angels with greetings and peace and they will be safe there from all difficulties.

translation: And abide there for ever: What an excellent destination and abode!
sentence: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There they will stay forever - a beautiful place of settlement for them to settle in and a place of residence for them to reside in.

translation: Say: "My Lord is not concerned on your account if you do not pray to Him. You have surely done with denying; soon will come the inevitable judgement.
sentence: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَؤُا۟ بِكُمْ رَبِّى لَوْلَا دُعَآؤُكُمْ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًۢا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say - O Messenger, to the disbelievers who persist in their disbelief: My Lord will never care about you because of some benefit that He gets from your obedience. If it were not because He calls you for your benefit He would not have cared about you. Now since you rejected that which the Messengers brought from your Lord, the recompense for such rejection will be inseparable from you.

translation: TA SIN MIM.
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ طسٓمٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Ṭā Sīn Mīm The discussion on similar letters has already passed in Sūrah Al-Baqarah.

translation: These are the verses of the perspicuous Book.
sentence: تِلْكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those are the verses of the Qur’ān that makes the truth clear from falsehood.

translation: You may perhaps wear out your heart because they do not come to belief.
sentence: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Perhaps you O Messenger because of your eagerness for their guidance are killing yourself out of fear for them that they do not believe in Allah.

translation: We could send down from the heavens a sign to them if We pleased, before which their heads would remain bowed.
sentence: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: If I had wished to send down to them a miracle from the sky I would have sent it down and their necks would remain bowed in utter humility before it. But I did not wish that, in order to test them: Do they believe in the Ghaib?

translation: Never does a new reminder come to them from Ar-Rahman but they turn away from it.
sentence: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Whenever any new reminder that is revealed by the Merciful to these idolaters, which contain His arguments that indicate His Oneness and the truth of His prophet, they turn away from listening to it and accepting it.

translation: Surely they have done with denying; soon will come to them the news of what they were laughing at.
sentence: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They have denied what their Messenger brought to them, but the confirmation of the information that they used to mock at will soon come to them and the punishment will fall upon them.

translation: Do they not see the earth, how We grow all kinds of noble things upon it?
sentence: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do these people remain persistent in their disbelief and not look at the earth, how many different types of vegetation that is beautiful to look at and that has plenty of benefits did I grow therein!

translation: Verily there are signs in this; yet many of them do not believe.
sentence: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In the earth’s growing various types of vegetation there truly is a clear sign of the Power of the One Who has made it grow to bring back the dead to life, though most of them do not have faith.

translation: Your Lord is surely mighty and merciful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Your Lord - O Messenger - is the One Who is the Dominant who can never be overpower, and the Merciful to those of His servants who have faith.

translation: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people,
sentence: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember - O Messenger - when your Lord called out to Moses instructing him to go to the people who were doing wrong by their rejection of Allah and enslavement of the people of Moses.

translation: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"
sentence: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These were the people of Pharaoh. He should instruct them gently and softly to be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His instructions and avoiding His prohibitions.

translation: : He said: "O Lord, I fear that they will deny me.
sentence: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 13. Moses (peace be upon him) said, I fear that they will deny me and what I convey to them from you, and that my breast will be constricted because of their denial of me, and that my tongue will not be free in calling to Allah, so send Gabriel (peace be upon him) to my brother, Aaron, so that he could assist me.

translation: My heart is constrained, my tongue falters, so delegate Aaron;
sentence: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 13. Moses (peace be upon him) said, I fear that they will deny me and what I convey to them from you, and that my breast will be constricted because of their denial of me, and that my tongue will not be free in calling to Allah, so send Gabriel (peace be upon him) to my brother, Aaron, so that he could assist me.

translation: And they have a charge (of murder) against me. So I fear that they will kill me."
sentence: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They also have a charge against me because I had killed the Copt, and I fear they may kill me.

translation: (It was) said: "By no means. Go with My signs, both of you. I am verily with you and I hear.
sentence: قَالَ كَلَّا فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah said to Moses (peace be upon him): By no means! They will never kill you. Go, you and your brother Aaron, with My signs that indicate your truthfulness. I shall be with you with My assistance and support, listening to what you say and what is said to you. Nothing of that misses us.

translation: Go to the Pharaoh and tell him: 'We bring a message from the Lord of all the worlds
sentence: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Go to Pharaoh and tell him: We are two Messengers sent to you by the Lord of all created things.

translation: That you should send the children of Israel with us.'
sentence: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That you send the Israelites with us.

translation: (The Pharaoh) said: "Did we not bring you up as a child? And you lived a number of years of your life with us.
sentence: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said to Moses (peace be upon him): Did we not bring you up as a child among us? Did you not stay with us for many years of your life? So what has now made you claim prophethood?

translation: And you commited what you did, and you are ungrateful!"
sentence: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You committed a serious deed when you killed the Copt in defence of a man of your people, and you are one of those who deny my favours to you.

translation: (Moses) replied: "I did do that and I was in the wrong,
sentence: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Moses (peace be upon him) said to Pharaoh: I did what you mentioned before I received revelation and was sent as a messenger.

translation: So I ran away from you out of fear. But my Lord has given me wisdom, and made me an apostle.
sentence: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I fled from you to Madyan after killing him when I feared that you will kill me. Then my Lord gave me knowledge and made me one of His Messengers that He sends to people.

translation: But the favour you oblige me with is that you have enslaved the children of Israel."
sentence: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Your bringing me up without enslaving me after you enslaved the Israelites is a favour that you are reminding me of?!

translation: The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"
sentence: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said to Moses (peace be upon him): What is the Lord of all created things Whose Messenger you claim to be?

translation: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you can believe."
sentence: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Moses said in response to Pharaoh: The Lord of all created things is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and the Lord of whatever is between them. If you are certain that He is your Lord then worship Him alone.

translation: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"
sentence: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُۥٓ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said to the leaders of his people around him: Do you not hear the response of Moses and the false claim it contains.

translation: (Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."
sentence: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Moses said to them: Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your earlier forefathers.

translation: (The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you, is certainly mad."
sentence: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said: This man who claims to be a Messenger to you is insane. He is not aware of how to respond and he says that which does not make sense.

translation: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them, if you have sense."
sentence: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Moses said, Allah, the One to Whom I call you, is the Lord of the East and the West and the Lord of what is in between them. If only you had sense that you could reason with.

translation: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."
sentence: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said to Moses after becoming unable to argue with him: If you worship any god other than Me, I will throw you into prison.

translation: (Moses) said: "Even though I have brought to you something convincing?"
sentence: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَىْءٍ مُّبِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Moses (peace be upon him) said to Pharaoh: Will you throw me into prison even if I bring to you something that makes clear my truthfulness in what I have brought to you from Allah?

translation: (The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it, if you speak the truth."
sentence: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He said: Bring what you say will indicate your truthfulness if you are true in your claim!

translation: So (Moses) cast his staff, and lo, it turned into a living serpent.
sentence: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Moses threw his stick down on the ground and it suddenly became a snake for everyone to see.

translation: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it looked white to the beholders.
sentence: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He put his hand into the opening of his garment without its being white and then he drew it out radiant white - not the white of leprosy - for the onlookers to see.

translation: The Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: "He is certainly a clever magician.
sentence: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said to the leaders of his people around him: This man is a magician, well versed in magic.

translation: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. So, what do you bid?"
sentence: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He means to use his magic to drive you out of your land! What do you suggest we do to him?

translation: They said: "Put him and his brother off awhile, and send summoners to the cities to gather
sentence: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 37. They said to him: Delay him and his brother and do not rush to punish them. Send out to the cities of Egypt those who will gather the magicians, to bring every magician, well versed in magic.

translation: And bring the ablest magicians to you."
sentence: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 37. They said to him: Delay him and his brother and do not rush to punish them. Send out to the cities of Egypt those who will gather the magicians, to bring every magician, well versed in magic.

translation: So the magicians were assembled at a stated time and place on an appointed day.
sentence: فَجُمِعَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَٰتِ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh assembled his magicians to challenge Moses at an appointed place and time.

translation: And the people were also asked to assemble.
sentence: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّجْتَمِعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people were told: Are you going to gather to see who wins? Will it be Moses or the magicians?

translation: (They said): "We may haply follow the magicians if they are victorious."
sentence: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: If the magicians succeed over Moses, perhaps we should follow them in their religion.

translation: When the magicians arrived, they said to the Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we are victorious?" --
sentence: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when the magicians came before Pharaoh to challenge Moses, they said to him, “Will we have a tangible reward or an intangible one, if we have the upper hand over Moses?”

translation: "Yes," he replied. "You 'will be among the honoured."
sentence: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said to them, “Yes, you shall get a reward. If you are to succeed over Moses, you shall be taken as my close ones by being appointed in lofty posts.”

translation: Moses said to them: "Cast what you have to cast."
sentence: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Confident in Allah’s help and in order to show clearly that whatever he possessed was not magic, Moses said to them, “Throw whatever ropes and sticks you want to!”

translation: So they cast their ropes and rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall be victorious."
sentence: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَٰلِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And so they threw down their ropes and sticks, and upon throwing them, said, “By the grandeur of Pharaoh we are going to succeed, and Moses is the one who shall be defeated!”

translation: Then Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it swallowed up their conjurations.
sentence: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Moses threw his staff and it turned into a snake, nullifying whatever magic they were casting over the people.

translation: Then the magicians fell prostrating in adoration,
sentence: فَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سَٰجِدِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the magicians saw Moses’s staff swallowing up whatever they had cast, they fell into prostration.

translation: And said: "We (affirm and) believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
sentence: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They said, “I have brought faith in the Lord of all creation.”

translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
sentence: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “The Lord of Moses and Aaron (peace be upon them).”

translation: Said (the Pharaoh): "You have come to believe in him before I gave you leave. He is surely your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon come to know: I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides, and have every one of you crucified."
sentence: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh, disapproving of the magicians’ belief, said to them, “Have you accepted Moses as being true, before I gave you permission to do so? Indeed, Moses is your mentor who has taught you magic; you have all collaborated to exile the people of Egypt from its lands, and you will soon see what punishment I inflict upon you. I shall cut off a hand and leg of each of you from opposite sides, and crucify you all on palm trunks, sparing no one.”

translation: They said: "There will be no harm. We shall return to our Lord.
sentence: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The magicians said to Pharaoh, “There is no big deal in the crucifixion and maiming you threaten us with in this world, because your punishment will end, while we shall return to our Lord who shall enter us into His everlasting mercy.”

translation: We certainly hope our Lord will forgive our sins as we are the first to believe."
sentence: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Due to us being the first ones to bring faith in Moses, we hope greatly that Allah erases the sins we have committed in the past.”

translation: We said to Moses: "Travel by night with My creatures. You will surely be pursued."
sentence: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِىٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I revealed to Moses commanding him to march the Israelites out at night, because Pharaoh and his people would pursue them, forcing them back.

translation: Then the Pharaoh sent announcers to the cities,
sentence: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when Pharaoh came to know of the Israelites escaping, he sent some of his army into the cities, rallying the rest of the armies.

translation: (Proclaiming): "Surely they are a small band (of fugitives).
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh said, undermining the Israelites, “Indeed, these people are very few in number.”

translation: They are always harassing us.
sentence: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَآئِظُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they will do things which will incite us against them.

translation: But we are a fully accounted army."
sentence: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَٰذِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, we are alert and prepared for them.

translation: So We made them leave the gardens and springs of water,
sentence: فَأَخْرَجْنَٰهُم مِّن جَنَّٰتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I took Pharaoh and his people out of the land of Egypt, which had abundant gardens, flowing streams and wealth.

translation: And treasures and agreeable mansions.
sentence: وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It also had treasures of wealth and beautiful dwellings.

translation: Thus it was; and We made the children of Israel possess them.
sentence: كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَٰهَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As I took Pharaoh and his people out of it, I made the Israelites inherit it.

translation: But they pursued them at sunrise.
sentence: فَأَتْبَعُوهُم مُّشْرِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh and his people caught the trail of the Israelites at sunrise.

translation: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."
sentence: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when the two groups came into view of each other, Moses’s people said, “we are definitely going to be captured!” When Pharaoh and his people drew closer to Moses and his people, such that each person was in view of the other on the opposite side, Moses’s people said, “Indeed, Pharaoh and his people will catch up with us and we are powerless against them.”

translation: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."
sentence: قَالَ كَلَّآ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Moses said to his people: “It is not as you have imagined it to be, for My Lord is with me supporting and helping me. He shall guide and show me the path to salvation.”

translation: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain.
sentence: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And so I revealed to Moses commanding him to strike the sea with his staff, which he did. The sea parted, turning into twelve paths: the same number as the tribes of the Israelites, and each parted segment was like a great mountain in its grandeur and stability, such that no water flowed from it.

translation: Then We brought the others to that place.
sentence: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I made Pharaoh and his people draw closer until they entered the sea, thinking that the path was traversable.

translation: We delivered Moses and every one with him,
sentence: وَأَنجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥٓ أَجْمَعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I saved Moses and whoever was with him from the Israelites; none from among them perished.

translation: And We drowned the others.
sentence: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I then destroyed Pharaoh and his people by drowning them in the sea.

translation: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
sentence: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in the parting of the sea for Moses, his salvation from Pharaoh and Pharaoh’s destruction, is a miracle proving the truthfulness of Moses. The majority of those with Pharaoh were not believers, they were rejecters.

translation: Indeed your Lord is mighty and merciful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord is the almighty who takes retribution from His enemies, yet merciful to those of them who repent.

translation: Relate the news of Abraham to them.
sentence: وَٱتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Recite unto them the story of Abraham.

translation: When he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When he said to his father Azar and his people, “What do you worship instead of Allah?”

translation: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."
sentence: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His people said to him, “I worship idols, whose worship I remain firm upon and hold fast to.”

translation: (Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them?
sentence: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Abraham said to them, “Do the idols hear your prayers when you supplicate to them?”

translation: Or do they benefit you, or do you harm?"
sentence: أَوْ يَنفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Or do they benefit you if you feed them, or harm you if you disobey them?”

translation: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."
sentence: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They said, They do not hear us when we supplicate to them, nor do they benefit us when we feed them, nor harm us if we disobey them. However, the reality is that we found our forefathers doing that, so we follow them.

translation: He said: "Have you considered what you have been worshipping,
sentence: قَالَ أَفَرَءَيْتُم مَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Abraham said, “Have you contemplated over and realised what idols you actually worship instead of Allah?”

translation: You and your fathers?
sentence: أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُمُ ٱلْأَقْدَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And what your forefathers before used to worship?”

translation: Yet they are my enemies except the Lord of all the worlds
sentence: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Because they are all my enemies; they are all false except for the Lord of all creation.”

translation: Who created me and showed me the way,
sentence: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَنِى فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “The one who created me and it is He who will guide me to the best of this world and the Hearafter.”

translation: Who gives me food and drink,
sentence: وَٱلَّذِى هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِى وَيَسْقِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “The being who alone feeds me when I am hungry and gives me drink when I am thirsty.”

translation: And heals me when I am sick,
sentence: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And when I am ill, He alone cures me from illness; there is no healer for me except Him.”

translation: Who will make me die, then give me life again,
sentence: وَٱلَّذِى يُمِيتُنِى ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “The being who alone will cause me to die when my lifespan expires and will resurrect me after I die.”

translation: And who, I hope, will condone my faults on the Day of Judgement.
sentence: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “The being in who alone I hope will forgive my sins on the day of requital.”

translation: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous,
sentence: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Abraham, supplicating to his Lord, said, “O my Lord! Grant me a deep understanding of religion and join me up with the pious prophets who came before me, by entering me into paradise with them.”

translation: And uphold my name with posterity,
sentence: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And grant me a true reputation of honour with the generations after me.

translation: And put me among the inheritors of Paradise.
sentence: وَٱجْعَلْنِى مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And make me from among those who inherit the dwellings of paradise wherein your believing servants shall reside in luxury; grant me residence in them.

translation: Forgive me and my father: He was surely among those who went astray.
sentence: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And forgive my father. Indeed, he was one of those who deviated from the truth due to idolatry. Abraham supplicated on behalf of his father before it became clear to him that he was from among the people of hell. When that became clear to him, he proclaimed his disassociation with him and no longer supplicated for him.

translation: And do not disgrace me on the day when they are raised from the graves,
sentence: وَلَا تُخْزِنِى يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do not humiliate me with punishment on the day people are resurrected to be taken to account.

translation: The day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail
sentence: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when the wealth he accumulated in this world shall not benefit nor his children that used to support him.

translation: But to him who comes to God with a tranquil heart."
sentence: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for the one who brings a perfect heart: one free of idolatry, hypocrisy, ostentation and arrogance. That is because he would have benefitted from his wealth which was spent in the path of Allah and his children, who would pray for him.

translation: Paradise will be brought near those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path;
sentence: وَأُزْلِفَتِ ٱلْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Paradise will be brought nearer to those who were mindful of their Lord, by fulfilling His commands and refraining from His prohibitions.

translation: And Hell made visible to those who had gone astray.
sentence: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Hellfire will be exposed on the plains of resurrection for the deviants who deviated from the truth.

translation: They will be asked: "Where are those you worshipped
sentence: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said in rebuke to them, “Where are the idols you used to worship?”

translation: Other than God? Can they save you or even save themselves?"
sentence: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “You used to worship them instead of Allah? Will they help you by preventing the punishment of Allah from you, or will they be able to help themselves?”

translation: They will then be thrown into Hell with those who had gone astray
sentence: فَكُبْكِبُوا۟ فِيهَا هُمْ وَٱلْغَاوُۥنَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, they will be thrown into hell one on top of the other, together with whoever they led astray.

translation: Together with the hordes of Iblis.
sentence: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The helpers of Iblīs are all satans, without exception.

translation: Disputing among themselves they will say:
sentence: قَالُوا۟ وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The idolaters who worshipped other than Allah and took them as partners to Him, will say whilst arguing with those they used to worship,

translation: "By God, we were plainly in error
sentence: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “By Allah we were deviant from the clear truth.”

translation: In equating you with the Lord of all the worlds;
sentence: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُم بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “When we regarded you as equals to the Lord of all creation and worshipped you like we worshipped Him.”

translation: No one but the sinners led us astray.
sentence: وَمَآ أَضَلَّنَآ إِلَّا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “None led us astray from the path of truth except those criminals who called us towards worshipping them instead of Allah.”

translation: Now we have none to intercede for us,
sentence: فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَٰفِعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So we have no intercessors today who shall intercede for us in front of Allah, to save us from His punishment.”

translation: Nor any sincere friend.
sentence: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Neither do we have a true devoted friend who will defend and intercede for u.”

translation: If only we could return and be among the believers!"
sentence: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “If only we could return once more to the worldly life, so that we could be from those who believed in Allah.”

translation: Verily there is a sign in this, but many of them do not believe.
sentence: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in the aforementioned, i.e. the story of Abraham (peace be upon him) and the ultimate abode of the rejecters, is a lesson for those who take heed. Although most of them do not believe; they were rejecters of what Abraham brought from his Lord.

translation: Verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord is the almighty who takes retribution from His enemies, yet merciful to those of them who repent.

translation: The people of Noah accused the apostles of lies.
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of Noah disbelieved in all the messengers when they rejected Noah (peace be upon him).

translation: When their brother Noah said to them: "Will you not take heed?
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When Noah said to them, “Will you not be mindful of Allah and leave the worship of other than Him, out of fear for Him?”

translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
sentence: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, I am a Messenger for you; Allah has sent me to you and I am trustworthy, I will not increase or decrease in that which has be revealed to me.”

translation: So be fearful of God and listen to me.
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I command you with and forbid you from.”

translation: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I do not seek any reward from you for what I convey to you from my Lord. My reward is only from Allah: the Lord of all creation, not from anyone else.”

translation: So fear God and follow me."
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I command you with and forbid you from.”

translation: They said: "Should we place our trust in you when only the condemned follow you?"
sentence: قَالُوٓا۟ أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَٱتَّبَعَكَ ٱلْأَرْذَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His people said to him, “O Noah! Should we believe you and follow what you have brought and act upon it, whilst your followers are the lowliest of people; there are no leaders and noblemen among them?”

translation: He said: "It is not for me to know what they were doing.
sentence: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Noah (peace be upon him) said to them, “What do I know of what these believers used to do? I am not an overseer over them that I account for their deeds.”

translation: It is for my Lord to bring them to book, if you can understand.
sentence: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Their accountability is only to Allah who knows their secret and public affairs, not to me. If you realised, you would not have said what you just did.”

translation: I am certainly not one to drive away the believers.
sentence: وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِطَارِدِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I am not going to push away these believers from my gathering in acceptance of your wished, just so that you believe.”

translation: I am only a plain admonisher."
sentence: إِنْ أَنَا۠ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I am only a clear warner; I warn you of the punishment of Allah.”

translation: They said: "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will be stoned to death."
sentence: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His people said to him, “If you do not stop calling towards what you’re calling us towards, you will definitely be harrassed and stoned to death.”

translation: He prayed: "O Lord, verily my people accuse me of lies.
sentence: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِى كَذَّبُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Supplicating to his Lord, Noah said, “O my Lord! Indeed, my nation has rejected me and not believed in what I have brought from you to be true.”

translation: So adjudge between me and them conclusively, and save me and the believers who are with me."
sentence: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So judge between me and them such that they are destroyed due to their insistence on falsehood and save me and those believers who are with me, from the punishment you destroy the disbelievers with.”

translation: So We delivered him and those with him in the loaded ark,
sentence: فَأَنجَيْنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I answered his supplication and saved him and the believers with him in the ark, which was full of people and animals.

translation: And drowned the rest of them.
sentence: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ ٱلْبَاقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then I drowned the remaining rest, who were the people of Noah.

translation: Verily there is a sign in this, yet many of them do not believe.
sentence: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in the aforementioned, i.e. the story of Noah and his people, the saving of Noah and the believers with him and the destruction of the disbelievers from his nation, is a lesson for those who take heed. Although most of them do not believe; they were rejecters.

translation: But surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord is the almighty who takes retribution from His enemies, yet merciful to those of them who repent.

translation: The people of 'Ad accused the messengers of lies.
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of ‘Ād disbelived in all the messengers by their rejection of Hud (peace be upon him).

translation: When their brother Hud said to them: "Will you not take heed?
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember when their brother, the prophet Hud said to them, “Will you not be mindful of Allah and leave the worship of other than Him, out of fear for Him?”

translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
sentence: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, I am a Messenger for you; Allah has sent me to you and I am trustworthy, I will not increase or decrease in that which has be revealed to me.”

translation: So fear God and listen to me.
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I have commanded you with and forbidden you from.”

translation: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I do not seek any reward from you for what I convey to you from my Lord. My reward is only from Allah: the Lord of all creation, not from anyone else.”

translation: You construct monuments on every hill in vain,
sentence: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ ءَايَةً تَعْبَثُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Why are you building upon every elevated, overlooking place a building as a marker, unnecessarily, without any benefit in it for you in the world or the afterlife?”

translation: Erect palaces (thinking) that you will live for ever,
sentence: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And why do you build forts and palaces as if you were to live forever in this world, never to depart from it?”

translation: And whenever you apply force become tyrannical.
sentence: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُم بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And when you attack a place, you attack like tyrants, killing and with violence, showing no kindness or mercy.”

translation: So be fearful of God and follow me.
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I command you with and forbid you from.”

translation: Fear Him who has bestowed on you what you know,
sentence: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَمَدَّكُم بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And fear the wrath of Allah who has granted you everything which you know well.”

translation: Gave you increase of cattle and sons,
sentence: أَمَدَّكُم بِأَنْعَٰمٍ وَبَنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “He granted you many bounties, and granted you offspring.”

translation: And orchards and springs.
sentence: وَجَنَّٰتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And He granted you gardens and flowing streams.”

translation: I fear the punishment of a terrible day for you.
sentence: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O my people! I fear the punishment of the great day over you: the Day of Judgement.

translation: They said: "It is the same to us if you warn us or do not warn.
sentence: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His people said to him, “Your warning us and not warning us is the same to us, for we shall never believe in you and will never turn away from whatever we are doing.”

translation: This is just a habit of antiquated people.
sentence: إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا خُلُقُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This is nothing but the religion of the people of the past, their habits and their character.

translation: We are not going to be damned."
sentence: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And we are not going to be punished.

translation: Then they accused him of lies; so We annihilated them. Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
sentence: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَٰهُمْ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They continued rejecting their prophet Hud (peace be upon him), so I destroyed them due to their rejection by a barren wind. Indeed, there is a lesson in their destruction for those who take heed. Although most of them do not believe; they were rejecters.

translation: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord is the almighty who takes retribution from His enemies, yet merciful to those of them who repent.

translation: The Thamud accused the messengers of lies.
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Thamūd disbelieved in all the messenger by their rejection of Saleh (peace be upon him).

translation: When their brother Saleh said to them: "Will you not take heed?"
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember when their brother in lineage Saleh said to them, “Will you not be mindful of Allah and leave the worship of other than Him, out of fear for Him?”

translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
sentence: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, I am a Messenger for you; Allah has sent me to you and I am trustworthy, I will not increase or decrease in that which has be revealed to me.”

translation: So fear God and follow me.
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I have commanded you with and forbidden you from.”

translation: I do not ask any recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I do not seek any reward from you for what I convey to you from my Lord. My reward is only from Allah: the Lord of all creation, not from anyone else.”

translation: (Do you think) you will be left secure here
sentence: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِى مَا هَٰهُنَآ ءَامِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Do you expect to be left alone in whatever goodness and bounties you are in, in safety and without fear?”

translation: In these gardens and these springs,
sentence: فِى جَنَّٰتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In gardens and flowing springs.

translation: The fields of corn and date-palm trees with soft and tender spathes,
sentence: وَزُرُوعٍ وَنَخْلٍ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Among crops and palms, the fruits of which are tender and delicate.”

translation: And dwellings hewed out of mountains ingeniously?
sentence: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا فَٰرِهِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And you skilfully carve out houses from the mountains, in which you then live.”

translation: So be mindful of God and listen to me.
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I have commanded you with and forbidden you from.”

translation: Do not follow those who are extravagant,
sentence: وَلَا تُطِيعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And do not submit to the commands of those who are immoderate on themselves by committing sins.”

translation: Who corrupt the land and do not reform it."
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Those who cause corruption on Earth by spreading sins and do not rectify themselves by holding on to the obedience of Allah.”

translation: They said: "Surely you are deluded.
sentence: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَحَّرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His people said to him, “You are surely one of those who have been bewitched repeatedly until the magic has overpowered your intellect and driven you crazy.”

translation: You are nothing but a man like us. Bring us a token if you speak the truth."
sentence: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “You are nothing but a human like us; you do not have any privilege over us which makes you worthy of being a Messenger, so bring a sign that proves you are a Messenger if indeed you are truthful in your claim to be one.”

translation: (Saleh) said: "Here is a she-camel. She has a right of drinking water, and you have a right of drinking it on appointed turns.
sentence: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: After Allah had given Saleh a sign that was in the form of the she-camel which Allah extracted from the rock, he said to them, “This is a she-camel which can be seen and felt, it will have a share of the water as you also have a known share. It will not drink on the day scheduled for you, neither shall you make your livestock drink on the day scheduled for it.”

translation: Do not treat her unkindly or the punishment of a grievous day will fall on you."
sentence: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Do not harm it by way of hitting it or cutting its legs, otherwise the punishment of Allah will come upon you and destroy you on a distressing day, due to the affliction that comes down on it.”

translation: But they hamstrung her; and on the morrow were repentant,
sentence: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ نَٰدِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So they agreed upon cutting its legs, and the most wretched from them all did the act. Then they regretted the deed they had committed because of realising that the punishment was about to befall them inevitably. However, regret after seeing the punishment is of no benefit.

translation: For they were seized by the torment. Verily there was a sign in this, but most of them did not believe.
sentence: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So the punishment that they were promised seized them: it was an earthquake accompanied by a scream. Indeed, in the aforementioned, i.e. the story of Saleh and his people, is a lesson for those who take heed. Although most of them do not believe; they were rejecters.

translation: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord is the almighty who takes retribution from His enemies, yet merciful to those of them who repent.

translation: The people of Lot accused the messengers of lies.
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of Lut disbelieved in all the messengers by their rejection of Lut (peace be upon him).

translation: When their brother Lot said to them: "Will you not take heed?
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember when their brother in lineage Lot said to them, Will you not be mindful of Allah by leaving idolatry, fearing Him?

translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
sentence: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, I am a Messenger for you; Allah has sent me to you and I am trustworthy, I will not increase or decrease in that which has be revealed to me.”

translation: So fear God and listen to me.
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I command you with and forbid you from.”

translation: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I do not seek any reward from you for what I convey to you from my Lord. My reward is only from Allah: the Lord of all creation, not from anyone else.”

translation: Why do you go for males unlike all other creatures
sentence: أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Do you seek sexual gratification from males?”

translation: Leaving the consorts your Lord has made for you? But you are a people who exceed the bounds."
sentence: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Whilst neglecting sexual gratification from the front passages of your wives Allah has created for you? You have indeed transgressed the limits of Allah by this detestable absurdity.”

translation: They said: "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will be expelled (from the city)."
sentence: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His people said to him, “O Lot! If you do not stop forbidding us from this act and rebuking us over it, you and those with you shall be exiled from our city.”

translation: (Lot) said: "I am disgusted with your actions,"
sentence: قَالَ إِنِّى لِعَمَلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْقَالِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Lot said to them, “Indeed, I am one of those who dislike and hate this act of yours.”

translation: (And prayed:) "O Lord, save me and my family from what they do."
sentence: رَبِّ نَجِّنِى وَأَهْلِى مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Supplicating to his Lord, he said, “O my Lord! Save me and my family from whatever punishment is going to afflict these people because of the evil they commit.”

translation: So We saved him and his whole family
sentence: فَنَجَّيْنَٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ أَجْمَعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I accepted his supplication and saved him and his whole family.

translation: Except one old woman who remained behind.
sentence: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِى ٱلْغَٰبِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for his wife because she was a disbeliever, so she ended up being one of those who perished and were destroyed.

translation: Then We destroyed the rest of them,
sentence: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, after Lot and his family left the city of Sodom, I severely destroyed his people who remained behind.

translation: And rained on them a shower (of Stones). How terrible was the rain (that fell) on those who had been warned!
sentence: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I rained down on them stones from the sky, just like we send down the rain. Disgraceful was the rain that befell these people, whom Lot used to warn of the punishment of Allah if they continued committing their evil acts.

translation: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe.
sentence: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in the aforementioned, i.e. the punishment that descended on the people of Lot because of their sexual indecency, is a lesson for those who take heed. Although most of them do not believe; they were rejecters.

translation: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and powerful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord is the almighty who takes retribution from His enemies, yet merciful to those of them who repent.

translation: The people of the Wood too called the messengers liars.
sentence: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَٰبُ لْـَٔيْكَةِ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of the Thicket close to Madyan rejected the Messengers when they rejected their prophet Shu‘ayb (peace be upon him).

translation: When Shu'aib said to them: "Will you not take heed?
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When their prophet Shu‘ayb said to them, “Will you not be mindful of Allah by leaving idolatry, fearing Him?”

translation: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
sentence: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, I am a Messenger for you; Allah has sent me to you and I am trustworthy, I will not increase or decrease in that which has be revealed to me.”

translation: So fear God and follow me.
sentence: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commandments and refrain from that which He has prohibited. And obey me in whatever I have commanded you with and forbidden you from.”

translation: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I do not seek any reward from you for what I convey to you from my Lord. My reward is only from Allah: the Lord of all creation, not from anyone else.”

translation: Give full measure and do not cheat;
sentence: أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “When you sell to the people, measure for them properly. Do not be people who reduce measure when selling to people.”

translation: Weigh on an even balance.
sentence: وَزِنُوا۟ بِٱلْقِسْطَاسِ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And when you weigh for others, weigh with properly functioning scales.”

translation: And do not withhold from people what belongs to them, and do not corrupt the land;
sentence: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And do not violate the rights of people and cause excessive corruption on Earth by committing sins.”

translation: And fear Him who created you and all the earlier people."
sentence: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ وَٱلْجِبِلَّةَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And be mindful of the one who created you and created the previous nations, by fearing that He sends down His punishment upon you.”

translation: They said: "Surely you are deluded.
sentence: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَحَّرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Shu‘ayb’s people said to him, “You are definitely one of those who have been victim of sorcery repeatedly, until it has overpowered your intelligence and driven you crazy.”

translation: You are nothing but a man like us, and we think you are a liar.
sentence: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَٰذِبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “You are only a human like us and have no privilege over us, so how could you be a Messenger? I think of you only to be a liar in your claim to be a Messenger.”

translation: But in case you are speaking the truth, then make a segment of the sky to fall upon us."
sentence: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So if you are truthful in your claim, cause a piece of sky to fall upon us.”

translation: (Shu'aib) said: "My Lord knows well what you are doing."
sentence: قَالَ رَبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Shu‘ayb said to them, “My Lord is better aware of the idolatry and sins you commit; none of your actions are hidden from Him.”

translation: But they denied him, and We seized them with the torment of the Day of Shadowing (when the cloud had rained down fire). It was indeed the torment of a terrible day!
sentence: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They continued rejecting him and so a grave punishment afflicted them by way of a cloud appearing after a severely hot day. It rained a fire upon them that burned them. The day they were destroyed was an extremely horrific day.

translation: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe.
sentence: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in the aforementioned i.e. the destruction of the people of Shu‘ayb, is a lesson for those who take heed. Although most of them do not believe; they were rejecters.

translation: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
sentence: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord is the almighty who takes retribution from His enemies, yet merciful to those of them who repent.

translation: And this (Qur'an) is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds,
sentence: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, this Qur’ān that was revealed to Muhammad (peace be upon him), was revealed by the Lord of all creation.

translation: Which the trusted spirit descended with
sentence: نَزَلَ بِهِ ٱلرُّوحُ ٱلْأَمِينُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It was revealed through the trustworthy Gabriel (peace be upon him).

translation: To (communicate) to your heart that you may be a warner
sentence: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنذِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! He revealed it upon your heart so that you become one of the Messengers who warn the people and make them fearful of the punishment of Allah.

translation: In eloquent Arabic.
sentence: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِىٍّ مُّبِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He revealed it in clear Arabic language.

translation: This is (indicated) in the Books of earlier people.
sentence: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَفِى زُبُرِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed this Qur’ān has been referenced in the previous Books; the previous divine books have given glad tidings of it.

translation: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of Israel knew about this?
sentence: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Was it not a sign of your truthfulness for these people who reject you, that the scholars of the Israelites like Abdullah bin Salām, knew the reality of what has been revealed to you?

translation: Had We revealed it to a man of obscure tongue
sentence: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ ٱلْأَعْجَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Had we revealed this Qur’ān upon one of the non-Arabs who do not speak Arabic.

translation: And he had recited it to them, and they had not believed (it would have been different).
sentence: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And then they were to read it to them, they would not become believers, because they would say, “I do not understand it!” So they should praise Allah that it was revealed in their language.

translation: Thus do We cause (unbelief) to enter the hearts of sinners.
sentence: كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكْنَٰهُ فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Likewise, we placed rejection and disbelief in the hearts of the criminals because of their wrongdoing.

translation: They will not believe it until they behold the painful punishment.
sentence: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They do not change from the state of disbelief they are in, and will not believe until they see the painful punishment.

translation: It will come upon them unawares, and they will not comprehend it.
sentence: فَيَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This punishment will come to them suddenly and unexpectedly.

translation: Then will they say: "Can we be given respite?"
sentence: فَيَقُولُوا۟ هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when the punishment will come upon them suddenly, they will say out of immense grief, “Will we be given respite to repent to Allah?”

translation: Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?
sentence: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do these disbelievers seek our punishment hastily, saying, “We will never believe in you until you cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces, just as you claim it will.”

translation: Just think: If We let them enjoy (the good things of life) for a few years more,
sentence: أَفَرَءَيْتَ إِن مَّتَّعْنَٰهُمْ سِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 206. O Messenger! So tell me, How will it if I was to let these disbelievers enjoy the bounties for a lengthy period of time and then the punishment they were promised came to them after that period of enjoyment.

translation: And then what they were promised comes upon them,
sentence: ثُمَّ جَآءَهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 206. O Messenger! So tell me, How will it if I was to let these disbelievers enjoy the bounties for a lengthy period of time and then the punishment they were promised came to them after that period of enjoyment.

translation: Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them?
sentence: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What worldly bounties which they were enjoying, would benefit them? Verily, those bounties would have finished, and they will not be of any use.

translation: Never have We destroyed a habitation till We had sent admonishers to them
sentence: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I did not destroy any nation except they were warned by sending messengers to them and revealing books.

translation: To warn. For We are never unjust.
sentence: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which served as admonitions and warnings for them. I was not oppressive by punishing them after establishing an excuse, by sending them Messengers and books.

translation: The devils did not bring it down:
sentence: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The satans did not come down with this Qur’ān upon the heart of Muhammad (peace be upon him);

translation: They are not worthy of it, nor have they power.
sentence: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: it is permissible that they come down with it onto his heart. They are not even capable of doing that.

translation: They have been precluded from hearing it.
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are incapable of doing so because they have been cut off from its place in the heavens, so how could they reach it and then bring it down?

translation: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment;
sentence: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So do not worship any deity with Allah and ascribe it to Him. Otherwise, you will be one of those who shall be punished.

translation: And warn your near relations,
sentence: وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ ٱلْأَقْرَبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Warn your closest relatives from your people, in order of strength in relationship, lest the punishment of Allah does not afflict them if they remain upon idolatry.

translation: And take those believers under your wing who follow you.
sentence: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And be kind in action and speech, out of mercy and gentleness, to those believers who follow you.

translation: If they do not obey you, tell them: "I am not responsible for what you do."
sentence: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: If they disobey you and do not accept proclaiming the oneness of Allah and His obedience you command them with, then say to them, “I proclaim innocence from the idolatry and sins you commit.”

translation: Have trust in the Mighty, the Merciful,
sentence: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And place your reliance in all your affairs upon the Almighty who takes retribution from His enemies and is merciful to whoever repents to Him from them.

translation: Who watches you when you get up,
sentence: ٱلَّذِى يَرَىٰكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The being, may He be glorified, who sees you when you stand towards prayer.

translation: And your movements among those who bow in homage to God.
sentence: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِى ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He sees you changing from posture to posture among those who pray. Nothing is hidden from Him, neither any action you undertake, nor anyone else undertakes.

translation: He is all-hearing and all-knowing.
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, He is the hearer of the Qur’ān you recite and remembrance you do in your prayer, knower of your intention.

translation: Should I tell you on whom the devils descend?
sentence: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Shall I inform you who the satans actually come down to, as you have claimed that they come down with the Qur’ān?”

translation: They come down to every mendacious sinner,
sentence: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “They come down to every fortune-teller, who is a perpetual liar, sinner and disobeyer.”

translation: Who listens to you (for spreading rumours); but most of them are liars.
sentence: يُلْقُونَ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَٰذِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “The satans eavesdrop on the exalted assembly of angels and then convey that information to their fortune-teller friends. The majority of fortune tellers are liars; if they are truthful in one statement, they tell a hundred lies with it.

translation: As for the poets, only those who go astray follow them.
sentence: وَٱلشُّعَرَآءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ ٱلْغَاوُۥنَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And as for the poets that you claim Muhammad (peace be upon him) is from, those deviant from the path of guidance and steadfastness follow them and relate whatever poetry they say.

translation: Have you not seen that they wander distract in every valley,
sentence: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Do you not see that one of the manifestations of their errors is that they wander around in all the valleys, sometimes immersed in praise, sometimes in criticism, and many times in other issues!

translation: And they say what they do not do,
sentence: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed they lie, saying, “I did such and such”, while they did not actually do it.

translation: Except those who believe and do the right, and remember God a great deal, who retaliate only when they have been wronged. Yet the oppressors will now come to know through what reversals they will be overthrown!
sentence: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for those poets who have faith, perform good deeds, remember Allah abundantly and take retribution from the enemies of Allah after they have oppressed, like Hassān bin Thābit may Allah be pleased with him. Those who committed wrong by ascribing partners to Allah and showing hostility to His servants, will soon know what their place of return will be: they will return to a great place and a meticulous accounting.

translation: TA SIN. THESE are the verses of the Qur'an, and collection of explicit laws,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ طسٓ تِلْكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَكِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Ta Sin. These are the verses of the Qur’ān and a clear book. The discussion on similar letters has passed in the beginning of Sūrah Al-Baqarah. These verses which are revealed to you are verses of the Qur’ān and a clear book in which there is no confusion. Whoever ponders upon it will know that it is from Allah.

translation: A guidance and good tidings for the believers,
sentence: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These verses guide to the truth and direct towards it, and give glad-tidings to those who bring faith in Allah and His Messengers.

translation: Who fulfil their devotional obligations, pay the zakat, and believe with certainty in the life to come.
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْءَاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who perform prayer in the most complete manner and give Zakat of their wealth by spending it on its recipients, and they are convinced of the reward and punishment in the afterlife.

translation: We make their deeds attractive to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, so that they may wander in perplexity.
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْءَاخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The disbelievers who do not bring faith in the afterlife and the reward and punishment therein - I adorned their bad deeds for them so they continued in doing them, thus they are confused without finding their way towards what is right or guidance.

translation: They are those who will suffer the worst chastisement in this life, and will be the greatest losers in the life to come.
sentence: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Such people will suffer in the worldly life through trials and humiliation and in the Hereafter they suffer the greatest loss, losing themselves and their families on the Day of Judgement and entering Hell forever.

translation: You have been conveyed the Qur'an from One all-wise and all-knowing.
sentence: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger, you are receiving this Qur’ān which is being revealed to you from one who is Wise in His creating, managing and legislating, and Knowing, with nothing of the interests of His servants being hidden from Him.

translation: (Remember) when Moses said to his family: "I see a fire. I shall bring you news from it, or bring an ember that you may warm yourselves."
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِۦٓ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًا سَـَٔاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ ءَاتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember, O Messenger, when Moses said to his family: “I have seen a fire. I shall bring some news from it, from the person who lit it to guide us towards the path, or I shall I bring you a flame of fire taken from it, in the hope that you will light a fire from it to warm yourselves from the cold”.

translation: But when he reached it, a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِىَ أَنۢ بُورِكَ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then when he reached the place of the fire that he saw, Allah called unto him that the one in the fire and the angels surrounding it are blessed.

translation: O Moses, I am that God, the mighty and all-wise.
sentence: يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah said to him: “O Moses, it is I, Allah, the Mighty whom nobody can overpower, Wise in My creating, managing and legislating.

translation: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent he turned his back and fled without turning (to look). "O Moses," (said the voice), "be not fearful. Surely those sent as messengers do not fear in My presence,
sentence: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ يَٰمُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّى لَا يَخَافُ لَدَىَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And throw down your staff”. Moses obeyed. Then when Moses saw it moving and shaking like a snake, he fled turning his back to it and did not return. So Allah said to him: “Do not be scared of it. The Messengers do not fear snakes or anything else in my presence.

translation: Except those who do some wrong but afterwards do good to make up for the wrong. And I am forgiving and merciful.
sentence: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًۢا بَعْدَ سُوٓءٍ فَإِنِّى غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: However, whoever wrongs himself by committing a sin, then repents after that, I am Forgiving to him, Merciful to him.

translation: Put your hand in the bosom of your shirt; it will come out white without any blemish. This will be one of nine tokens for the Pharaoh and his people, who are a wicked lot indeed."
sentence: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍ فِى تِسْعِ ءَايَٰتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا فَٰسِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And put your hand in the opening of your shirt; it will come out after entering it white like snow without being due to leprosy, as part of nine signs which testify to your truthfulness.
