So ask the disbelievers who reject the resurrection: “Are you harder to create, and greater in form than other things that Allah has created from the heavens, the earth and the angels?” Indeed, Allah created them from sticky clay, so how could they deny the resurrection when they were created from such a weak substance?

translation: Yet while you are filled with wonder, they just scoff;
sentence: بَلْ عَجِبْتَ وَيَسْخَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Muhammad! You are amazed at the power of Allah and His management of the affairs of His creation; you are astonished at the idolaters rejecting the resurrection. While these idolaters mock at what you say regarding the resurrection, due to their extreme denial of it.

translation: And when they are warned they pay no heed.
sentence: وَإِذَا ذُكِّرُوا۟ لَا يَذْكُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: If these idolaters were to be advised with any advice, they would not take heed from it and would not benefit, because of their hard-heartedness.

translation: When they see a sign, they laugh at it,
sentence: وَإِذَا رَأَوْا۟ ءَايَةً يَسْتَسْخِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And when they witness a miracle from the miracles of the Prophet (peace be upon him) that prove his truthfulness, they exaggerate in showing astonishment and mocking it.

translation: And say: "This is only magic.
sentence: وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they say, “This thing that Muhammad has brought is nothing but clear sorcery.”

translation: When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, how can we be raised again,
sentence: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So when we die and become dust and decomposed, crumbling bones, will we be resurrected alive after that? That is indeed, far-fetched.”

translation: And our fathers too?"
sentence: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Will our ancient forefathers who dies before us also be resurrected?”

translation: You say: "Yes; and you will be lowly made."
sentence: قُلْ نَعَمْ وَأَنتُمْ دَٰخِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Muhammad! Say to them in reply: “Yes, you shall be resurrected after you have turned into dust and decomposed bones, and your forefathers will also be resurrected; you will all be resurrected in the condition that you are in a despised and humiliating state.”

translation: There will only be a single jerk, and they will gape,
sentence: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will only be one blow of the trumpet (the second blowing), and suddenly they will all be looking at the horrors of the Day of Judgement, awaiting what Allah will do with them.

translation: And say: "Ah woe! This is the Day of Reckoning."
sentence: وَقَالُوا۟ يَٰوَيْلَنَا هَٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The idolaters who reject the resurrection say, “May we be doomed! This is the Day of Requital on which Allah will requite His servants for whatever deeds they sent forth in their worldly life!”

translation: "(Yes,) this is the Day of Judgement you had called a lie."
sentence: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said to them: “This is the Day of Judgement between the servants, which you used to deny and reject in the world!”

translation: Gather all the wicked together and their comrades, and those they had worshipped
sentence: ٱحْشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزْوَٰجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that day, it will be said to the angels, “Gather the idolaters and their like, who wronged due to their ascribing partners with Allah; all those who followed them in rejection, and all the idols they used to worship instead of Allah. And show them all the path to the hellfire; lead them on to it and drive them towards it, because it is their abode.”

translation: Other than God," (the angels will be told), "then show them the way to Hell,
sentence: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that day, it will be said to the angels, “Gather the idolaters and their like, who wronged due to their ascribing partners with Allah; all those who followed them in rejection, and all the idols they used to worship instead of Allah. And show them all the path to the hellfire; lead them on to it and drive them towards it, because it is their abode.”

translation: And detain them, for they will be questioned."
sentence: وَقِفُوهُمْ إِنَّهُم مَّسْـُٔولُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And hold them back for a while before entering them into the hellfire for them to give account, because they are to be questioned. Then after that, drive them towards the hellfire.”

translation: "What is the matter with you that you do not help each other?"
sentence: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنَاصَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And it will be said to them in rebuke, “What is the matter with you that you are not helping each other like you used to in the world, and you used to claim that your idols would help you?”

translation: They will submit to questioning then,
sentence: بَلْ هُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ مُسْتَسْلِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Rather, today they are submissive to the command of Allah and humiliated, they will not help each other because of their incapability to do so, and because of their lack of strategies.

translation: And some of them will confront the others,
sentence: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they will turn to each other blaming each other and arguing, when shifting the blame and arguing will be of no use.

translation: Saying: "It were you who imposed yourselves upon us."
sentence: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The followers will say to the leaders, “O our seniors! You use to approach us in matters of religion and truth, and would beautify for us disbelief, ascribing partners with Allah and sins, while scaring us away from the truth that the messengers brought from Allah.”

translation: They will say: "No, you were the ones who would not believe.
sentence: قَالُوا۟ بَل لَّمْ تَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The leaders will say to the followers: “The matter is not as you claim it is. Rather, you yourselves were upon disbelief and were not believers; you were the rejectors.”

translation: We had no power over you. In fact, you were a people rebellious.
sentence: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَٰنٍۭ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَٰغِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O followers! We had no power or authority over you such that we cause you to disbelieve, ascribe partners with Allah or commit sins. Rather, you were people who transgressed the limit in disbelief and deviance yourselves; we were not the ones who led you astray.”

translation: The sentence of our Lord has come true for us. We have certainly to taste (the punishment),
sentence: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So the promise of Allah is now imposing on us and on you, when He said, “I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together.” (Ṣād: 85), and because of that we are inevitably going to taste whatever our Lord has promised.”

translation: For we had led you astray. In fact we ourselves were astray."
sentence: فَأَغْوَيْنَٰكُمْ إِنَّا كُنَّا غَٰوِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “So we called you towards deviance and disbelief; we had deviated from the path of guidance, but all you did was that you followed us because of your disposition to incline towards disbelief and deviance.”

translation: So, they will become partners in punishment.
sentence: فَإِنَّهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So the followers and the leaders will share in the punishment on the Day of Judgement; none will benefit the other in any way because they were all partners in deviance and disbelief in the world.

translation: That is how We deal with sinners.
sentence: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, just as I did with these people by making them taste the punishment, I will do the same with other criminals by joining the followers and leaders in the punishment, each in proportion to whatever they deserve of it.

translation: They were those who, when it was said to them, "There is no god but God," behaved with insolence,
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, these idolaters, when it would be said to them in the world, “There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah” so that they could act upon its requirements and leave everything that contradicted it, they would reject answering the call to it and submitting to it out of arrogance from the truth and showing haughtiness to it.

translation: And said: "Should we abandon our gods for the sake of an insane poet?"
sentence: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they would say, justifying their disbelief: “Should we leave the worship of our idols because of the words of a mad poet?” intending through this statement of theirs: the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him).

translation: Not in the least. He has brought the truth and confirmed the other messengers.
sentence: بَلْ جَآءَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, they have spoken a grave lie, because the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was not a madman nor a poet; he brought the Qur’ān which calls towards the oneness of Allah and towards following His Messenger. He corroborated the message of monotheism and affirmation of the afterlife the messengers brought from Allah; he did not contradict them in anything.

translation: You will indeed taste a painful punishment,
sentence: إِنَّكُمْ لَذَآئِقُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلْأَلِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O idolaters! You are surely going to suffer the painful punishment on the Day of Judgement due to your disbelief and rejection of the messengers.

translation: And be rewarded but only for what you had done,
sentence: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O idolaters! Your requital will only be for the disbelief and sins you used to commit in the world.

translation: Except the chosen creatures of God,
sentence: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: However, the believing servants of Allah whom Allah chose for His worship, and they sincerely devoted worship to Him, will be in a place of safety from this punishment.

translation: Whose provision is predetermined --
sentence: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ رِزْقٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For those sincere servants will be a special provision granted to them by Allah, well-known for its purity, beauty and eternity.

translation: Fruits of every kind, and they will be honoured
sentence: فَوَٰكِهُ وَهُم مُّكْرَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: From this special provision will be that they are provided with the purest of fruits they ever eat and desire; on top of that they will be honoured with their ranks being raised and being able to see the blessed face of Allah.

translation: In gardens of delight,
sentence: فِى جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: All that they will get in the permanent gardens of everlasting bliss, which will never expire or cease to exist.

translation: (Sitting) on couches, face to face,
sentence: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَٰبِلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will lean on thrones opposite to and facing one another; each one happy to meet his brother.

translation: With cups from a flowing stream being passed around,
sentence: يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِكَأْسٍ مِّن مَّعِينٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Glasses of wine, clear like flowing water, shall be passed around them.

translation: Clear, delicious to drink,
sentence: بَيْضَآءَ لَذَّةٍ لِّلشَّٰرِبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: White in colour, whoever drinks from it will enjoy a complete sensation.

translation: Neither dulling the senses nor intoxicating,
sentence: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will not be like the wine of the world; there will be no intoxication that clouds the minds, nor will it give its drinkers headaches. The bodies and minds of its drinkers will remain safe.

translation: And with them maidens of modest look and large lustrous eyes,
sentence: وَعِندَهُمْ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرْفِ عِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In Paradise, they will also have chaste wives with beautiful eyes, who will not longingly look towards anyone other than their husbands.

translation: Like sheltered eggs in a nest.
sentence: كَأَنَّهُنَّ بَيْضٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In their white complexation blended with a tinge of redness, it will be as if they were ostrich eggs covered by feathers from the wind and dust; protected and untouched by any hand.

translation: Then one turned to the other in an enquiry.
sentence: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of Paradise will turn to one another asking about their past, and what happened to them in the world.

translation: Said one of the speakers: "I had a friend
sentence: قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّى كَانَ لِى قَرِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: One of the believers will say, “Indeed, I had a companion in the world who would deny the resurrection.”

translation: Who used to say: 'Are you one of those who can testify to the truth?
sentence: يَقُولُ أَءِنَّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُصَدِّقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He would say to me in denial and mockingly, “O my friend! Are you one of those who believe in the resurrection of the dead?”

translation: (Do you think) we would be paid back our due when we are dead and reduced to dust and bones?'
sentence: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “When we die and turn into dust and decayed bones, will we then be resurrected and requited for our deeds we did in the world?”

translation: He said: 'Will you look down?'
sentence: قَالَ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّطَّلِعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His believing companion will say to his companions of the people of Paradise: “Take a look with me; let us see the outcome of that companion of mine who used to deny the resurrection.”

translation: He looked down and saw (his friend) in the midst of Hell.
sentence: فَٱطَّلَعَ فَرَءَاهُ فِى سَوَآءِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So he will take a look and see his companion in the middle of hell.

translation: 'By God', he said, 'you had almost ruined me.
sentence: قَالَ تَٱللَّهِ إِن كِدتَّ لَتُرْدِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He will say: “O my companion! By Allah, you were close to dooming me to the hellfire by calling me towards disbelief and denying the resurrection!”

translation: Had it not been for the grace of my Lord I too would have been there (in Hell).
sentence: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Had it not been for Allah blessing me with guidance to faith and the ability to accept it, I would have been one of those brought to the punishment like you.”

translation: (Another will say:)"Is it true, we are not going to die
sentence: أَفَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَيِّتِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “We, the people of Paradise, will never die.”

translation: Other than our first death, and we shall not be punished?
sentence: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Except the first death of ours in the world. Instead, we will live forever in Paradise and will not be punished like the disbelievers will be.”

translation: This will indeed be great happiness.
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, this requital of ours which our Lord has given us, i.e entry into Paradise, living in it forever and salvation from the hellfire, is the greatest, unparallelled success.”

translation: For this the toilers should strive."
sentence: لِمِثْلِ هَٰذَا فَلْيَعْمَلِ ٱلْعَٰمِلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is for requital like this the workers should strive for, because this is the profitable trade.

translation: Is this better or the tree of Zaqqum
sentence: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Is that aforementioned bounty which Allah has prepared for His servants whom He chose to obey Him, better and more virtuous in rank and honour, than the tree of Zaqqūm which has been cursed in the Qur’ān? It is the food of the disbelievers, which neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.

translation: Which We have reserved as punishment for evil-doers?
sentence: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَٰهَا فِتْنَةً لِّلظَّٰلِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have made this tree a trial, with which those who do wrong through disbelief and sins are tested, when they say: “Indeed, fire consumes trees, so it is impossible that it grows in the hellfire.”

translation: It is a tree that grows at the bottom of Hell.
sentence: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِىٓ أَصْلِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the tree of Zaqqūm is a disgusting tree, and is one that comes out of the depth of hell.

translation: Its spathes are like the prickly pear.
sentence: طَلْعُهَا كَأَنَّهُۥ رُءُوسُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The fruits that come out of it are ugly in appearance, like the heads of satans. The ugliness in appearance is a sign of ugliness in nature, which means they revolting in taste.

translation: They will eat and fill their bellies with it,
sentence: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَءَاكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the disbelievers will eat from its bitter, ugly fruits, and fill their empty bellies with them.

translation: Washing it down with boiling water.
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, after having eaten them, they will have a disgusting, boiling cocktail to drink.

translation: Then to Hell they will surely be returned.
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرْجِعَهُمْ لَإِلَى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, their return after that will be to the punishment of hell; they will move from one punishment to another.

translation: They had found their fathers astray,
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ أَلْفَوْا۟ ءَابَآءَهُمْ ضَآلِّينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, these disbelievers found their forefathers astray from the path of guidance and followed them blindly without proof of their truth.

translation: Yet they hasten to follow in their footsteps.
sentence: فَهُمْ عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَٰرِهِمْ يُهْرَعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So they hastily followed the footsteps of their forefathers in deviance, as if they were harassed and forced into doing so.

translation: So had many an earlier people gone astray,
sentence: وَلَقَدْ ضَلَّ قَبْلَهُمْ أَكْثَرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, the majority of people before them also went astray. So O Messenger, those to whom you have been sent are not the first to go astray.

translation: And We had sent admonishers to them.
sentence: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِم مُّنذِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, I sent to the previous nations messengers who would warn them of the punishment of Allah, but they disbelieved.

translation: Look, then how was the end of those who had been warned,
sentence: فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! See what the outcome was of the nations who were warned by their messengers but did not accept their warning! Indeed, their outcome was entering into the hellfire having to live in it forever due to their disbelief and rejection of their messengers.

translation: Other than the chosen creatures of God.
sentence: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for those whom Allah chose to believe in Him and His oneness; they were saved from the punishment which was the outcome of the disbelieving rejectors.

translation: Noah had verily called to Us. And how gracious was He who answered (him).
sentence: وَلَقَدْ نَادَىٰنَا نُوحٌ فَلَنِعْمَ ٱلْمُجِيبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, My Prophet Noah (peace be upon him) called out to Me when he supplicated against his people who had rejected him. I am the best of answerers; I quickly answered his supplication against his people.

translation: We saved him and his family from the great affliction,
sentence: وَنَجَّيْنَٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْكَرْبِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I saved him, together with members of his household and the believers with him from the harm of his people and from drowning in the great flood, which was sent upon the disbelievers from his people.

translation: And made his progeny survive,
sentence: وَجَعَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُۥ هُمُ ٱلْبَاقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I saved his family members and his believing followers only, because I drowned the others from his disbelieving nation.

translation: And left (his name) for posterity.
sentence: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I left a good legacy for him in the nations that would come after, who would praise Noah and always mention him with good.

translation: Peace on Noah among all men.
sentence: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ نُوحٍ فِى ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is a security and safety for Noah from the following nations saying evil regarding him. Instead, praise and positive mention of him will remain.

translation: That is how We reward those who do good.
sentence: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, I grant those who do good through their worship and obedience to Me alone, the same type of reward I granted to Noah.

translation: Surely he was among Our faithful creatures.
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Noah was definitely one of My servants who believed and acted according to My obedience.

translation: Afterwards We drowned the others.
sentence: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, I drowned the rest by the flood I sent upon them. None of them remained.

translation: And Abraham indeed was of his inducement,
sentence: وَإِنَّ مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ لَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, Abraham was someone on the same religion as Noah, and he also called to the Oneness of Allah.

translation: When he came to his Lord with a heart compliant,
sentence: إِذْ جَآءَ رَبَّهُۥ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember when he came to his Lord with a heart pure from ascribing partners to Allah and from doubts, full of sincerity to Allah only wanted good for the creation.

translation: When he said to his father and his people: "What is this you worship?
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When he said to his father and his idolatrous nation, rebuking them, “What do you worship instead of Allah?”

translation: Why do you solicit false gods instead of God?
sentence: أَئِفْكًا ءَالِهَةً دُونَ ٱللَّهِ تُرِيدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O my people, do you prefer to worship idols besides Allah basing your worship on a completely fabricated lie?”

translation: What do you imagine the Lord of the worlds to be?"
sentence: فَمَا ظَنُّكُم بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O my people! What do you think will happen when you meet the Lord of the worlds, while you used to worship things other than Him? What do you think He will do to you?”

translation: Then he looked up at the stars (they worshipped),
sentence: فَنَظَرَ نَظْرَةً فِى ٱلنُّجُومِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Abraham took a glance at the stars, hatching a plan to come out of having to go out with his people.

translation: And said: "I am sick (of what you worship)!"
sentence: فَقَالَ إِنِّى سَقِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He said, presenting an excuse from having to go with his people to their festival, “I am sick.”

translation: But they turned their backs on him and went away.
sentence: فَتَوَلَّوْا۟ عَنْهُ مُدْبِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So they left him behind and went.

translation: Then he turned towards their gods and said: "Why do you not eat (of these offerings)?
sentence: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He turned towards the idols they would worship instead of Allah, and said mocking them, “Will you not eat from the food the idolaters make for you?”

translation: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?"
sentence: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَنطِقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “What is the matter with you that you do not speak, nor answer whoever asks you? Can this type of thing be worshipped instead of Allah?”

translation: Then he started striking them down with his right hand.
sentence: فَرَاغَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضَرْبًۢا بِٱلْيَمِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, Abraham started hitting them with his right hand, intending to break them.

translation: So the people descended upon him.
sentence: فَأَقْبَلُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِ يَزِفُّونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So the worshippers of these idols came rushing to him.

translation: "Why do you worship these you carve yourselves," he asked,
sentence: قَالَ أَتَعْبُدُونَ مَا تَنْحِتُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But Abraham countered them with steadfastness, and said to them rebuking them, “Do you worship idols instead of Allah, which you carve with your own hands?”

translation: "When God has created you and what you make?"
sentence: وَٱللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ وَمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “While Allah (may He be glorified) is the one who created your bodies and your actions; the making of these idols are also from your actions, so He is most deserving that you worship Him alone and not ascribe partners with Him.

translation: "Build a pyre for him and throw him into the raging fire."
sentence: قَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنْيَٰنًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When they became speechless to his clear reasoning they resorted to violence, and consulted with each other about what they should do with Abraham. They said, “Build a structure from him, fill it with firewood and set it on fire, then throw him into it.”

translation: So they contrived a plot against him, but We made them abject.
sentence: فَأَرَادُوا۟ بِهِۦ كَيْدًا فَجَعَلْنَٰهُمُ ٱلْأَسْفَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So the people of Abraham intended to do evil to Abraham by destroying him so they could be saved from him, but I made them the losers when I made the fire cool and safe for him.

translation: And he said: "I am going away to my Lord who will show me the way.
sentence: وَقَالَ إِنِّى ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Abraham said, “I am going to emigrate to my Lord and leave the city of my people so that I am able worship Him. My Lord will guide me to whatever is good for me in the world and the Hereafter.”

translation: (And he prayed:) "O Lord, grant me a righteous son."
sentence: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O my Lord! Grant me a pious child who will be a means of help for me and a substitute for me from my people in the wilderness.”

translation: So We gave him the good news of a clement son.
sentence: فَبَشَّرْنَٰهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ حَلِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I answered his supplication for him and gave him news which pleased him, when I gave him the good news of a child who would grow old and become forbearing. This child was Ishmael (peace be upon him).

translation: When he was old enough to go about with him, he said: "O my son, I dreamt that I was sacrificing you. Consider, what you think?" He replied: "Father, do as you are commanded. If God pleases you will find me firm."
sentence: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعْىَ قَالَ يَٰبُنَىَّ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ فِى ٱلْمَنَامِ أَنِّىٓ أَذْبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ قَالَ يَٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When Ishmael grew into a youth and reached working age, his father Abraham saw a dream. The dreams of prophets are a form of divine revelation, so Abraham said to his son, informing him of the meaning of this dream, “O my son! Indeed, I saw in my sleep that I am slaughtering you; what is your opinion in the matter?” Ishmael replied to him saying, “O my father! Do whatever Allah has commanded you to do in slaughtering me. You will find me one of those who are patient and content with the order of Allah.”

translation: When they submitted to the will of God, and (Abraham) laid (his son) down prostrate on his temple,
sentence: فَلَمَّآ أَسْلَمَا وَتَلَّهُۥ لِلْجَبِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when they submitted to Allah and obeyed him, Abraham laid his son down on his forehead, to carry out the order given to him to slaughter his son.

translation: We called out: "O Abraham,
sentence: وَنَٰدَيْنَٰهُ أَن يَٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I called out to Abraham while he was about to carry out the order of Allah to slaughter his son, saying: “O Abraham!”

translation: You have fulfilled your dream." Thus do We reward the good.
sentence: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ ٱلرُّءْيَآ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “You have fulfilled the dream you saw in your sleep by resolving to slaughter your son. Just as I rewarded you by freeing you of this great trial, I also reward those who do good by saving them from trials and difficulties.”

translation: That was indeed a trying test.
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْبَلَٰٓؤُا۟ ٱلْمُبِينُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, this was a clear test which Abraham passed.

translation: So We ransomed him for a great sacrifice,
sentence: وَفَدَيْنَٰهُ بِذِبْحٍ عَظِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I set Ishmael free in exchange for a huge ram which was to be slaughtered instead of him.

translation: And left (his hallowed memory) for posterity.
sentence: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I preserved good praise for Abraham to remain among the following nations.

translation: Peace be on Abraham.
sentence: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As a commemoration for Abraham from Allah, and a prayer to keep him safe from every harm and difficulty.

translation: That is how We reward those who do good.
sentence: كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Just as I requited Abraham with this reward for his obedience, I also reward those who do good.

translation: He is truly among Our faithful creatures.
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, Abraham was one of My believing servants who fulfilled the demands of his servitude to Me.

translation: So We gave him the good news of Isaac, apostle, who is among the righteous.
sentence: وَبَشَّرْنَٰهُ بِإِسْحَٰقَ نَبِيًّا مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I gave him glad tidings of another son who would become a Prophet and a pious servant: he was Isaac. It was another reward for his obedience to Allah by resolving to slaughter his only son, Ishmael.

translation: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants are some who do good, but some who wrong themselves.
sentence: وَبَٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسْحَٰقَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ مُبِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I showered upon him and his son Isaac My special blessings and gave them both many bounties, from which one was an increase in offspring. There were those in their progeny who did good by obeying their Lord, and those who clearly wronged themselves by disbelief and committing sins.

translation: We were indeed gracious to Moses and Aaron,
sentence: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And verily I favoured Moses and his brother Aaron with messengership.

translation: And saved them and their people from great distress,
sentence: وَنَجَّيْنَٰهُمَا وَقَوْمَهُمَا مِنَ ٱلْكَرْبِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I saved them and their nation, the Israelites, from Pharaoh enslaving them and from drowning.

translation: And helped them, so they were victorious.
sentence: وَنَصَرْنَٰهُمْ فَكَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I also helped them against Pharaoh and his armies, so they had the upper hand over their enemies.

translation: We gave them the explicit Book,
sentence: وَءَاتَيْنَٰهُمَا ٱلْكِتَٰبَ ٱلْمُسْتَبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I gave Moses and his brother Aaron the Torah; a clear book from Allah in which there was no doubt.

translation: And showed them the straight path,
sentence: وَهَدَيْنَٰهُمَا ٱلصِّرَٰطَ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I also guided them towards the straight path in which there was no deviance. It was the path of the religion of Islam which led to the pleasure of the Creator (may He be glorified).

translation: And left (their remembrance) for posterity.
sentence: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِمَا فِى ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I also preserved for them positive mention and good praise among the following nations.

translation: Peace be on Moses and Aaron.
sentence: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As a commemoration from Allah for them, in praise of them and as a prayer for safety from every harm.

translation: That is how We reward those who do good.
sentence: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Just as I requited Moses and Aaron with this good reward, I also reward those who do good by obeying their Lord.

translation: They are among Our faithful devotees.
sentence: إِنَّهُمَا مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, Moses and Aaron were two of My servants who believed in me and strove to do that which I legislated for them.

translation: Verily Elias is one of the apostles.
sentence: وَإِنَّ إِلْيَاسَ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, Elias was one of the messengers sent by his Lord. He blessed him with messengership and prophethood.

translation: When he said to his people: "Will you not be mindful of God?
sentence: إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember when he said to his people whom he was sent towards from the Israelites, “O my people! Will you not fear Allah by fulfilling His commands, of which is monotheism, and refraining from the things He has not allowed, from which is ascribing partners with Him?”

translation: Would you call on Baal and leave the best of creators,
sentence: أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ ٱلْخَٰلِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Do you worship your idol Ba‘l instead of Allah and leave the worship of Allah who is the best of creators?”

translation: God, your Lord, and the Lord of your fathers?"
sentence: ٱللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ وَرَبَّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Allah is your lord who created you and created your forefathers before you; He is the most deserving of worship, not anything else like the idols which cannot benefit nor harm.”

translation: They denied him, and will surely be brought to punishment,
sentence: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The only response of his nation was that they rejected him, and because of their rejection they will be brought to the punishment.

translation: Except the chosen creatures of God.
sentence: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for those who were believers and devoted their worship to Allah alone; they will be saved from being brought to the punishment.

translation: And We left his (memory) for posterity.
sentence: وَتَرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I also preserved for him positive mention and good praise among the following nations.

translation: Peace be on Elias.
sentence: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰٓ إِلْ يَاسِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As a commemoration from Allah and praise for Elias.

translation: That is how We reward those who do good.
sentence: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Just as I requited Elias with this good reward, I also reward those of My believing servants who do good.

translation: He is truly among Our faithful devotees.
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, Elias was one of My true believing servants who are sincere in their belief in Me.

translation: Verily Lot was one of the apostles,
sentence: وَإِنَّ لُوطًا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, Lot was one of the messengers of Allah who were sent to their people as bearers of good news and warners.

translation: Wherefore We saved him and his entire family
sentence: إِذْ نَجَّيْنَٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ أَجْمَعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So remember when I saved him and members of his household from the punishment that was sent upon his people.

translation: Except an old woman who was one of those who stayed behind.
sentence: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِى ٱلْغَٰبِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for his wife, because she was a woman whom the punishment of her people included within it, due to her being a disbeliever like them.

translation: Then We destroyed the others.
sentence: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, I destroyed the remainder of his people who rejected him and did not believe in what he had brought.

translation: You pass by (their habitations) in the morning
sentence: وَإِنَّكُمْ لَتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيْهِم مُّصْبِحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people of Makkah! Indeed, you pass by their dwellings in you journeys towards the Levant in the morning.

translation: Or at night. Then how is it you do not understand?
sentence: وَبِٱلَّيْلِ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And likewise, you also pass by them at night. So do you not understand and take heed from the outcome of these people after they rejected, disbelieved and committed indecency, indecent behaviour, immorality, immoral behaviour, sexual indecency, sexual immortality which was unprecedented?

translation: Verily Jonah is one of the apostles.
sentence: وَإِنَّ يُونُسَ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, Jonah was one of the messengers of Allah who were sent to their people as bearers of good news and warners.

translation: When he fled on the laden ship,
sentence: إِذْ أَبَقَ إِلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember when he became angry over his people and left them, boarding a ship full of passengers and goods.

translation: And lots were cast (when a storm overtook them), he was rejected, (and thrown overboard).
sentence: فَسَاهَمَ فَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُدْحَضِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The ship was close to sinking because of its load, so the passengers drew lots to throw some of them overboard, fearing its sinking because of too many passengers. Jonah was one of the names that were drawn, and so they threw him in to the sea.

translation: Then he was swallowed by a large fish as he was worthy of blame.
sentence: فَٱلْتَقَمَهُ ٱلْحُوتُ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when they threw him into the sea, a whale took him and swallowed him. He was to face the blame that was to come to him, because of him going to the sea without permission from his Lord.

translation: Had he not been one of those who struggled hard,
sentence: فَلَوْلَآ أَنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَبِّحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Had it not been that Jonah was one of those who would remember Allah abundantly before whatever afflicted him, and had it not been for his glorifying Allah in the stomach of the whale

translation: He would have stayed in its belly till the day the dead are raised.
sentence: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: he would have remained in the stomach of the whale until the Day of Judgement, with it having become his grave.

translation: So We cast him, sick, on a barren shore,
sentence: فَنَبَذْنَٰهُ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ سَقِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I took him from the stomach of the whale and placed him on a land barren of trees and buildings, in the state that he was physically weak because of having stayed in the stomach of the whale for a while.

translation: And We made a gourd tree grow over him.
sentence: وَأَنۢبَتْنَا عَلَيْهِ شَجَرَةً مِّن يَقْطِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I then made a gourd tree grow for him on that barren earth, which would give him shade.

translation: We sent him to a hundred thousand men or more,
sentence: وَأَرْسَلْنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I sent him back to his people, their number being a hundred thousand and more.

translation: And they came to believe; so We allowed them to enjoy the good things of life for an age.
sentence: فَـَٔامَنُوا۟ فَمَتَّعْنَٰهُمْ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They brought faith and believed in whatever He brought, so Allah granted them enjoyment in their worldly lives until their fixed lifetimes expired.

translation: Now ask them if their Lord has daughters, and they sons?
sentence: فَٱسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَلِرَبِّكَ ٱلْبَنَاتُ وَلَهُمُ ٱلْبَنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Muhammad! So ask these idolaters, idolaters a rebuking question: “Do you attribute for Allah daughters which you yourselves dislike, while attributing sons for yourselves whom you love? What kind of distribution is this?”

translation: Or did We make the angels females, and they witnessed it?
sentence: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَٰثًا وَهُمْ شَٰهِدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: How could they claim the angels are female when they were not present at the time of their creation and did not witness it?

translation: Is it not a lie invented by them when they say:
sentence: أَلَآ إِنَّهُم مِّنْ إِفْكِهِمْ لَيَقُولُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Listen carefully! Indeed, the idolaters, idolaters from their attributing lies unto Allah

translation: "God has begotten (children)?" They are liars indeed!
sentence: وَلَدَ ٱللَّهُ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَٰذِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: attribute offspring to Him, and indeed, they are liars in this claim of theirs.

translation: Does He prefer sons to daughters?
sentence: أَصْطَفَى ٱلْبَنَاتِ عَلَى ٱلْبَنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Would Allah prefer daughters for Himself which you dislike, over sons which you like? Never!

translation: What ails you that you judge in such a wise?
sentence: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O idolaters, what is wrong with you that you make this unjust judgment where you make daughters for Allah and sons for yourself?

translation: Why do you not reflect?
sentence: أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Would you not take admonition of this wrong belief you are on? If you were to take heed, you would stop saying such as statement.

translation: Or have you received some clear authority?
sentence: أَمْ لَكُمْ سُلْطَٰنٌ مُّبِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do you have a clear proof from a divine scripture or a messenger from Allah?

translation: Then bring your scripture, if what you say is true.
sentence: فَأْتُوا۟ بِكِتَٰبِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then bring your book which bears for you evidence of this if you are true in what you claim.

translation: They link Him with jinns by lineage, yet the jinns know they will be brought before Him.
sentence: وَجَعَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُۥ وَبَيْنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ ٱلْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the idolaters made blood ties between Allah and the angels when they claimed the angels are Allah’s daughters and their mothers are the elite jinns. But the jinns already know Allah will bring them to be reckoned, so if there was lineage between Him and them he would not bring them for that.

translation: God is too glorious for what they ascribe to Him
sentence: سُبْحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pure is Allah and exalted from what the idolaters describe Him with of that which does not befit Him, such as children, partners.

translation: Except His chosen creatures who do not.
sentence: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except Allah’s chosen servants, as they do not describe Allah except with the qualities of majesty and perfection which are befitting for Him.

translation: So neither you nor those you worship
sentence: فَإِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So you, O idolaters, and what you worship besides Allah.

translation: Can mislead anyone away from Him,
sentence: مَآ أَنتُمْ عَلَيْهِ بِفَٰتِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You cannot misguide anyone from the true religion.

translation: Except one who is (destined) to burn in Hell.
sentence: إِلَّا مَنْ هُوَ صَالِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except one whom Allah has decreed is from the people of hell, as Allah will carry out His decree regarding him and so he will disbelieve and enter the fire. As for you and your gods, you do not have power over that.

translation: "There is not one of us who does not have his appointed place," (declare the angels.)
sentence: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the angels said, stating their servitude to Allah and their being free of what the idolaters claimed: “There is nobody amongst us except that he has a known position in Allah’s worship and obedience.

translation: "And we are truly those who stand in rows,
sentence: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلصَّآفُّونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And we declare Him pure of qualities and descriptions which do not befit Him”.

translation: And we are those who sing hallelujas to Him."
sentence: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْمُسَبِّحُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And we declare Him pure of qualities and descriptions which do not befit Him”.

translation: They used to say:
sentence: وَإِن كَانُوا۟ لَيَقُولُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 170. And the idolaters from the people of Makkah used to say before Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent: “If we had a book of the previous people, such as the Torah for example, we would have worshipped Allah sincerely”. But they are lying in that, as Muhammad (peace be upon him) brought them the Qur’ān but they disbelieved in it. So soon they will know the severe punishment that is waiting for them on the day of judgment.

translation: If we had the account of earlier people with us,
sentence: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 170. And the idolaters from the people of Makkah used to say before Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent: “If we had a book of the previous people, such as the Torah for example, we would have worshipped Allah sincerely”. But they are lying in that, as Muhammad (peace be upon him) brought them the Qur’ān but they disbelieved in it. So soon they will know the severe punishment that is waiting for them on the day of judgment.

translation: We would have been the chosen creatures of God."
sentence: لَكُنَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 170. And the idolaters from the people of Makkah used to say before Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent: “If we had a book of the previous people, such as the Torah for example, we would have worshipped Allah sincerely”. But they are lying in that, as Muhammad (peace be upon him) brought them the Qur’ān but they disbelieved in it. So soon they will know the severe punishment that is waiting for them on the day of judgment.

translation: Yet now (that it has come) they refuse to believe in it; but they will come to know soon.
sentence: فَكَفَرُوا۟ بِهِۦ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: 170. And the idolaters from the people of Makkah used to say before Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent: “If we had a book of the previous people, such as the Torah for example, we would have worshipped Allah sincerely”. But they are lying in that, as Muhammad (peace be upon him) brought them the Qur’ān but they disbelieved in it. So soon they will know the severe punishment that is waiting for them on the day of judgment.

translation: Our word had already been given before to Our votaries, the apostles, --
sentence: وَلَقَدْ سَبَقَتْ كَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And victory is for My army which fights in My way, so that My word is the highest.

translation: That they would be helped,
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ لَهُمُ ٱلْمَنصُورُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And victory is for My army which fights in My way, so that My word is the highest.

translation: And that certainly Our armies will be victorious.
sentence: وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ ٱلْغَٰلِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And victory is for My army which fights in My way, so that My word is the highest.

translation: So you ignore them for a time
sentence: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So turn away, O Messenger, from these stubborn idolaters until a time which Allah knows, until the time of their punishment comes.

translation: And wait; they will come to know soon.
sentence: وَأَبْصِرْهُمْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And look at them when the punishment comes upon them, for they themselves will see when seeing will not benefit.

translation: Do they want to hasten Our punishment?
sentence: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then do these idolaters hastily seek the punishment of Allah?

translation: When it comes down on their plains, it will be an evil dawn for those who had been warned.
sentence: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then when Allah’s punishment comes upon them, what a bad morning will theirs be!

translation: So turn away from them for a time
sentence: وَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And turn away, O Messenger, from them when Allah decides their punishment.

translation: And watch; they will come to know soon.
sentence: وَأَبْصِرْ فَسَوْفَ يُبْصِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And look, for these people will see the punishment and punishment of Allah that comes upon them.

translation: Too glorious is your Lord, the Lord of power, for what they ascribe to Him.
sentence: سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Muhammad, exhalt your Lord declaring his glorification, the Lord of Honour, and exalt Him above the qualities of deficiency the idolaters describe Him with.

translation: So peace be on the messengers,
sentence: وَسَلَٰمٌ عَلَى ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Allah’s greetings and His praise be for His noble messengers.

translation: And all praise to God, the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: وَٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And all praise is for Allah, as He is deserving of it, and He is Lord of all the creation. They have no lord besides Him.

translation: SAD. I CALL to witness the admonishing Qur'an.
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ صٓ وَٱلْقُرْءَانِ ذِى ٱلذِّكْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Saad. By the Qur’ān containing reminder. The discussion on similar letters has already passed in the beginning of Sūrah Al-Baqarah. I swear by the Qur’ān which is full of admonition, reminding mankind that which benefits them in their worldly life and the Afterlife. The matter is not as the idolaters think, namely that Allah has partners beside Him.

translation: But the unbelievers are still full of pride and hostility.
sentence: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But the disbelievers are in fanaticism and arrogance towards the oneness of Allah, and in opposition to Muhammad (peace be upon him) and hatred for him.

translation: How many generations have We destroyed before them who cried (for mercy) when it was too late for escape.
sentence: كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن قَرْنٍ فَنَادَوا۟ وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: How many generations who denied their messengers before them have I destroyed, they called out seeking help when the punishment fell upon them. But the time was not the time to be saved from the punishment where seeking help from Him would benefit them.

translation: They were surprised that one of them had come to them as warner; and the unbelievers said: "He is a deceiving sorcerer.
sentence: وَعَجِبُوٓا۟ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ وَقَالَ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَٰحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they expressed surprise when a messenger came to them from themselves to warn them of Allah’s punishment if they remain in their disbelief. And the disbelievers said when they saw the proof for the truthfulness of what Muhammad (peace be upon him) brought: “This is a magician who performs magic on people, and a liar in claiming that he is a messenger from Allah who receives revelation.

translation: Has he turned so many gods into one deity? This is indeed a strange thing!"
sentence: أَجَعَلَ ٱلْءَالِهَةَ إِلَٰهًا وَٰحِدًا إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَىْءٌ عُجَابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Has he made the numerous gods into one God, besides whom there is no god? This act of his is extremely strange”.

translation: And their leading chiefs said: "Remain attached to your gods. There is surely some motive behind it.
sentence: وَٱنطَلَقَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ ٱمْشُوا۟ وَٱصْبِرُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِكُمْ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَىْءٌ يُرَادُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And their leaders and elders went, saying to their followers: “Carry on with what you are upon and do not enter the religion of Muhammad. Remain firm on worshipping your gods. That which Muhammad is calling you towards, namely worshipping one god, is something planned which he wants so that he can dominate over us and have followers for himself.

translation: We never heard of it in the former faith. It is surely a fabrication.
sentence: مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِى ٱلْمِلَّةِ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا ٱخْتِلَٰقٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We have not heard the oneness of Allah which Muhammad is calling us towards in what we found our fathers on nor in the religion of Jesus (peace be upon him). What we have heard from him is nothing but a lie and fabrication.

translation: To him of all of us has the Reminder been sent down?" They are still in doubt about My admonition; but they have not tasted My punishment yet!
sentence: أَءُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلذِّكْرُ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُمْ فِى شَكٍّ مِّن ذِكْرِى بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Is it right that the Qur’ān is revealed to him from amongst us and he is chosen for it, and it is not revealed to us whereas we are great leaders?” But these idolaters are in doubt about the revelation which is revealed to you. And they have not yet tasted the punishment of Allah, so they have been deceived due to their being given respite. If they were to taste it, they would not have the audacity to disbelieve in Allah and doubt what is revealed to you.

translation: Do they have the stores of the mercy of your Lord, the mighty and munificent?
sentence: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَآئِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْوَهَّابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do these denying idolaters have treasures of the grace of your Lord, the Mighty whom nobody can overpower, who gives what He wants to whom He wants? And from His treasures is prophethood, so He gives it to whom He wishes. It is not for them that they should give it to whom they want and stop it from whom they want.

translation: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, theirs? Then let them climb up the ladders (to the heavens).
sentence: أَمْ لَهُم مُّلْكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فَلْيَرْتَقُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَسْبَٰبِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they have the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and possession of everything therein so they may chose who to give it to? If this is what claim they are making then let them adopt the means to go up to the heavens so they can then rule how they wish from above the heavens in who should be given and who should be held back from.

translation: They will be one more army vanquished among the many routed hordes.
sentence: جُندٌ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِّنَ ٱلْأَحْزَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These deniers of Muhammad (peace be upon him) are a defeated army like the armies which came before them who denied their messengers and so I destroyed them. So that will occur with this army as occurred with others.

translation: Even before them the people of Noah, 'Ad, the mighty Pharoah,
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو ٱلْأَوْتَادِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These deniers are not the first to deny, because the people of Noah, Aad, and the powerful Pharaoh denied before them.

translation: And the Thamud, the people of Lot, as well as the dwellers of the Wood, had denied. These were the hordes.
sentence: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ وَأَصْحَٰبُ لْـَٔيْكَةِ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Thamud, the people of Lot and the people of Shu’ayb denied. Those are the groups who were all united in their denial of the messengers and disbelief of what they brought.

translation: Of all these there was not one who did not deny the messengers. So My retribution was justified.
sentence: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There is not a single one of these groups except that it denied the messengers. So Allah’s punishment was justified for them and His punishment befell them, even though it was delayed for a while.

translation: They await but a single blast which will not be repeated.
sentence: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These deniers of Muhammad (peace be upon him) are not waiting except for the second blowing of the Trumpet in which there shall be no return. Then the punishment will fall upon them if they had died in a state of denial.

translation: Still they say: "O Lord, give us our share before the Day of Reckoning."
sentence: وَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ ٱلْحِسَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they said mockingly: “Our Lord, give us our share of punishment in the worldly life before the day of judgment”.

translation: Bear with patience what they say, and remember Our votary David, man of strength. He surely turned to Us in penitence.
sentence: ٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُۥدَ ذَا ٱلْأَيْدِ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger, be patient on the things these deniers say which do not please you, and remember My servant David, who had the power to fight his enemies and persevere in Allah’s obedience. He used to turn to Allah frequently through repentance and actions which please Him.

translation: We subjugated the chiefs (of tribes) to struggle day and night with him,
sentence: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا ٱلْجِبَالَ مَعَهُۥ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ وَٱلْإِشْرَاقِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I subjugated the mountains with David. They would exalt with his exalting at the end of the day and its beginning at sunrise.

translation: And the levied Tair. They were all obedient to him.
sentence: وَٱلطَّيْرَ مَحْشُورَةً كُلٌّ لَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I subjugated the birds held in the air. Each of them was obedient, exalting out of following him.

translation: So We further strengthened his kingdom, and bestowed wisdom on him, and judgement in legal matters.
sentence: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُۥ وَءَاتَيْنَٰهُ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ ٱلْخِطَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I strengthened his kingdom through the awe, strength and help against his enemies I had given him. And I gave him prophethood and correctness in his affairs. And I gave him clear eloquence in every objective, and decisiveness in speech and wisdom.

translation: Have you heard of the litigants who jumped over the wall into his chamber?
sentence: وَهَلْ أَتَىٰكَ نَبَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا۟ ٱلْمِحْرَابَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger, has the news of the two disputants come to you, when they climbed upon the place of worship of David (peace be upon him)?

translation: When they came before David, he was frightened of them. "Do not be afraid," they said. "The two of us are disputing the wrong one has done the other. So judge between us with equity, and do not be unjust, and guide us to the right path.
sentence: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَىٰ دَاوُۥدَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَٱحْكُم بَيْنَنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَٱهْدِنَآ إِلَىٰ سَوَآءِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When they entered upon David suddenly, so he became frightened due to their strange act of entering upon him in this most unusual of ways. When they saw his fear, they said: “Do not fear. We are two disputants, one of us having wronged the other, so judge between us justly and do not be unjust when you judge between us, and guide us to the right path which is the path of correctness”.

translation: This man here is my brother. He has ninety and nine ewes while I have only one. He demands that I should give him my ewe, and wants to get the better of me in argument."
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذَآ أَخِى لَهُۥ تِسْعٌ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةً وَلِىَ نَعْجَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِى فِى ٱلْخِطَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: One of the disputants said to David (peace be upon him): “This man is my brother. He has ninety-nine ewes and I have one ewe. He asked me to give him that too and he has overpowered me in proof”.

translation: (David) said: "He is unjust in demanding your ewe to add to his (many) ewes. Many partners are surely -- unjust to one another, except those who believe and do the right; but there are only a few of them." It occurred to David that he was being tried by Us, and he begged his Lord to forgive him, and fell down in homage and repented.
sentence: قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِۦ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ ٱلْخُلَطَآءِ لَيَبْغِى بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَقَلِيلٌ مَّا هُمْ وَظَنَّ دَاوُۥدُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّٰهُ فَٱسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُۥ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًا وَأَنَابَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then David judged between them and addressed the claimant, saying: “Your brother has wronged you when he asked you to add your ewe to his ewes. And many partners oppress one another by taking their rights and not being fair, except the believers who do good actions, for they are fair with their partners and do not wrong them. But those attributed with that are few”. And David (peace be upon him) was convinced that I only put him to test through this dispute, so he sought forgiveness from his Lord and prostrated to get close to Him, and repented to Him.

translation: So We forgave him. He has surely a high rank with Us and an excellent place of return.
sentence: فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُۥ ذَٰلِكَ وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَـَٔابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I responded to him and forgave him that. And he is amongst the close ones with Me, and for him is a good return in the Afterlife.

translation: "O David, We have made you trustee on the earth. So judge between men equitably, and do not follow your lust lest it should lead you astray from the way of God. Surely for those who go astray from the way of God, is severe punishment, for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning.
sentence: يَٰدَاوُۥدُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَٰكَ خَلِيفَةً فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱحْكُم بَيْنَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌۢ بِمَا نَسُوا۟ يَوْمَ ٱلْحِسَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O David, I made you a deputy on earth to execute worldly and religious rulings and judgments, so judge between people with justice. And do not follow desires in your judgement between people, by inclining towards one of the disputants due to relationship or friendship, or by turning away from him due to enmity, whereby desires will misguide you from Allah’s straight path. Those who go astray from Allah’s straight path will have a severe punishment due to their forgetting the day of reckoning, because if they were to remember it and fear it they would not incline to their desires.

translation: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, all for nothing. Only those who deny imagine so. So for the unbelievers there is woe from the fire.
sentence: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَٰطِلًا ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلنَّارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I did not create the heavens or the earth in vain, but rather I created them out of complete wisdom to prove the power of Allah and so that He is obeyed in them. That is the belief of those who deny the truth who believe they were created in vain. So woe to these disbelievers who believe this from the fire of hell on the Day of Judgment, when they die on the disbelief and bad opinion of Allah they are upon.

translation: Should We equate those who do the right with those who spread corruption in the land? Should We make those who are morally integrated equal to those who seek disintegration?
sentence: أَمْ نَجْعَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ كَٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ كَٱلْفُجَّارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will never make those who believe in Allah, follow His messenger and do good deeds like those who make the corruption on earth through disbelief and sins, nor will I make those who are mindful of their Lord by carrying out His orders and refraining from His prohibitions like the disbelievers and hypocrites who are engrossed in sins. Making them both equal is an injustice which does not befit Allah. But rather Allah will reward the pious believers by entry into Paradise and punish the wretched disbelievers by entry into the fire, because they are not equal in Allah’s sight so their reward is not equal in His sight too.

translation: We have sent down a Book to you which is blessed, so that people may apply their minds to its revelations, and the men of wisdom may reflect.
sentence: كِتَٰبٌ أَنزَلْنَٰهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَٰرَكٌ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوٓا۟ ءَايَٰتِهِۦ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَٰبِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This Qur’ān is a book I revealed to you, O Prophet, abundant in good and benefit. I revealed it so that people ponder over its verses and contemplate its meanings, and so that the people of enlightened superior intellect take lessons from it.

translation: We bestowed Solomon on David who was an excellent devotee, for he turned to God in penitence.
sentence: وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُۥدَ سُلَيْمَٰنَ نِعْمَ ٱلْعَبْدُ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I granted David his son Solomon, as a favour from Me to him and a grace so that he is pleased. What an excellent servant Solomon was. He would abundantly repent and turn to Allah.

translation: When they brought fleet-footed chargers in the evening to show him,
sentence: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِٱلْعَشِىِّ ٱلصَّٰفِنَٰتُ ٱلْجِيَادُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember when at the time of Asr purebred fast horses were presented to him, standing on three feet with one foot raised. These purebred horses continued to be presented to him until sunset.

translation: He said: "The love of horses is worthy of desire to me for the remembrance of my Lord;" and when they were out of sight, (he said):
sentence: فَقَالَ إِنِّىٓ أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ ٱلْخَيْرِ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّى حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِٱلْحِجَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Solomon said: “I preferred love of wealth, these horses being part of it, over the remembrance of my Lord until the sun set.

translation: "Bring them back to me," and he began to rub and stroke their shanks and necks.
sentence: رُدُّوهَا عَلَىَّ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًۢا بِٱلسُّوقِ وَٱلْأَعْنَاقِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Return these horses to me”. So they returned them to him, then he began striking their legs and necks with his sword.

translation: We surely tried Solomon, and placed another body on his throne. So he turned to God
sentence: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَٰنَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِۦ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I tested Solomon and put on his chair part of a child, and that was when he swore by Allah that he will sleep with all of his wives and each one of them will bring forth a horseman to strive in Allah’s way. But he did not say in this oath of his: “if Allah wills”. So he slept with all of them, but none of them gave birth except one who gave birth to part of a child. Then Solomon repented to his Lord.

translation: Saying: "O Lord, forgive me, and give me such a dominion as none will merit after me. You are the great bestower."
sentence: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَهَبْ لِى مُلْكًا لَّا يَنۢبَغِى لِأَحَدٍ مِّنۢ بَعْدِىٓ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْوَهَّابُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Solomon said: “My Lord, forgive me my sins and grant me a kingdom especially for me which no person will have after me. My Lord, You give abundantly and are very generous”.

translation: So we subjugated the wind to his service which carried his merchandise wheresoever he wished;
sentence: فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ ٱلرِّيحَ تَجْرِى بِأَمْرِهِۦ رُخَآءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I responded to him and made the wind subservient to him. It would obey his order, gently. There was no shaking in it, despite its strength and its fast movement. It would carry him wherever he wanted.

translation: And the devils -- the builders and divers of all kinds,
sentence: وَٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ كُلَّ بَنَّآءٍ وَغَوَّاصٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I made the satans subservient to him, complying with his orders. Some of them were builders and others were divers who would dive into the seas and take out pearls from them.

translation: And many others bound in bond.
sentence: وَءَاخَرِينَ مُقَرَّنِينَ فِى ٱلْأَصْفَادِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And from the satans there were rebellious ones who were made subservient for him. They were tied up in shackles, unable to move.

translation: "This is Our gift," (We said to him), "so bestow freely or withhold without reckoning."
sentence: هَٰذَا عَطَآؤُنَا فَٱمْنُنْ أَوْ أَمْسِكْ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O Solomon, this is My gift which I granted you in response to what you asked of Me. So give whom you want and stop from whom you want, as I will not take you to account in your giving or holding back”.

translation: He has a high position with Us and an excellent abode.
sentence: وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَـَٔابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Solomon is amongst the close ones with us, and he has a good return which he will return to, and it is Paradise.

translation: Remember Our votary Job because he called to his Lord: "Satan has afflicted me with disease and distress."
sentence: وَٱذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَآ أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَسَّنِىَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger, remember My servant Job when he called upon Allah, his Lord: “The satan has afflicted Me with a tiring and tormentful matter”.

translation: "Go swiftly to the spring," (We said). "This cold water is for bathing and for drinking."
sentence: ٱرْكُضْ بِرِجْلِكَ هَٰذَا مُغْتَسَلٌۢ بَارِدٌ وَشَرَابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I said to him: “Strike your foot on the ground”. So he struck his foot on the ground, then water sprung forth for him from it, which he would drink and bathe from and through it, his difficulty and pain would go.

translation: We restored his family to him with others similar to them, as a blessing from Us and a reminder for men of wisdom. --
sentence: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ أَهْلَهُۥ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَٰبِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I responded to him and removed the difficulty he was affected by, and I gave him his family and added to them a like number of sons and grandsons, as a mercy from Me to him and a reward for his patience, and so that the people of superior intellect are reminded that the outcome of patience is ease and reward.

translation: "Take a handful of herbs," (We said to him), and apply and rub them, and do not make a mistake." We found him patient in adversity, an excellent devotee, always turning in repentance.
sentence: وَخُذْ بِيَدِكَ ضِغْثًا فَٱضْرِب بِّهِۦ وَلَا تَحْنَثْ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَٰهُ صَابِرًا نِّعْمَ ٱلْعَبْدُ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When Job became angry with his wife, he swore an oath he will lash her a hundred times, so I said to him: “O Job, take a bunch of stalks in your hand and hit her with them, to fulfil your oath. And do not break the oath you made”. So he took a bunch of stalks and hit her with them. I found him to be patient in what I afflicted him with. What an excellent servant he was. He would turn to Allah abundantly.

translation: Remember Our votaries Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of power and insight.
sentence: وَٱذْكُرْ عِبَٰدَنَآ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْحَٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ أُو۟لِى ٱلْأَيْدِى وَٱلْأَبْصَٰرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger, remember My servants I chose and the messengers I sent: Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. They were people of strength in Allah’s obedience and seeking His pleasure, and they were people of true insight into the truth.

translation: We distinguished them for the distinct remembrance of the abode (of the Hereafter).
sentence: إِنَّآ أَخْلَصْنَٰهُم بِخَالِصَةٍ ذِكْرَى ٱلدَّارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I favoured them with a special favour I chose them with, which was filling their hearts with the remembrance of the abode of the Afterlife, preparing for it through good actions and calling people towards acting for it.

translation: They are the chosen ones, the excellent in Our sight.
sentence: وَإِنَّهُمْ عِندَنَا لَمِنَ ٱلْمُصْطَفَيْنَ ٱلْأَخْيَارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they were with Me amongst those I chose for My obedience and worship, and whom I selected to bear My message and convey it to the people.

translation: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl. Every one of them is among the best.
sentence: وَٱذْكُرْ إِسْمَٰعِيلَ وَٱلْيَسَعَ وَذَا ٱلْكِفْلِ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ ٱلْأَخْيَارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Prophet, remember Ishmael, the son of Abraham, and remember Elisha, and remember Dhul-Kifl, and praise them well as they deserve it. And all of these were amongst the chosen and selected in Allah’s sight.

translation: This is a commemoration. Surely for those who take heed for themselves is an excellent place of return --
sentence: هَٰذَا ذِكْرٌ وَإِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسْنَ مَـَٔابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This is a reminder of these people through good praise in the Qur’ān. And for the Mindful through carrying out the orders of Allah and refraining from His prohibitions is a good return in the abode of the Afterlife.

translation: Gardens of Eden with gates open wide to them,
sentence: جَنَّٰتِ عَدْنٍ مُّفَتَّحَةً لَّهُمُ ٱلْأَبْوَٰبُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This good return is gardens of residence they will enter on the Day of Judgment, whose doors will be opened to welcome them.

translation: Where they will take their ease, calling for fruits in plenty, and for wine,
sentence: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَٰكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ وَشَرَابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Reclining on couches which will be adorned for them. They will ask their attendants to present to them the many different types of fruit they will desire and the drinks they will desire, such as wine and so forth.

translation: With companions of modest look, the same in age, by their side.
sentence: وَعِندَهُمْ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرْفِ أَتْرَابٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And with them will be women, all of similar age, whose gaze will be limited only to their husbands.

translation: This is what is promised you for the Day of Reckoning.
sentence: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوْمِ ٱلْحِسَابِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Alah-conscious people, this is the pleasant reward you are being promised on the day of judgment for your good deeds you used to do in the world.

translation: This is surely Our provision never-ending.
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُۥ مِن نَّفَادٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This reward I have mentioned is My provision I will give to the Alah-conscious on the Day of Judgment, and it is continuous provision which will not pause or end.

translation: This (for the virtuous); but for the transgressors the evil destination,
sentence: هَٰذَا وَإِنَّ لِلطَّٰغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَـَٔابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This that I mentioned is the reward of the Mindful. And those who trespass the limits of Allah through disbelief and sins will have a reward different to that of the Mindful, so for them is a bad return they shall return to on the day of judgment.

translation: Hell, in which they will burn. How vile a resting place!
sentence: جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا فَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This reward is hell which will surround them, and they will suffer its heat and flames. From it they will have a spread, so what an evil spread is theirs.

translation: There will be boiling water for them and cold, clammy, fetid drink to taste,
sentence: هَٰذَا فَلْيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٌ وَغَسَّاقٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This punishment is extremely hot water, and pus which will flow from the bodies of the people of hell being punished in it, so they should taste it as it is their drink. However it is a drink which does not quench thirst.

translation: And other similar torments.
sentence: وَءَاخَرُ مِن شَكْلِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they will have another punishment like this punishment. They will have a number of various punishments they will be punished with in the Afterlife.

translation: Here is a multitude rushing headlong with you. There is no welcome for them. They will roast in the fire.
sentence: هَٰذَا فَوْجٌ مُّقْتَحِمٌ مَّعَكُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًۢا بِهِمْ إِنَّهُمْ صَالُوا۟ ٱلنَّارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And when the people of hellfire will enter, they will dispute with one another, cursing and disassociating from one another. When it will be said to those already in the fire: “This is a new group of those that will inhabit the fire with you, they will respond:” “May they not be welcome, they will suffer the punishment like we are suffering”

translation: They will say: "In fact, it is you who will have no welcome. It is you who brought this upon us. What an evil place of rest!"
sentence: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ أَنتُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًۢا بِكُمْ أَنتُمْ قَدَّمْتُمُوهُ لَنَا فَبِئْسَ ٱلْقَرَارُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The group of followers will say to their leaders who were followed: “But rather you, O leaders who were followed, no welcome to you, as you are what caused us this painful punishment by misguiding us and leading us astray”. What a terrible settlement this is, the settlement of hell fire for them all.

translation: They will say: "O Lord, give him who has brought this upon us two times more the torment of Hell;"
sentence: قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَٰذَا فَزِدْهُ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا فِى ٱلنَّارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The followers will say: “Our Lord, whoever lead us astray from the guidance after it came to us, double his punishment in the fire”.
