en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who are mindful of their Lord by carrying out His commands and refraining from His prohibitions will be in gardens and a great pleasure which will never end.

translation: Rejoicing at what their Lord has given them; and their Lord will preserve them from the torment of Hell.
sentence: فَٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will be enjoying the pleasures of food, drink and marriage that Allah will have given them, and their Lord (may He be glorified), protected them from the punishment of hell. Hence, they were successful through achieving their desired pleasures and by being protected from difficulties.

translation: "Eat and drink with relish," (they will be told), (as recompense) for what you had done."
sentence: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said to them: “Eat and drink of what your souls desire, in satisfaction without fearing harm or pain from what you eat and drink, as a reward for your excellent actions in the world”.

translation: They would recline on couches set in rows, paired with fair companions (clean of thought and) bright of eye.
sentence: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ وَزَوَّجْنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Reclining on adorned thrones which have been lined up, and I will marry them to fair women with beautiful wide eyes.

translation: And those who believed, and whose progeny also followed them in their faith, will be united with their offspring. We will not deprive them of their labour in the least. Every man is bound to what he does.
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَٰنٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَآ أَلَتْنَٰهُم مِّنْ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَىْءٍ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who brought faith and whose children followed them in faith - I will join their children with them so that they are pleased with them, even though they did not reach their actions. And I will not decrease anything from the reward of their actions. Every person will be held for the bad actions he earned; nobody else will bear any of his actions.

translation: We shall give them fruits and meats, and what they desire.
sentence: وَأَمْدَدْنَٰهُم بِفَٰكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I will provide these people of Paradise with different fruits and I will provide them with all the meat they desire.

translation: They will exchange cups of wine free of (incitement to) pleasantry or sin.
sentence: يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will give to one another cups of wine, bearing no resemeblness to the wine of this world, free from intoxication and that which arises from it, such as false speech.

translation: And young attendants like pearls within their shells, will go round.
sentence: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَّهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And servants will circle amongst them, as though they are protected pearls.

translation: They will ask each other questions,
sentence: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of Paradise will turn to one another, asking each other about their condition in the world.

translation: Saying: "We were also once full of fear at home.
sentence: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِىٓ أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will respond to them: “We were, in the world amongst our families, fearful of Allah’s punishment.

translation: But God has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of scorching wind.
sentence: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Allah favoured us by guiding us to Islam, and He protected us from the punishment which is extremely hot.

translation: We used to pray to Him erstwhile; He is the just and merciful.
sentence: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We used to worship Him in our worldly life and we used to pray to Him to protect us from the fire of hell. He is Beneficent to His servants and Merciful to them. Part of His beneficence and mercy upon us is that He guided us to faith, entered us into Paradise and distanced us from the fire.”

translation: Remind them, therefore, that by the grace of your Lord you are neither a soothsayer nor possessed.
sentence: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So remind through the Qur’ān, O Messenger, for you are not, by the faith and intelligence Allah has favoured you with, a soothsayer with visions of jinns nor are you insane.

translation: Do they say: "He is a poet for whom we expect an adverse turn of fortune?"
sentence: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيْبَ ٱلْمَنُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do these idolaters say: “Muhammad is not a messenger, but he is a poet whom we await death to seize so we can be relieved of him”?

translation: Tell them: "Keep on expecting, I am expecting with you."
sentence: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا۟ فَإِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger, say to them: “Await my death, and I will await the punishment which will befall you due to denying me”.

translation: Does their reasoning prompt them to this, or they are a people rebellious?
sentence: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَٰمُهُم بِهَٰذَآ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do their minds tell them to say: “He is a soothsayer and insane?” So they combine what cannot gather in one person, but rather they are a people who trespass the bounds, hence they do not return to any sacred law or intellect.

translation: Or do they say: "He has fabricated it?" In fact, they will never believe.
sentence: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥ بَل لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they say: “Muhammad fabricated this Qur’ān and nothing has been revealed to him?” He has not fabricated it, but rather they are too arrogant to have faith in it, so they say: “He has fabricated it”.

translation: So let them bring a discourse like it, if they are truthful
sentence: فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِحَدِيثٍ مِّثْلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَٰدِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So let them produce a narrative like it, even if it has been fabricated, if they are true in their claim that he has fabricated it.

translation: Or were they created of themselves? Or are they the creators?
sentence: أَمْ خُلِقُوا۟ مِنْ غَيْرِ شَىْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ ٱلْخَٰلِقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or have they been created without a creator to create them? Or are they their own creators? The existence of a creation without a creator or a creation which creates itself is impossible, so why do they not worship their own creator?

translation: Or have they created the heavens and the earth? In fact they are certain of nothing.
sentence: أَمْ خَلَقُوا۟ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? But they do not have conviction that Allah is their Creator, if they had been convinced of that, they would have declared His oneness and brought faith in His Messenger.

translation: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the treasurers?
sentence: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ ٱلْمُصَۣيْطِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they have the treasures of your Lord’s provision to give to whom they wish, and prophethood to give to or stop from whom they want? Or are they the controllers and disposers according to their wish?

translation: Or do they have a ladder (climbing which) they can hear (the secrets of heaven)? Let one who has heard then bring a clear proof.
sentence: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُم بِسُلْطَٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they have a ladder with which to climb to the sky in which they listen to Allah’s revelation which He sends to tell them they are on the truth? So let the one who listens amongst them to that revelation bring a clear proof to affirm you in your claim that you are on truth.

translation: Has (God) daughters and they sons?
sentence: أَمْ لَهُ ٱلْبَنَٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلْبَنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or does He (may He be glorified) have daughters which you dislike, whilst you have sons which you love?

translation: Or do you demand any wages from them so that they are burdened with expense?
sentence: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do you, O Messenger, seek a wage from them for what you convey to them from their Lord, due to which they are burdened with something they cannot bear?

translation: Or do they have knowledge of the Unknown which they write down?
sentence: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they have knowledge of the Ghaib, so that they write for people what they learn from the Ghaib and inform them of what they want therefrom?

translation: Or do they want to stage a deception? -- Then only those who do not believe will be the ones who will be tricked.
sentence: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْمَكِيدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do these deniers intend to plot against you and your religion. Trust in Allah, as those who disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger are the ones who will be plotted against, not you.

translation: Or do they have a god apart from God? He is too exalted for what they associate with Him!
sentence: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ سُبْحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they have a true god besides Allah? Pure and exalted is Allah from the partner they attribute to him. None of what was mentioned has happened or is even thinkable.

translation: If they should see a segment falling from the sky, they would say: "It is only a massive cloud."
sentence: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ كِسْفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا۟ سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And if they see a piece of the sky falling, they will say: “This is a cloud which is piled up on each other as usual”. So they do not take heed or believe.

translation: So, leave them until they face their day (of doom) when they will be stunned.
sentence: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So leave them, O Messenger, in their stubbornness and denial until they meet their day in which they will be punished, which is the day of judgment.

translation: Their deception will not avail them in the least on that day, nor will they be helped.
sentence: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The day when their plot will neither help them a little or a lot, nor will they be helped by being saved from the punishment.

translation: Surely there are other torments besides this for those who are wicked, though most of them do not know.
sentence: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And for those who wronged themselves through idolatry and sins is a punishment before the punishment of the afterlife: in this life through being killed and imprisoned, and in the Transitory Stage through punishment of the grave. However, most of them do not know that, which is why they remain on their disbelief.

translation: Await the judgement of your Lord, for you are always before Our eyes, and glorify your Lord with praises when you rise,
sentence: وَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Be patient, O Messenger, on the decree of your Lord and His divine law, as you are in My sight and protection. And glorify and praise your Lord when you stand from your sleep.

translation: And glorify Him in the night and when the stars begin to wane.
sentence: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And at night, glorify your Lord and pray to Him, and pray the Fajr prayer after the stars have set due to daylight.

translation: I CALL TO witness the star of the pleiades when it has dipped
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He (may He be glorified) swore by the star when it descends.

translation: That your companion is not confused, nor has he gone astray,
sentence: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَمَا غَوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Muhammad (peace be upon him) the Messenger of Allah did not deviate from the path of guidance nor did he go astray, but rather he is rightly-guided.

translation: Neither does he speak of his own will.
sentence: وَمَا يَنطِقُ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he did not speak this Qur’ān out of following his desires.

translation: This is only revelation communicated,
sentence: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحْىٌ يُوحَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This Qur’ān is nothing but a revelation which Allah revealed to him through the medium of Gabriel (peace be upon him)

translation: Bestowed on him by the Supreme Intellect,
sentence: عَلَّمَهُۥ شَدِيدُ ٱلْقُوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: An angel of great strength, Gabriel (peace be upon him), taught him it.

translation: Lord of power and wisdom. So he acquired poise and balance,
sentence: ذُو مِرَّةٍ فَٱسْتَوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Gabriel (peace be upon him) is of excellent form, so he rose up appearing to the Prophet (peace be upon him) in his form in which Allah created him.

translation: And reached the highest pinnacle.
sentence: وَهُوَ بِٱلْأُفُقِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Whilst he was on the highest horizon.

translation: Then he drew near and drew closer
sentence: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then Gabriel (peace be upon him) came close to the Prophet (peace be upon him), then he came even closer.

translation: Until a space of two bow (arcs) or even less remained,
sentence: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So his closeness to him was the distance of two bow lengths or even closer.

translation: When He revealed to His votary what He revealed.
sentence: فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ عَبْدِهِۦ مَآ أَوْحَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Gabriel (peace be upon him) revealed to Allah’s servant, Muhammad (peace be upon him), what he revealed.

translation: His heart did not falsify what he perceived.
sentence: مَا كَذَبَ ٱلْفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The heart of Muhammad (peace be upon him) did not lie about what his eye saw.

translation: Will you dispute with him what he saw?
sentence: أَفَتُمَٰرُونَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So do you, O idolaters, argue with him about what he saw on the night he was taken on the journey?

translation: He saw Him indeed another time
sentence: وَلَقَدْ رَءَاهُ نَزْلَةً أُخْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Muhammad (peace be upon him) had seen Gabriel (peace be upon him) in his true form another time on the night he was taken for the journey.

translation: By the Lote-tree beyond which none can pass,
sentence: عِندَ سِدْرَةِ ٱلْمُنتَهَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: By the lote tree of the utmost boundary, which is a tree on the seventh heaven.

translation: Close to which is the Garden of Tranquility,
sentence: عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: By this tree is the Garden of Refuge.

translation: When the Lote-tree was covered over with what it was covered over;
sentence: إِذْ يَغْشَى ٱلسِّدْرَةَ مَا يَغْشَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the lote tree was covered through the command of Allah by something great whose true nature only Allah knows.

translation: Neither did sight falter nor exceed the bounds.
sentence: مَا زَاغَ ٱلْبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The eye of Muhammad (peace be upon him) did not swerve left or right, nor did it trespass what was fixed for it.

translation: Indeed he saw some of the greatest signs of His Lord.
sentence: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ ءَايَٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Muhammad (peace be upon him) saw on the night he was raised great signs of his Lord which show His power. He saw Paradise, hell and other things.

translation: Have you considered Lat and 'Uzza,
sentence: أَفَرَءَيْتُمُ ٱللَّٰتَ وَٱلْعُزَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Have you, O idolaters, seen these idols that you worship besides Allah: Lat and Uzza

translation: And Manat, the other third (of the pagan deities)?
sentence: وَمَنَوٰةَ ٱلثَّالِثَةَ ٱلْأُخْرَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Manat, another third one amongst your idols? Tell me do they possess any benefit or harm for him?

translation: Are there sons for you, and daughters for Him?
sentence: أَلَكُمُ ٱلذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ ٱلْأُنثَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O idolaters, do you have boys whom you like, whilst He (may He be glorified) has girls which you dislike?

translation: This is certainly an unjust apportioning.
sentence: تِلْكَ إِذًا قِسْمَةٌ ضِيزَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This distribution which you made with your desires is an unjust distribution.

translation: These are only names which you and your fathers have invented. No authority was sent down by God for them. They only follow conjecture and wish-fulfilment, even though guidance had come to them already from their Lord.
sentence: إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّآ أَسْمَآءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَٰنٍ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى ٱلْأَنفُسُ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These idols are nothing but names without meaning, so they have no share of divine qualities. You and your fathers named them on your own part. Allah did not reveal any proof for them. The idolaters do not follow in their belief except assumption and what their souls desire from what the satan has adorned in their hearts. And the guidance has come to them from their Lord on the tongue of Muhammad (peace be upon him), but they were not guided.

translation: Can ever man get what he desires?
sentence: أَمْ لِلْإِنسَٰنِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or will man have what he desired i.e., the idols interceding with Allah?

translation: To God belong the End and the Beginning.
sentence: فَلِلَّهِ ٱلْءَاخِرَةُ وَٱلْأُولَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: No, he will not have what he desired. For Allah alone is the afterlife and the first [life]; He grants of them whatever He wishes and withholds whatever He wishes.

translation: Many as the angels be in heaven their intercession will not avail in the least without God's permission for whomsoever He please and approve.
sentence: وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغْنِى شَفَٰعَتُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَن يَأْذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرْضَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: How many angels are there in the heavens whose intercession cannot help at all if they were to intend to help someone, except after Allah permits intercession for whom He wishes among them and He is pleased with the one being interceded for. Allah will never permit one who associates a partner with Him to intercede and He will never be pleased with the one he is interceding for who worships him besides Allah.

translation: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels names of females.
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْءَاخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ ٱلْأُنثَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who do not believe in the resurrection in the afterlife give the angels female names in their belief that they are the daughters of Allah. Allah is far above what they say.

translation: Yet they have no knowledge of this, and follow nothing but conjecture, but conjecture cannot replace the truth.
sentence: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ شَيْـًٔا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In giving them female names they have no knowledge to base this on. They merely follow speculation. Speculation is of no value against the truth, to take its place.

translation: So you turn away from him who turns away from Our rememberance and wants nothing but the life of this world:
sentence: فَأَعْرِضْ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So, O Messenger, ignore those who turn away from Allah’s remembrance without showing any concern for it, and who want only the life of this world and therefore do not work for their Hereafter because they do not believe in it.

translation: This is the farthest limit of their knowledge. Surely your Lord alone knows best who has strayed away from the path and who has come to guidance.
sentence: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That which the idolaters say - about giving the angels female names - is the limit of their knowledge because they are ignorant. They have not reached certainty. Your Lord - O Messenger- knows best about those who deviate from the path of truth and He knows best about those who are guided to its path. Nothing of that is hidden from Him.

translation: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, that He may requite those who do evil, in accordance with their deeds, and those who do good with good.
sentence: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَٰٓـُٔوا۟ بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ بِٱلْحُسْنَى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and to Him alone belongs whatever is on earth. He created, owns and controls all of it. To recompense whose who do evil actions in the world with the punishment that they deserve and to repay the believers who do good actions with Paradise.

translation: As for those who avoid the greater sins and shameful acts, except minor trespasses, your Lord's forgiveness surely has great amplitude. He is fully knowledgeable of you as He produced you from the earth, and since you were a foetus in your mother's womb. So do not assert your goodness; he is better who takes heed and preserves himself.
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَٰٓئِرَ ٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِى بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمْ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who stay away from major sins and evil wrongs, besides minor sins as these are forgiven by leaving out the major ones and by an abundance of good deeds. Your Lord, O Messenger, is of vast forgiveness. He forgives the sins of His servants when they repent from them. He, (may He be glorified), knew best about their states and affairs when He created their father, Adam, from earth and when you were in the wombs of your mothers, being created in one form after another. Nothing of that is hidden from Him. So do not claim purity for your souls by praising them and asserting their piety. He, (may He be glorified), knows best about those who are mindful of Him, by fulfilling His instructions and avoiding His prohibitions.

translation: Have you seen him who turns his back,
sentence: أَفَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى تَوَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Have you seen the evil state of the one who turned away from Islam after coming close to it?

translation: Who gives but little, and is niggardly?
sentence: وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًا وَأَكْدَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He gave a little wealth and then held back, because miserliness was an innate quality in him. Despite this he declares his soul to be pure.

translation: Has he knowledge of the Unknown that he perceives everything?
sentence: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does he have knowledge of the Ghaib and therefore sees and speaks about the Ghaib?

translation: Has he not heard what is contained in the Book of Moses,
sentence: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِى صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or is he fabricating against Allah? Or has this person, who makes up lies about Allah, not been informed about what was in the earlier scriptures that Allah had revealed to Moses?

translation: And of Abraham who fulfilled his trust? --
sentence: وَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلَّذِى وَفَّىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the scriptures of Abraham who fulfilled everything His Lord tasked him with?

translation: That no one who carries a burden bears another's load;
sentence: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That no person will bear the sin of another.

translation: That a man receives but only that for which he strives;
sentence: وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that man will only obtain the reward of the action that he did.

translation: That his endeavours will be judged,
sentence: وَأَنَّ سَعْيَهُۥ سَوْفَ يُرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that his action will be openly seen on the Day of Judgement.

translation: And only then will he receive his recompense in full;
sentence: ثُمَّ يُجْزَىٰهُ ٱلْجَزَآءَ ٱلْأَوْفَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then he will be given the recompense of his action in full without reduction.

translation: And that to your Lord is your returning;
sentence: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلْمُنتَهَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that to your Lord, O Messenger, will be the return and destination of the servants after they die.

translation: That it is He who makes you happy and morose,
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضْحَكَ وَأَبْكَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that He makes whoever He wills happy and makes him laugh, and makes whoever He wills sad and makes him cry.

translation: And He who ordains death and life;
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that He causes the living to die in the world and brings the dead to life by resurrection.

translation: That He created pairs, male and female,
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوْجَيْنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that He created the two types: Male and female.

translation: From a drop of semen when emitted;
sentence: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: From a drop when it is placed in the womb.

translation: That the second creation is incumbent on Him;
sentence: وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْأُخْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that He will undertake to recreate them after they die for the resurrection.

translation: That it is He who makes you rich and contented;
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغْنَىٰ وَأَقْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that He enriches whichever of His servants He wills by making him the owner of wealth and He gives wealth that people take as possessions they acquire.

translation: That He is the Lord of Sirius;
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that He is the Lord of Sirius, the star that is worshipped by some idolaters together with Allah.

translation: That it was He who destroyed the 'Ad of old,
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥٓ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا ٱلْأُولَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that He destroyed the first Ad, who were the people of Hud when they persisted in their disbelief.

translation: And Thamud, and did not leave them,
sentence: وَثَمُودَا۟ فَمَآ أَبْقَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He destroyed the Thamud, the people of Salih, and did not spare any one of them.

translation: Like the people of Noah before them, who were surely oppressors and rebellious;
sentence: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He destroyed the people of Noah before the Ad and Thamud. The people of Noah were more unjust and transgressed even more than the Ad and Thamud, because Noah lived amongst them for nine hundred and fifty years inviting them to Allah’s oneness but they did not respond to him.

translation: And He overthrew the Cities of the Plain,
sentence: وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He raised the villages of the people of Lot to the sky and then dropped them to ground.

translation: So that they were covered over by what they were covered over.
sentence: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He then covered them with stones after raising them to the sky and dropping them to the ground.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So which of the signs of your Lord indicating His power do you dispute with, O man, and not take a lesson from?

translation: He who warns you is one of the warners of old.
sentence: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٌ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلْأُولَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This messenger that is sent to you is from the class of the earlier messengers.

translation: What is to come is imminent.
sentence: أَزِفَتِ ٱلْءَازِفَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Day of Standing has drawn nearer.

translation: There is no one to unveil it apart from God.
sentence: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There is no one that can push it back and no one to uncover it besides Allah.

translation: Are you astonished at this news,
sentence: أَفَمِنْ هَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do you marvel at this Qur’ān that is recited to you, that it is from Allah?

translation: And keep laughing and do not weep,
sentence: وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And laugh mockingly at it and not cry when hearing its admonitions?

translation: Indulging in pleasantries?
sentence: وَأَنتُمْ سَٰمِدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Whilst you are neglectful of it, not giving it any attention?

translation: Bow instead in adoration before God and worship Him.
sentence: فَٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ وَٱعْبُدُوا۟
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So prostrate to Allah alone, and dedicate your worship to Him.

translation: THE HOUR HAS come and split is the moon.
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱقْتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلْقَمَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The coming of the Hour is close and the moon split in the time of the Prophet (peace be upon him), the splitting of which was one of the tangible miracles of the Prophet (peace be upon him).

translation: But if they see a sign they turn away, and say: "This is the same old lie continuing,"
sentence: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ ءَايَةً يُعْرِضُوا۟ وَيَقُولُوا۟ سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the idolaters see any sign or proof of the truthfulness of the Prophet (peace be upon him) they turn away from accepting it and say: The evidence and proof we have seen are false sorcery.

translation: And deny, and follow their own vain desires; but every matter is determined at its time.
sentence: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They denied the truth that came to them and followed their desires in this denial. Any matter, whether good or bad, will occur to the one who deserves it on the Day of Judgement.

translation: Messages deterring them from evil had come to them,
sentence: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There has come to them reports of the nations that Allah destroyed because of their disbelief and wrongdoing that were sufficient to deter them from their disbelief and wrongdoing.

translation: Containing consummate wisdom; yet warnings were of no avail.
sentence: حِكْمَةٌۢ بَٰلِغَةٌ فَمَا تُغْنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What has come to them is complete wisdom to establish the evidence against them. The warnings do not benefit a people who do not have faith in Allah and nor in the last day.

translation: So turn away from them. When on the Day the crier calls to the painful business,
sentence: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَىْءٍ نُّكُرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Since they do not follow the right path, leave them, O Messenger, and turn away from them waiting for the day when the angel appointed to blow the trumpet will call towards a horrific matter, the like of which was not known by created beings previously.

translation: They will come out of the graves with downcast eyes like an expanding swarm of locusts.
sentence: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Their gazes will be lowered. They will come out of their graves as if, in their rush towards the place of reckoning, they are scattered locusts.

translation: They will hasten forward to the caller, gazes fixed. And the unbelievers will say: "This is the day of untold woe."
sentence: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِ يَقُولُ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Rushing to the caller of that place. The disbelievers will say: This day is a hard one, because of the difficulty and horrors therein.

translation: The people of Noah had denied before them, and had called Our votary a liar, and said: "He is possessed," and repulsed him.
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا۟ عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا۟ مَجْنُونٌ وَٱزْدُجِرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Prior to these people who rejected your invitation, O Messenger, the people of Noah also denied. They denied My servant, Noah (peace be upon him) when I sent him to them. They said about him: He is insane, and they rebuked him with various forms of swearing, abuse and threats if he did not stop inviting them.

translation: So he prayed to his Lord: "I am helpless, deliver me."
sentence: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَغْلُوبٌ فَٱنتَصِرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Noah called unto His Lord saying: My people have overwhelmed me and they did not respond to me. So take retribution from them by a punishment that you send down on them.

translation: And We opened up the flood gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,
sentence: فَفَتَحْنَآ أَبْوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٍ مُّنْهَمِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I opened the doors of the sky to continuous torrential water.

translation: And We opened up the springs of the earth; and the waters met for a decreed end.
sentence: وَفَجَّرْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَٱلْتَقَى ٱلْمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I burst open the ground and it became springs from which water gushed. The water coming down from the sky met with the water gushing from the ground for a matter that Allah had determined in eternity. Everyone was drowned besides those whom Allah saved.

translation: But We bore him on a (vessel made) of planks and oakum,
sentence: وَحَمَلْنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَٰحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I carried Noah on a vessel that had planks and nails and I saved him and those with him from drowning.

translation: Which sailed right under Our eyes: A recompense for him who had been denied.
sentence: تَجْرِى بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَآءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This vessel was sailing on the clashing waves of water under My gaze and protection, as a victory for Noah whose people denied him and rejected what he brought from Allah.

translation: And We left it as a sign. Is there anyone who will be warned?
sentence: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَٰهَآ ءَايَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have left this punishment that I meted out to them as a lesson and admonition. Is there anyone to take a lesson from that?

translation: How was then My punishment and My commination!
sentence: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: How was my punishment to those who denied? How was my warning that I will destroy them?

translation: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?
sentence: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have made the Qur’ān easy to remember, so is there anyone to take heed of the lessons and admonishment that it contains?

translation: The 'Ad had also disavowed. How was then My punishment and My commination!
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Ad denied their prophet, Hud (peace be upon him). So reflect- O people of Makkah - how was my punishment to them? And how was my warning to others about their punishment?

translation: We let loose against them a violent roaring wind on a day of ill omen, continuous,
sentence: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِى يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I sent on them a severe cold wind on a day of evil and misfortune that will continue with them until they arrive in Hell.

translation: Which snatched away men as though they were palm trees pulled out by the roots.
sentence: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It picked up people from the ground and threw them on their heads as if they were the trunks of date-palms uprooted from their plantations.

translation: How was then My punishment and My commination!
sentence: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So reflect- O people of Makkah - how was my punishment to them? And how was my warning to others about their punishment?

translation: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will pay heed?
sentence: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have made the Qur’ān easy to remember, so is there anyone to take heed of the lessons and admonishment that it contains?

translation: The Thamud rejected the warnings,
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Thamud denied what their messenger, Salih (peace be upon him) warned them about.

translation: And said: "Should we follow only one man among us? In that case we shall he in error and insane.
sentence: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرًا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدًا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّفِى ضَلَٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They condemningly said: Shall we follow a human from our species, who is alone? If we follow him in this state, we will be astray from what is correct and will be in difficulty.

translation: Was he the one of all of us to have been given the exposition? He is surely an impudent liar."
sentence: أَءُلْقِىَ ٱلذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Has revelation been sent down to him, whilst he is just one person, and has he been chosen for it instead of all of us? No, in fact he is an imperious liar.

translation: "Tomorrow they will know who is the impudent liar!
sentence: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَّنِ ٱلْكَذَّابُ ٱلْأَشِرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will soon come to know on the day of judgment who the imperious liar is, Salih or they?

translation: We shall send the she-camel to try them. So watch them, and be constant.
sentence: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَّهُمْ فَٱرْتَقِبْهُمْ وَٱصْطَبِرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will take out a she-camel from the rock and send it as a test to them. So wait, O Salih - and watch what they do to it and what is done to them, and be patient over their harm.

translation: Tell them that the water is to be apportioned between them (and her); and every turn of drinking will be fixed (for each)."
sentence: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلْمَآءَ قِسْمَةٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُّحْتَضَرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Tell them that the water of their well is divided between them and the she-camel: one day for it and one day for them. Each turn will be attended by its owner alone on the day allocated to him.

translation: But they called their commander, who seized and hamstrung her.
sentence: فَنَادَوْا۟ صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They then called their companion to kill the she-camel and he took a sword and killed it, fulfilling the instruction of his people.

translation: How was then My punishment of which they had been warned?
sentence: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So reflect- O people of Makkah - how was my punishment to them? And how was my warning to others about their punishment?

translation: We sent a single blast against them, and they were reduced to husks of a decayed fence.
sentence: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلْمُحْتَظِرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I sent on them a single blast which destroyed them and they became like dry trees that are used by a person who makes a fence for his sheep.

translation: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?
sentence: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have made the Qur’ān easy to remember, so is there anyone to take heed of the lessons and admonishment that it contains?

translation: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of Lot denied what their messenger, Lot (peace be upon him) warned them about.

translation: We sent a stone-hurtling storm against them, except the family of Lot whom We saved in the early hours of the morning
sentence: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ نَّجَّيْنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I sent on them a wind that threw stones on them except the family of Lot (peace be upon him). The punishment did not afflict them, as I had rescued them from it as he had travelled away with them before the punishment came down in the last part of the night.

translation: As a favour from Us. That is how We reward the grateful.
sentence: نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَن شَكَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I rescued them from the punishment as My favour upon them. I give a recompense similar to the one I gave to Lot to those who are thankful to Allah for His favours.

translation: He had warned them of Our might, but they passed over the warnings.
sentence: وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا۟ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Lot warned them of My punishment but they disputed with one another about his warning and they rejected it.

translation: They lusted after his guests, so We put out their eyes (and said): "Taste My punishment and My commination."
sentence: وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِۦ فَطَمَسْنَآ أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Lot’s people tried to tempt him to give them access to the angels who were his guests with the intention of doing an indecent act. I obliterated their eyes so they did not see them and I said to them: Taste my punishment and the result of My warning to you.

translation: And early in the morning the decreed punishment came upon them.
sentence: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In the morning a punishment came to them, which will remain with them until they come to the afterlife and its punishment will come on them.

translation: So now taste My punishment and My commination!
sentence: فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said to them: Taste My punishment that I sent down on you and the result of Lot’s warning to you.

translation: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?
sentence: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have made the Qur’ān easy to remember, so is there anyone to take heed of the lessons and admonishment that it contains?

translation: The warnings came to the people of Pharaoh.
sentence: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: My warning came to the people of Pharaoh on the tongue of Moses and Aaron (peace be upon them).

translation: They rejected each one of Our signs. So We seized them with the grip of one mighty and powerful.
sentence: كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَٰهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They denied the proof and evidence that came to them from Me, so I punished them for their denial thereof with the punishment of a Mighty One whom none can overpower, a Powerful One who is not unable to do anything.

translation: Are the unbelievers among you any better than they? Or is there immunity for you in the Scriptures?
sentence: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٌ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Are your disbelievers, O people of Makkah, better than those disbelievers mentioned: The people of Noah, the Ad, the Thamud, the people of Lot and Pharaoh and his people? Or do you have immunity from Allah’s punishment that has been brought by the heavenly scriptures?

translation: Or do they say: "We are a well-accoutred army?"
sentence: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُّنتَصِرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do these disbelievers from the people of Makkah say: We are all together and well-defended against those who have evil designs against us and who wish to break up our unity?

translation: The army will be routed and put to flight.
sentence: سَيُهْزَمُ ٱلْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The group of these disbelievers will be defeated and they will turn their backs before the believers. This occurred on the day of Badr.

translation: Surely the Hour will be the moment of their promise, and that moment will be calamitous and distressing.
sentence: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In fact, the Hour that they deny is the appointed time when they will be punished. The Hour is more severe and bitter than the punishment of the world that they received on the day of Badr.

translation: Surely the sinners are misguided and insane.
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who are guilty of disbelief and sins are astray from the truth and in punishment and difficulty.

translation: On that Day they will be dragged into the fire faces foremost, (and told:) "Taste the feel of Hell."
sentence: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا۟ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when they will be dragged in the Fire on their faces and it will be said to them in rebuke: Taste the punishment of the Fire.

translation: We have indeed created all things by measure;
sentence: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have created everything in existence with a prior determination from Me, in accordance with My knowledge and what I had written in the Preserved Tablet.

translation: And Our command is but one (word) swift as the winking of an eye.
sentence: وَمَآ أَمْرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍۭ بِٱلْبَصَرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: My matter when I intend something is only that I say one word, which is: ‘Be,’ and what I intend quickly becomes like the twinkling of an eye.

translation: We have destroyed the likes of you in the past: So is there any one who will be warned?
sentence: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَآ أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I had destroyed the likes of you in disbelief from the previous nations. Is there anyone who will take a lesson from this and desist from his disbelief?

translation: All things they do are (recorded) in the books;
sentence: وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Everything the servants do is written in the books of the guardian angels, whom nothing escapes.

translation: All things small or great have been written down.
sentence: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُّسْتَطَرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Every small and big action or statement is written in the books of deeds and in the Preserved Tablet, and they will be recompensed for it.

translation: Surely those who fear God and follow the straight path will be amidst gardens and light,
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّٰتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who are mindful of their Lord through fulfilling His instructions and refraining from His prohibitions will enjoy in gardens and in flowing streams.

translation: At the still centre in the proximity of the King all-powerful.
sentence: فِى مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In an assembly of truth, in which there will be no futility or sin, by a Sovereign Who owns everything, a Powerful One Who is not unable to do anything. So do not ask about the perpetual bliss they will receive.

translation: AR-RAHMAN
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Merciful one, possessor of vast mercy.

translation: Bestowed the Qur'an,
sentence: عَلَّمَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He taught the Qur’ān to people by making its memorization easy and facilitating the understanding of its meanings.

translation: Created man,
sentence: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He created man perfectly and formed him in the best manner.

translation: And taught him to express clearly.
sentence: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلْبَيَانَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He taught him how to express what is within himself in speech and writing.

translation: The sun and moon revolve to a computation;
sentence: ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He fixed a perfectly calculated course for the sun and moon, to teach people the number of years and calculation.

translation: And the grasses and the trees bow (to Him) in adoration.
sentence: وَٱلنَّجْمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Plants that do not have a stem and trees prostrate to Allah, (may He be glorified), in submission and surrender to Him.

translation: He raised the sky and set the Balance
sentence: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلْمِيزَانَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He raised the sky above the earth as a roof for it. He established justice on earth and instructed His servants with it.

translation: So that none may err against the scales,
sentence: أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْمِيزَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He established justice so that you, O people, are not unjust and deceitful in weighing and measurement.

translation: And observe correct measure, weigh with justice, and not cheat the balance.
sentence: وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلْوَزْنَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا۟ ٱلْمِيزَانَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Maintain the weighing justly between yourselves and do not give short weight or measure when you measure or weigh for others.

translation: He positioned the earth for all the creatures:
sentence: وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He prepared the earth for the creation to settle on it.

translation: There are fruits of all kinds on it, and date-palms with their clusters sheathed,
sentence: فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٌ وَٱلنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ ٱلْأَكْمَامِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It contains trees that produce fruit and date-palms that have receptacles that split open to reveal clusters.

translation: Grain with husk, and fragrant grasses.
sentence: وَٱلْحَبُّ ذُو ٱلْعَصْفِ وَٱلرَّيْحَانُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It contains grain with straw like wheat and barley and the different types of grain that you have been provided as food. It contains plants whose fragrances you find to be pleasant.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: He created man of fermented clay dried tinkling hard like earthen ware,
sentence: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلْصَٰلٍ كَٱلْفَخَّارِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He created Adam (peace be upon him) from dried clay that has a clatter like that of baked clay.

translation: And created jinns from the white-hot flame of fire.
sentence: وَخَلَقَ ٱلْجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٍ مِّن نَّارٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He created the father of the jinn from a flame that is pure of smoke.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Lord of the two Easts, Lord of the two Wests.
sentence: رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَغْرِبَيْنِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Lord of the sun’s two points of rising and its two points of setting in winter and summer.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: He has set two seas in motion that flow side by side together,
sentence: مَرَجَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah mixed the two seas, the salty and the sweet, that converge as far as the eye can see.

translation: With an interstice between them which they cannot cross.
sentence: بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَّا يَبْغِيَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Between them is a barrier that prevents each one of them from transgressing over the other so that the sweet remains sweet and the salty remains salty.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Out of them come pearls and coral.
sentence: يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا ٱللُّؤْلُؤُ وَٱلْمَرْجَانُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: From these seas pearls and coral emerge.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: His are the high-sailed vessels in deep ocean like the mountains.
sentence: وَلَهُ ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ كَٱلْأَعْلَٰمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He, (may He be glorified), alone has control of the ships that sail on the oceans like mountains.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: All that is on the earth is passing,
sentence: كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Every creation that is on the surface of the earth will inevitably perish.

translation: But abiding is the glory of your Lord, full of majesty and beneficence.
sentence: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلْجَلَٰلِ وَٱلْإِكْرَامِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The face of your Lord, O Messenger, the One of greatness, kindness and bounty for His servants, will remain and will never perish.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: All those there are in the heavens and the earth turn to Him with solicitation, intent on His purpose all the time.
sentence: يَسْـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِى شَأْنٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The angels in the heavens and the jinn and men on earth ask Him for their needs. Every day he brings about a matter from the affairs of His servants such as giving life, death, provision etc.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: We shall soon be free to turn to you, O weary caravans,
sentence: سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will attend to your reckoning, O men and jinn. and I will recompense each one with the reward or punishment he deserves.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: O society of jinns and men, cross the bounds of the heavens and the earth if you have the ability, then pass beyond them; but you cannot unless you acquire the law.
sentence: يَٰمَعْشَرَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَن تَنفُذُوا۟ مِنْ أَقْطَارِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنفُذُوا۟ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَٰنٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah will say on the Day of Judgment, when He gathers jinn and men: O group of jinn and men, if you are able to find for yourselves an exit from one part of the heavens and earth then do so. You will never be able to do so except with power and evidence, and where do you have that?

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Let loose at you will be smokeless flames of fire so that you will not be able to defend yourselves.
sentence: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِّن نَّارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A flame of smokeless fire will be sent on you, O men and jinn, and smoke without a flame, and you will not be able to protect yourselves.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: When the sky will split asunder, and turn rosy like the dregs of annointing oil,
sentence: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَٱلدِّهَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the sky will split open for the angels to descend from it and it will be red like molten lead or the like due to the terror of the day of judgment.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Neither man nor jinn will be questioned on that day about his sin.
sentence: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُسْـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٌ وَلَا جَآنٌّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that great day no man or jinn will be asked about their sins, because Allah knows their deeds.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: The sinners will be recognised by their marks, and seized by the forelock and their feet.
sentence: يُعْرَفُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَٰهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِى وَٱلْأَقْدَامِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The guilty ones will be recognised on that day by their mark, which is the blackness of their faces and the blueness of their eyes. Their forelocks will be tied to their feet and they will be thrown into Hell.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: This is Hell the sinners called a lie.
sentence: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِى يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said to them in rebuke: This is the Hell that the guilty ones used to reject in the world, which is before their eyes and which they are unable to deny.

translation: They will go round and around between it and boiling water.
sentence: يَطُوفُونَ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ حَمِيمٍ ءَانٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will go between it and water that is extremely hot.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: But for him who lived in awe of the sublimity of his Lord, there will be two gardens --
sentence: وَلِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who fear to stand before their Lord in the Hereafter, and therefore have faith and do righteous deeds, will have two gardens.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Full of overhanging branches --
sentence: ذَوَاتَآ أَفْنَانٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These two gardens will have huge fresh branches producing fruit.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: With two springs of water flowing through them both. --
sentence: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ تَجْرِيَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In the two gardens there will be two springs flowing between them with water.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: In both of them there will be every kind of fruits in pairs. --
sentence: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَٰكِهَةٍ زَوْجَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In them there will be two types of every fruit to enjoy.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Reclining there on carpets lined with brocade, fruits of the garden hanging low within reach.
sentence: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ وَجَنَى ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Reclining on spreads, whose inner lining will be of coarse silk, and the fruits that they will reap from the two gardens will be close and within reach of a person standing, sitting or reclining.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: In them maidens with averted glances, undeflowered by man or by jinn before them, --
sentence: فِيهِنَّ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In them there will be women who will restrict their gaze to their husbands, whose virginity was not broken by any man or jinn before their husbands.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: As though rubies and pearls.
sentence: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلْيَاقُوتُ وَٱلْمَرْجَانُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As though they are rubies and coral in their beauty and purity.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Should the reward of goodness be aught else but goodness? --
sentence: هَلْ جَزَآءُ ٱلْإِحْسَٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلْإِحْسَٰنُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The reward of those who properly followed their Lord is only that Allah will give them a proper recompense.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: And besides these two other gardens --
sentence: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Below those two mentioned gardens are another two gardens.

translation: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Of darkest verdant green --
sentence: مُدْهَآمَّتَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Both of the deepest green.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: With two fountains gushing constantly, --
sentence: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In these two gardens there are springs that forcefully gush forth with water. The gushing of their water does not stop.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: With fruits in them, and dates and pomegranates --
sentence: فِيهِمَا فَٰكِهَةٌ وَنَخْلٌ وَرُمَّانٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In these two gardens there are abundant fruit, huge date-palms and pomegranates.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: In them good and comely maidens --
sentence: فِيهِنَّ خَيْرَٰتٌ حِسَانٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In these four gardens there are women with good characters and beautiful faces.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Houris cloistered in pavilions --
sentence: حُورٌ مَّقْصُورَٰتٌ فِى ٱلْخِيَامِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Houris covered in tents as protection for them.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Undeflowered by man or by jinn before them, --
sentence: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Before their husbands no man or jinn has come close to them.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Reclining on green cushions and rich carpets excellent.
sentence: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِىٍّ حِسَانٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Reclining on cushions covered with green covers, and beautiful carpets.

translation: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which of Allah’s numerous favours to you, O group of Jinn and men, do you deny?

translation: Blessed be the name of your Lord, full of majesty and beneficience.
sentence: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِى ٱلْجَلَٰلِ وَٱلْإِكْرَامِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The name of your Lord, the Possessor of majesty, favour and bounty over His servants, is great and full of goodness.

translation: WHEN WHAT IS to happen comes to pass --
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِذَا وَقَعَتِ ٱلْوَاقِعَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the inevitable rising will occur.

translation: Which is bound to happen undoubtedly --
sentence: لَيْسَ لِوَقْعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There will be no soul that denies it like how it used to deny in the world.

translation: Degrading (some) and exalting (others);
sentence: خَافِضَةٌ رَّافِعَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will bring the sinful disbelievers low by entering them into the Fire, and it will raise the mindful believers high by entering them into Paradise.

translation: When the earth is shaken up convulsively,
sentence: إِذَا رُجَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ رَجًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the earth is shaken violently.

translation: The mountains bruised and crushed,
sentence: وَبُسَّتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ بَسًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the mountains are completely crushed.

translation: Turned to dust, floating in the air,
sentence: فَكَانَتْ هَبَآءً مُّنۢبَثًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Due to this crushing they will become scattered dust.

translation: You will become three categories:
sentence: وَكُنتُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا ثَلَٰثَةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You will be in three categories on that day.

translation: Those of the right hand -- how (happy) will be those of the right hand!
sentence: فَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَيْمَنَةِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَيْمَنَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of the right hand, who will receive their books in their right hands. How high and great will be their rank!

translation: Then those of the left hand -- how (unhappy) will be those of the left hand!
sentence: وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The people of the left hand, who will receive their books in their left hands. How despicable and wretched will be their ranks.

translation: Then the foremost, how pre-excellent,
sentence: وَٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ ٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who were foremost in doing good deeds in the world they will be foremost in the afterlife to enter Paradise.

translation: Who will be honoured
sentence: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are the ones who will be brought close to Allah.

translation: In gardens of tranquility;
sentence: فِى جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In gardens of delight, they will enjoy different types of delight.

translation: A number of the earlier peoples,
sentence: ثُلَّةٌ مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A group from this nation and from previous nation.

translation: And a few of later ages,
sentence: وَقَلِيلٌ مِّنَ ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A few people at the end of time will be the foremost ones that are brought close.

translation: On couches wrought of gold,
sentence: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّوْضُونَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On couches woven with gold.

translation: Reclining face to face.
sentence: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَيْهَا مُتَقَٰبِلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Reclining on these couches facing one another and no one will look at the back of another.

translation: Youths of never-ending bloom will pass round to them
sentence: يَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Children who will never face old age or extinction will roam around them, to serve them.

translation: Cups and decanters, beakers full of sparkling wine,
sentence: بِأَكْوَابٍ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأْسٍ مِّن مَّعِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will roam around them holding handle-less jugs, jugs with handles, and glasses of unlimited wine that flows in Paradise.

translation: Unheady, uninebriating;
sentence: لَّا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنْهَا وَلَا يُنزِفُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not like the wine of the world; it’s drinkers will not get headaches nor suffer intoxication.

translation: And such fruits as they fancy,
sentence: وَفَٰكِهَةٍ مِّمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These children will also roam around them with fruits, from which they may choose.

translation: Bird meats that they relish,
sentence: وَلَحْمِ طَيْرٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will also roam around with the meat of birds their hearts desire.

translation: And companions with big beautiful eyes
sentence: وَحُورٌ عِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will also have beautiful, wide-eyed women in Paradise.

translation: Like pearls within their shells,
sentence: كَأَمْثَٰلِ ٱللُّؤْلُؤِ ٱلْمَكْنُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Like pearls protected within their shells.

translation: As recompense for all they had done.
sentence: جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As a reward for the good actions they used to do in the world.

translation: They will hear no nonsense there or talk of sin,
sentence: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will not hear any foul language in Paradise, nor any language that incurs sin.

translation: Other than "Peace, peace" the salutation.
sentence: إِلَّا قِيلًا سَلَٰمًا سَلَٰمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will only hear the angels greeting them, and the greetings of one another.

translation: As for those of the right hand -- how (happy) those of the right hand --
sentence: وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْيَمِينِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْيَمِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the People of the Right: who are the People of the Right? Their rank and status with Allah is indeed, great!

translation: They will be in (the shade) of thornless lote
sentence: فِى سِدْرٍ مَّخْضُودٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will be among harmless, thornless lote trees.

translation: And acacia covered with heaps of bloom,
sentence: وَطَلْحٍ مَّنضُودٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And bananas, neatly arranged in rows with one another.

translation: Lengthened shadows,
sentence: وَظِلٍّ مَّمْدُودٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And lengthened, continuous, unmoving shadows.

translation: Gushing water,
sentence: وَمَآءٍ مَّسْكُوبٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And flowing water which never stops.

translation: And fruits numberless,
sentence: وَفَٰكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And many fruits that cannot be counted.

translation: Unending, unforbidden,
sentence: لَّا مَقْطُوعَةٍ وَلَا مَمْنُوعَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will never finish, because they are not seasonal, nor will there be anything that comes in between their desire for them at any time.

translation: And maidens incomparable.
sentence: وَفُرُشٍ مَّرْفُوعَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And raised spreads, spread on the couches.

translation: We have formed them in a distinctive fashion,
sentence: إِنَّآ أَنشَأْنَٰهُنَّ إِنشَآءً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, I created the aforementioned wide-eyed women in an extraordinary way.

translation: And made them virginal,
sentence: فَجَعَلْنَٰهُنَّ أَبْكَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I made them virgins, previously untouched.

translation: Loving companions matched in age,
sentence: عُرُبًا أَتْرَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are very loving to their husbands, and equal to them in age.

translation: For those of the right hand.
sentence: لِّأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I created them for the People of the Right: those who will be taken towards the right as a sign of their excellence.

translation: A crowd of earlier generations
sentence: ثُلَّةٌ مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are a group from the nations of the previous Prophets.

translation: And a crowd of the later.
sentence: وَثُلَّةٌ مِّنَ ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And a group from the nation of Muhammad (peace be upon him), which is the last of all nations.

translation: But those of the left hand -- how (unhappy) those of the left hand --
sentence: وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ مَآ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the People of the Left: who are the People of the Left? Their state and outcome is indeed, very bad.

translation: Will be in the scorching wind and boiling water,
sentence: فِى سَمُومٍ وَحَمِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will be among severely hot winds and extremely hot water.

translation: Under the shadow of thick black smoke
sentence: وَظِلٍّ مِّن يَحْمُومٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And in the shadow of black smoke.

translation: Neither cool nor agreeable.
sentence: لَّا بَارِدٍ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Neither will it be pleasant, nor will it be a good sight.

translation: They were endowed with good things
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتْرَفِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, before they came to the punishment, they were enjoying the luxuries in the world, caring only for their desires.

translation: But persisted in that greater sin,
sentence: وَكَانُوا۟ يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى ٱلْحِنثِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They used to persist on disbelief in Allah and the worship of idols instead of Him.

translation: And said: "What! When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be raised again?
sentence: وَكَانُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They also used to reject the resurrection, and they would say regarding it, mocking it and thinking it to be far-fetched: “What, when we die and become dust and decayed and decomposed bones, shall we be resurrected after that?”

translation: And so will our fathers?"
sentence: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Will our ancient forefathers who died before us also be resurrected?”

translation: Say: "Indeed, the earlier and the later generations
sentence: قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ وَٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these deniers of the resurrection: “Indeed, the earlier generations of people and the later ones from them...

translation: Will be gathered together on a certain day which is predetermined.
sentence: لَمَجْمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَٰتِ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “...will soon be inevitably gathered on the Day of Judgement to be taken to account and requited.”

translation: Then you, the erring and the deniers,
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ أَيُّهَا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ ٱلْمُكَذِّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, O you rejectors of the resurrection and deviants from the straight path!

translation: Will eat of the tree of Zaqqum,
sentence: لَءَاكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرٍ مِّن زَقُّومٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You shall, on the Day of Judgement, eat from the fruits of the tree of Al-Zaqqūm, which are the worst and most disgusting of fruits.

translation: Fill your bellies with it,
sentence: فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You will fill your hungry bellied with the fruits of that bitter tree.

translation: And drink over it scalding water,
sentence: فَشَٰرِبُونَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ ٱلْحَمِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then you will drink extremely hot water on top of that.

translation: Lapping it up like female camels raging of thirst with disease."
sentence: فَشَٰرِبُونَ شُرْبَ ٱلْهِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You will drink so much of it, just like a camel suffering from a burning thirst drinks.

translation: Such will be their welcome on the Day of Judgement.
sentence: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The aforementioned bitter fruit and extremely hot water is your hospitality you will be received with on the Day of Requital.

translation: It is He who created you, then why do you not affirm the truth?
sentence: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَٰكُمْ فَلَوْلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ
