translation: Whether you say a thing secretly or openly, He knows the innermost secrets of your hearts.
sentence: وَأَسِرُّوا۟ قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ ٱجْهَرُوا۟ بِهِۦٓ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people! Speak secretively or openly; Allah hears it anyway. Indeed, He may He be glorified is aware of whatever is in the hearts of His servants; nothing is hidden from Him in that regard.

translation: Can He who has created not know (His creation)? He is all-penetrating, all-aware.
sentence: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ ٱللَّطِيفُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does the one who created all creation not know of the secret, and that which is more inconspicuous than the secret? He is The Kind to His servants; The Aware of their affairs. Nothing is hidden from Him in that regard.

translation: It is He who made the earth subservient to you that you may travel all around it, and eat of things He has provided; and to Him will be your resurrection.
sentence: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَٱمْشُوا۟ فِى مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِهِۦ وَإِلَيْهِ ٱلنُّشُورُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He is the one who made the earth soft and easy for you to live on, so travel around to its edges and eat from the provision He has prepared for you within it. To Him alone you will be resurrected for accountability and requital.

translation: Are you so unafraid that He who is in Heaven will not open up the earth to swallow you, when it will begin to tremble?
sentence: ءَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَمُورُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do you feel safe from the being in the heavens that He may cause the earth to split beneath you, just as He caused it to split beneath Korah, despite it having been soft and easy to live on? It could suddenly shake with you on it, after being firm and solid.

translation: Or have you become so unafraid that He who is in Heaven will not send a violent wind to shower stones at you? Then you will know the import of My commination!
sentence: أَمْ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do you feel safe from the being in the heavens that He could rain down stones upon you just like He did upon the people of Lot? Then you will realise, when you see My punishment for yourselves, My warnings to you. But you will never be able to benefit from them after having witnessed the punishment.

translation: Those before them had also denied. And how was My punishment then!
sentence: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, the nations that came before these idolaters rejected, and so the punishment of Allah descended upon them after they insisted in their disbelief and rejection, so how was My disavowal of them? Verily, it was a severe disavowal.

translation: Do they not see the birds above them flying wings spread out or folded? Nothing holds them aloft but God. All things are within His purview.
sentence: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَٰٓفَّٰتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ إِنَّهُۥ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍۭ بَصِيرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do these rejectors not see the birds above them flying in rows, side by side with one another? What stops them from falling to the ground, except Allah? Indeed, He is The Seeing of everything, nothing is hidden from Him.

translation: What other army do you have to help you apart from Ar-Rahman? The unbelievers are surely lost in delusion.
sentence: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى هُوَ جُندٌ لَّكُمْ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ إِنِ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ إِلَّا فِى غُرُورٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O disbelievers! There is no army that can save you from the punishment of Allah if He decides to punish you. The disbelievers are in nothing but deception; Satan has deceived them and they have fallen into his deception.

translation: Who is there to give you food in case He withholds His bounty? Yet they persist in rebellion and aversion.
sentence: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُۥ بَل لَّجُّوا۟ فِى عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And there is no one that can sustain you if Allah stops His provisions from reaching you. Rather, the crux is that the disbelievers have prolonged in transgression, arrogance and refusal of the truth.

translation: Will he find the way who grovels flat on his face, or he who walks straight on the right path?
sentence: أَفَمَن يَمْشِى مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦٓ أَهْدَىٰٓ أَمَّن يَمْشِى سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So is the one who walks while falling on his face i.e. the idolater more guided, or the believer who walks upright on the straight path?

translation: Say: "It is He who raised you and gave you ears and eyes and hearts. How little are the thanks you offer!"
sentence: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these idolaters who reject: “Allah is the one who created you and made for you ears through which you hear, eyes with which you see, and hearts through which you think. Little do you show gratitude to Him for the blessings He has conferred upon you.

translation: Say: "It is He who dispersed you all over the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
sentence: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِى ذَرَأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these idolaters who reject: “Allah is the one who dispersed you on earth and made you spread upon it, not your idols which cannot create anything. To Him alone you will be gathered on the Day of Judgement for accountability and requital, not your idols. So fear Him and worship Him alone.

translation: But they say: "When will this promise come to pass, if what you say is true?"
sentence: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the rejectors of the resurrection, thinking it to be far-fetched, say, “O Muhammad! When will this promise that you and your companions promise us with, happen, if you are truthful in your claim that it will occur?”

translation: Say: "God alone has knowledge. My duty is only to warn you clearly."
sentence: قُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْعِلْمُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say, O Messenger: “The knowledge of the Hour is with Allah; only He knows when it will occur. I am only a clear warner in my warning to you.”

translation: When they realise it has come upon them, distraught will be the faces of unbelievers. They will be told: "This is what you asked for."
sentence: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيٓـَٔتْ وُجُوهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَدَّعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when the promise will come upon them and they will see the punishment close to them on the Day of Judgement, the faces of those who disbelieved in Allah will change and become dark. And it will be said to them, “This is what you used to ask for and want hastily!”

translation: Say: "Just think: If God destroys me and those with me, or is benevolent to us, who will then protect the unbelievers from a painful doom?"
sentence: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِىَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِىَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these rejecting idolaters, reprimanding them: “Tell me, if Allah was to case death to me and to those with me i.e. the believers, who will save the disbelievers from a painful punishment?” No one will ever save them from it.

translation: Say: "He is the benevolent; in Him do we believe, and in Him do we place our trust. You will now realise who is in manifest error."
sentence: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these idolaters: “He is The Merciful who invites you to worshipping Him alone. We have brought faith in Him, and upon Him alone we rely for our affairs. You will soon know, inevitably, who was in clear deviance and who was on the straight path.”

translation: Say: "Just think: If your water were to dry up in the morning who will bring you water from a fresh, flowing stream?"
sentence: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَآؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَآءٍ مَّعِينٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these idolaters: “Tell me, if the water you drink from was to seep away into the earth and you could not get to it, who then would bring you abundant, flowing water?” No one other than Allah could.

translation: NUN. I CALL to witness the pen and what they inscribe,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ نٓ وَٱلْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The discussion on similar letters has already passed in Sūrah Al-Baqarah. Allah takes an oath on the Pen and whatever the people write with their pens.

translation: You are not demented by the grace of your Lord.
sentence: مَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! You are not a madman, due to the messengership Allah has blessed you with. Rather, you are free of the insanity the idolaters accuse you with.

translation: There is surely reward unending for you,
sentence: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, there is definitely a great, everlasting reward for you for your conveying the message to the people, without there being a favour outstanding upon you for anyone.

translation: For you are verily born of sublime nature.
sentence: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, you are definitely on the greatest of character that the Qur’ān has brought; you are embodied with it to the most perfect degree.

translation: So you will see, and they will realise,
sentence: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So you will soon see, and these rejectors will also see.

translation: Who is distracted.
sentence: بِأَييِّكُمُ ٱلْمَفْتُونُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the truth is revealed, who from amongst you was actually a madman.

translation: Verily your Lord knows those who have gone astray from His path, and He knows those who are guided on the way.
sentence: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord knows of whoever deviates from His path, and He is best aware of those who are guided to it. Therefore, He knows that they are the ones who have deviated from it, and that you have been guided to it.

translation: So do not comply with those who deny:
sentence: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So, O Messenger, do not follow the rejectors in what you have brought.

translation: They only want that you should relent, so that they may come to terms.
sentence: وَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They wish that you were soft and compromising towards them in matters of religion, so they can be soft and kind to you in return.

translation: Do not heed a contemptible swearer,
sentence: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَّهِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And do not follow anyone who frequently takes false oaths, and is vulgar.

translation: Or backbiter, calumniator, slanderer,
sentence: هَمَّازٍ مَّشَّآءٍۭ بِنَمِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Who frequently backbites the people, and bears tales between them to cause division between them.

translation: Who hinders men from (doing) good, the transgressor, the iniquitous,
sentence: مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Who often prevents goodness and oppresses the people in their wealth, their dignity and their lives; who is a habitual sinner and disobeyer.

translation: Crude, and above all, mean and infamous,
sentence: عُتُلٍّۭ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ زَنِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Who is stubborn and rude, one residing among his people without being related to them.

translation: Simply because he possesses wealth and children.
sentence: أَن كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Just because he is a person of wealth and many sons, he is too arrogant to have faith in Allah and in His Messenger.

translation: When you recite Our revelations to him, he says: "These are fables of long ago."
sentence: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When My verses are read to him, he says, “This are the tales written of the people of the past.”

translation: We shall brand him on the muzzle.
sentence: سَنَسِمُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلْخُرْطُومِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will place a mark on his nose which will stick with him and disfigure him.

translation: We have tried you as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed to gather the fruits in the morning
sentence: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, I have tested these idolaters with drought and hunger, just as I tested the people of the garden when they swore that they will quickly harvest its fruits in the morning, so that the poor cannot eat from them.

translation: But did not add: "If God may please."
sentence: وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They did not attribute the matter to Allah among themselves, by saying: “If Allah wills”.

translation: Then a calamity from your Lord fell upon it, but they remained fast asleep.
sentence: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So I sent a fire to the garden which consumed it while its owners were asleep, unable to defend it.

translation: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.
sentence: فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَٱلصَّرِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It became black, like a dark night.

translation: At daybreak they called to each other:
sentence: فَتَنَادَوْا۟ مُصْبِحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In the morning, its owners called on each other.

translation: "If you want to gather the fruits, let us go early to the plantation."
sentence: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰرِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Saying, “Leave early towards your crop before the poor people arrive, if indeed, you wish to harvest your crops.”

translation: So they departed, talking in low voices:
sentence: فَٱنطَلَقُوا۟ وَهُمْ يَتَخَٰفَتُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So they made their way towards their crop quickly, talking among themselves in hushed tones.

translation: "Let no needy person come to you within it today."
sentence: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They were saying to one another: “No poor person should come to you at the garden today.”

translation: They left early in the morning bent on this purpose.
sentence: وَغَدَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَٰدِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They left in the early morning, determined not to let anyone get to their crops.

translation: When they saw (and did not recognise it) they said: "Surely we have lost the way.
sentence: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا لَضَآلُّونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, when they saw their crops having been burnt, they said to each other, “Surely, we have lost our way?!”

translation: No. In fact we have been deprived of it."
sentence: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Nay! We have been deprived of harvesting our crops because of us having been determined to prevent the poor from eating them.”

translation: One who was temperate among them, said: "Did I not say: 'Why don't you priase God?'"
sentence: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The most virtuous among them said, “Did I not tell you when you made up your mind to prevent the poor from your crops: “Why do you not glorify Allah and repent to Him?””

translation: "Glory to our Lord," they said; we were really in the wrong."
sentence: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They said, “Glory be to our Lord; indeed, we wronged ourselves when we decided to prevent the poor from the crops of our garden.”

translation: Then they started blaming one another,
sentence: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَٰوَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So they began to go back on their words out of regret.

translation: Saying: "Alas the woe, we were iniquitous.
sentence: قَالُوا۟ يَٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا طَٰغِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They said, regretfully, “How much we have lost! Indeed, we transgressed the limits by depriving the poor of their rights.”

translation: Maybe our Lord will give us better than this. We turn to our Lord in supplication."
sentence: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “It is hoped from our Lord that He gives us better than our garden in return. Indeed, we are desirous towards Him; we hope for forgiveness from Him and seek goodness from Him.”

translation: Such is Our chastisement; and the punishment of the Hereafter will be greater, if only they knew!
sentence: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I punish those who disobey Me just like I punished these people with the punishment of depravation. And indeed, the punishment of the afterlife is greater, if only they were to know its severity and permanence.

translation: For those who fear God there are pleasure gardens with their Lord.
sentence: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, those who are mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commands and refraining from the things He has not allowed, will have gardens of pleasure by their Lord, wherein they will live in permanent luxury.

translation: Should We treat those who submit and obey in the same way as those who are culpable?
sentence: أَفَنَجْعَلُ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ كَٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Should I make the Muslims the same as the disbelievers in terms of requital, as the idolaters of Makkah claim?

translation: What has come upon you that you judge in such a wise?
sentence: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O idolaters! What is wrong with you; how can you come to this oppressive, warped conclusion?

translation: Or have you a Book in which you read
sentence: أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَٰبٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do you have a book in which you read that there should be equality between the obedient and disobedient?

translation: That you can surely have whatever you choose?
sentence: إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in that book you would then have whatever you choose in the afterlife.

translation: Or have you taken a binding promise from Us which would hold till the Day of Judgement, that you will get whatever you demand?
sentence: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or, do you have covenants with Me weighted with oaths, that you will get whatever you decide for yourselves?

translation: Ask them: "Which of you is able to vouch for this?"
sentence: سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُم بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Ask those making these statement: “Who is their guarantor for this?”

translation: Or have they any partners? Let them bring their partners then, if what they say is true.
sentence: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَٰدِقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they have associates other than Allah who make them equal in requital with the believers? If so, they should bring forth these associates of theirs if they are true in their claim that they have made them equal in requital with the believers.

translation: On the day the great calamity befalls, and they are called to bow in homage, they will not be able to do so.
sentence: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the Day of Judgement, the horror will become clear and our Lord will expose a part of His Shin. The people will be invited to prostrate, so the believers will prostrate, but the disbelievers and hypocrites will remain standing, unable to prostrate.

translation: Lowered will be their eyes, disgrace overwhelming them. They had indeed been called to bow in homage when they were free of blame.
sentence: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَٰلِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Their eyesight will be humiliated; humiliation and regret will overcome them. Yet in the world, they were asked to prostrate to Allah while they were in safety from what they will be facing on that day.

translation: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me. We shall lead them step by step to (ruin) in a way they will not know.
sentence: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Leave me to deal with whoever denies this Qur’ān that has been revealed to you. I will drive them to the punishment gradually, in a way they do not realise that it is a method of leading them gradually into destruction.

translation: Yet I will give them respite: Surely My plan is compact.
sentence: وَأُمْلِى لَهُمْ إِنَّ كَيْدِى مَتِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I give them respite for a short while so that they go to extremes in their sin. Indeed, My plan regarding the people of disbelief and rejection is firm; they will not escape Me nor be safe from My punishment.

translation: Do you ask for any compensation from them that they are burdened with want?
sentence: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Do you seek a reward from them for what you invite them towards, due to which they are greatly burdened, being the cause of their turning away from you? The reality is the opposite: you do not seek any reward from them; so what stops them from following you?

translation: Or do they have knowledge of the unknown which they copy down?
sentence: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or do they have knowledge of the Ghaib from which they write whatever proof appeal to them, that they then use to argue against you?

translation: So wait with patience for the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like (onah) of the fish who called (to his Lord) when he was choked with anger.
sentence: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! So wait for the decision of your Lord to give them respite and gradually lead them into destruction. And do not be like the companion of the whale i.e. Jonah (peace be upon him) who became annoyed with his people, and then called out to his Lord while distressed in the darkness of the sea and the darkness of the stomach of the whale.

translation: Had it not been for a favour from his Lord he would have been cast blame-worthy on a barren plain.
sentence: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Had it not been for the mercy of Allah reaching him, the whale would have thrown him on a barren land, rebuked.

translation: Then his Lord chose him and placed him among the upright.
sentence: فَٱجْتَبَٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَجَعَلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But his Lord chose him and made him one of His pious servants.

translation: But the unbelievers would like to stare you out of balance when they hear the warning, and say: "Surely he is possessed;"
sentence: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, those who disbelieve in Allah and reject his Messengers could almost bring you to the ground with their eyes due to their extremely sharp glances towards you when they hear this Qur’ān that was revealed to you. While following their desires and turning away from the truth, they say, “Indeed, the Messenger who has brought it is a madman.”

translation: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
sentence: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Yet the Qur’ān that has been revealed to you is only a reminder and admonition for the humans and the Jinn.

translation: THE CONCRETE REALITY.
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah mentions the hour or resurrection that will occur on everyone.

translation: What is the concrete reality?
sentence: مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then He enhances its importance by asking this question: ‘What is al-Ḥāq-qah?’

translation: What do you comprehend by the concrete reality?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Has anyone taught you about this al-Ḥāq-qah?

translation: The Thamud and 'Ad denied the consequential calamity.
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌۢ بِٱلْقَارِعَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Thamūd, the people of Saleh, and the ‘Ād, the people of Hud all denied the Day of Judgement that will strike the people with its severe horrors.

translation: So destroyed were the Thamud by a storm of thunder and lightning;
sentence: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the Thamūd, Allah destroyed them with a scream that reached the height of severity and horror.

translation: And the 'Ad were destroyed by the furious cold blast of roaring wind
sentence: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the ‘Ād, Allah destroyed them with a severely cold, relentless wind that reached the height of harshness upon them.

translation: Which He sent to assail them for seven nights and eight days running. You should have seen the people prostrate like the decayed trunks of date-palm trees.
sentence: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah released it upon them for seven nights and eight days, destroying them all. You would have seen the people destroyed in their homes, thrown onto the ground by the wind; as if they were the decomposed trunks of date palms fallen to the ground.

translation: Do you see any trace of them?
sentence: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do you see anyone of them remaining, after the punishment that afflicted them?

translation: Then came the Pharaoh, and those before him whose habitations were overthrown while they were committing crimes.
sentence: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh and the nations before him, and the communities that were punished by being turned upside down i.e. the people of Lot, all committed wrong acts in ascribing partners with Allah and sins.

translation: When they disobeyed the apostle of their Lord He seized them with an overwhelming punishment.
sentence: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Each of them disobeyed their Messengers who were sent to them and rejected them, so Allah seized them with a seizing that exceeded the force required to destroy them.

translation: When the water rose in flood, We bore you in the ark,
sentence: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, when the water exceeded its limit in rising, I carried those of you who were in their backs on the ark that floated and which Noah (peace be upon him) built upon My command. So in effect, I carried you.

translation: In order to make it a warning for you, and that the ear retentive may preserve it.
sentence: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So that I could let the ark and its tale become a lesson through which proof of the destruction of the people of disbelief could be taken, together with the saving of the people of faith, and so attentive ears could take heed.

translation: When the single blast is sounded on the trumpet,
sentence: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when the appointed angel will blow into the trumpet once, being the second blowing.

translation: And the earth and mountains heaved and crushed to powder with one levelling blow,
sentence: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the earth and mountains are raised, then crushed with one severe blow, the earth and its mountains will turn to pieces.

translation: On that Day will come what is to come.
sentence: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ ٱلْوَاقِعَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when all that happens, the Day of Judgement will occur.

translation: The sky will cleave asunder on that day and fall to pieces.
sentence: وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَهِىَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the sky will crack open on that day because of the angels descending from it. So on that day it will be weak, whereas it was once solid and unyielding.

translation: On its fringes will be angels, eight of them, bearing their Lord's throne aloft.
sentence: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَٰنِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The angels will be on its edges and corners. Eight elite angels will carry the throne of your Lord on that great day.

translation: You will then be set before Him, and not one of you will remain unexposed.
sentence: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people! On that Day, you will be exhibited for judgemen]; not hidden among you is anything concealed, rather Allah will be fully aware and watchful of it.

translation: He who is given his ledger in his right hand, will say: "Here, read my ledger.
sentence: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَٰبِيَهْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the one who is given his book of deeds in his right hand, he will say out of happiness and delight, “Take and read my book of deeds!”

translation: I was certain I'll be given my account."
sentence: إِنِّى ظَنَنتُ أَنِّى مُلَٰقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, I did good deeds in the world and was convinced of being resurrected and having to meet my reward.”

translation: So he shall have an agreeable life
sentence: فَهُوَ فِى عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So he will be living in a contented manner because of seeing the everlasting favours.

translation: In high empyrean
sentence: فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In a Paradise elevated in position and rank.

translation: With fruits hanging low within reach,
sentence: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The fruits of which will be near to those intending to consume them.

translation: (And told:) "Eat and drink to your fill as reward for (good) deeds you had done in days of yore."
sentence: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said to them in hospitality, “Eat and drink carefree of any ill repercussions due to the good deeds you sent forth in the days passed in the world.”

translation: But whosoever gets his ledger in his left hand, will say: "Would that I were never given my ledger,
sentence: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the one who will be given his book of deeds in his left hand, he will say out of extreme regret, “If only I had not been given my book of deeds, because of the evil deeds deserving punishment within it.”

translation: And not known my account!
sentence: وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And if only I did not know what the result of my giving account was.”

translation: I wish death had put an end to me.
sentence: يَٰلَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلْقَاضِيَةَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “If only the death I died, was the final one after which I was never resurrected.”

translation: Of no use was even my wealth.
sentence: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّى مَالِيَهْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “My wealth did not protect me at all from the punishment of Allah.”

translation: Vanished has my power from me."
sentence: هَلَكَ عَنِّى سُلْطَٰنِيَهْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “My evidence has deserted me, as well as all the strength and dignity.”

translation: "Seize him and manacle him,
sentence: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And it will be said, “O angels! Grab him and gather his hands at his neck.”

translation: Then cast him to be burnt in Hell;
sentence: ثُمَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Then enter him into the hellfire so that he sees its heat.”

translation: And string him to a chain seventy cubits long.
sentence: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Then chain him up with a chain measuring seventy cubits in length.”

translation: He did not believe in God the supreme,
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, he would not believe in Allah the Great.”

translation: Nor urged others to feed the poor.
sentence: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Neither would he encourage others to feed the poor.”

translation: That is why he has no friend today,
sentence: فَلَيْسَ لَهُ ٱلْيَوْمَ هَٰهُنَا حَمِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So on the Day of Judgement, he will have no relative to save him from the punishment.

translation: Nor food other than suppuration (filth)
sentence: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Neither will he have any food to eat except the fluid flowing from the bodies of the people of the hellfire.

translation: Which none but the hellish eat."
sentence: لَّا يَأْكُلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْخَٰطِـُٔونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Only the sinners will eat from that food.

translation: So, I call to witness what you see
sentence: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on whatever you see.

translation: And what you do not see,
sentence: وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on whatever you cannot see.

translation: That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger,
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That indeed, the Qur’ān is the speech of Allah, which His noble Messenger recites to the people.

translation: And not the word of a poet. How little is it that you believe!
sentence: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not the speech of a poet because it is not on the pattern of a poem; little do you believe!

translation: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer. Little is it that you reflect!
sentence: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Neither is it the speech of a fortune teller because the speech of fortune tellers is different to that of this Qur’ān; little do you take heed!

translation: It has been sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: تَنزِيلٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Rather, it is a revelation from the Lord of all creation.

translation: Had he attributed falsely any words to Us,
sentence: وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ ٱلْأَقَاوِيلِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And if Muhammad was to fabricate lies and attribute them to Me, which I had not said.

translation: We would have seized him by his right hand,
sentence: لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِٱلْيَمِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I would definitely take forceful and due retribution from him.

translation: Then cut off his aorta,
sentence: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ ٱلْوَتِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then I would cut the vein connected to his heart.

translation: And not one of you would have been able to stop (Us).
sentence: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَٰجِزِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But none of you can protect him from Me, so it is far-fetched that he fabricates lies because of you.

translation: It is really a reminder for those who fear God and follow the straight path.
sentence: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذْكِرَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, the Qur’ān is an admonition for those who are mindful of their Lord by fulfilling His commands and refraining from the things He has not allowed.

translation: We certainly know that some among you do deny it.
sentence: وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I know that there are definitely people among you who reject this Qur’ān.

translation: It is surely the nemesis of unbelievers.
sentence: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, rejection of this Qur’ān will be a means of great regret on the Day of Judgement.

translation: And He, He is indeed the ultimate Reality.
sentence: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلْيَقِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the Qur’ān is the certain truth: there is no doubt and dispute that it is from Allah.

translation: So glorify your Lord, the most supreme.
sentence: فَسَبِّحْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! So proclaim the purity of you Lord of whatever is not befitting of Him, and remember His great name.

translation: AN INQUIRER ASKED for the affliction that is to come
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَآئِلٌۢ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A caller from the idolaters called for the punishment upon himself and his people if this punishment was to actually come. It was a mockery on his part, but it will happen on the Day of Judgement.

translation: Upon the infidels -- which none would be able to repel --
sentence: لِّلْكَٰفِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will fall upon the disbelievers in Allah. There will be no one to avert this punishment.

translation: From God, the Lord of the steps (of progression),
sentence: مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِى ٱلْمَعَارِجِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: From Allah the possessor of highness, ranks, virtues and favours.

translation: To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend, whose length is fifty thousand years.
sentence: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The angels and Gabriel will ascend in them ranks on the Day of Judgement: it is a day of which the duration is fifty thousand years.

translation: So persevere with becoming patience.
sentence: فَٱصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! So be patient; a patience free of worry and complaint.

translation: They surely take it to be far away,
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُۥ بَعِيدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, they think of this punishment to be farfetched and impossible.

translation: But We see it very near.
sentence: وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِيبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But I see it as being near and inevitably occurring.

translation: The day the sky becomes like molten brass,
sentence: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ كَٱلْمُهْلِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when the sky will be like molten copper, gold and other metals.

translation: The mountains like the tufts of (carded) wool,
sentence: وَتَكُونُ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَٱلْعِهْنِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the mountains will be light, like cotton.

translation: And no friend inquires after friend
sentence: وَلَا يَسْـَٔلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: No relative will ask another regarding his state, because each person will be preoccupied with his own self.

translation: Though within sight of one another. The sinner would like to ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his sons,
sentence: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Each human will see their relatives clearly, yet despite that no one will ask another due to the horror of the scenario. The one deserving of the hellfire will wish to present his children to the punishment instead of himself.

translation: His wife and his brother,
sentence: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَأَخِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or give his wife and brother in ransom.

translation: And his family who had stood by him,
sentence: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ ٱلَّتِى تُـْٔوِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or his closest relatives who would stand with him in the face of difficulties.

translation: And all those who are on the earth, to save himself.
sentence: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he will wish to give every human and Jinn on earth in ransom, wishing that it would save him from the punishment of the hellfire.

translation: But never. It is pure white flame
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will not be as this criminal will wish for. Indeed, it is the fire of the afterlife which blazes and flares up.

translation: That would skin the scalp.
sentence: نَزَّاعَةً لِّلشَّوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Due to its extreme heat and flares, the skin of the head will come clean apart.

translation: It will summon whoever turns his back and flees,
sentence: تَدْعُوا۟ مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will call out to whoever turned away from the truth, distanced himself from it, did not bring faith in it nor acted upon it.

translation: Who amasses and then hoards.
sentence: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوْعَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And whoever amassed wealth, withholding from spending it in the path of Allah.

translation: Surely man is greedy by nature.
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, man has been created extremely greedy.

translation: If evil befalls him he is perturbed;
sentence: إِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلشَّرُّ جَزُوعًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When a difficulty i.e. illness or poverty befalls him, he shows little patience.

translation: If good comes to him he holds back his hand,
sentence: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And when something that makes him happy comes to him, i.e. fertility and wealth, he is very resistant in spending it in the path of Allah.

translation: Except those who closely follow (the Book of God),
sentence: إِلَّا ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for those who perform prayer; they are safe from these blameworthy traits.

translation: Who persevere in devotion,
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَآئِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who are punctual with their prayers; they are not distracted from them and they perform them at their fixed times.

translation: In whose wealth a due share is included
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ فِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ حَقٌّ مَّعْلُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who have a set, determined amount of their wealth.

translation: For the needy and those dispossessed,
sentence: لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Which they give to whoever asks them or doesn’t, but are deprived of sustenance for whatever reason.

translation: And those who believe in the Day of Judgement,
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who believe in the Day of Judgement: the day Allah will requite everyone with whatever they deserve.

translation: And those who fear the punishment of their Lord, --
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord, despite having sent forth good deeds.

translation: Surely no one can be secure from the punishment of his Lord, --
sentence: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, no intelligent person feels safe from the punishment of his Lord.

translation: And those who guard their sex except from their wives and women slaves of old
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَٰفِظُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who safeguard their private parts by concealing them and keeping them away from shameful acts.

translation: Are free of blame,
sentence: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except from their wives or the servant girls they possess, because they are not blameworthy in enjoying them through sexual intercourse or anything less.

translation: But those who seek more than this will be transgressors;
sentence: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Whoever seeks pleasure in other than whatever has been mentioned i.e. wives and servant girls, they are the ones who have transgressed the limits of Allah.

translation: And those who fulfil their trusts and covenants,
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَٰنَٰتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَٰعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who, when entrusted with wealth, secrets etc., or with agreements they enter into, they uphold them: neither betraying their trusts nor breaking their agreements.

translation: Who uphold their testimonies,
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَٰدَٰتِهِمْ قَآئِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who give their testimonies in the manner sought from them, without being affected by relationships or enmity.

translation: And those who are mindful of their moral obligations.
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And those who are punctual in their prayers by performing them at their appropriate times, with due purity and composure, whilst not being distracted from them by anything.

translation: They will live in gardens with honour.
sentence: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ فِى جَنَّٰتٍ مُّكْرَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those possessing the aforementioned qualities will be honoured in gardens, attaining everlasting favours and being able to see the blessed Face of Allah.

translation: What is the matter with unbelievers that they stare at you with fixed gazes and hasten towards you
sentence: فَمَالِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What is it that has led these idolaters around you to reject you so quickly?

translation: In crowds, right and left?
sentence: عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Surrounding you from your right and left, in groups upon groups.

translation: Does every one of them wish to enter the garden of tranquility?
sentence: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do each of them hope that Allah will enter them into the garden of favours, wherein they shall live in luxury among the everlasting bounties, while they remain on their disbelief?

translation: Never so. We have created them from what they know.
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَٰهُم مِّمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not as they imagine. Indeed, I created them from what they know: I created them from a contemptible fluid, and they are weak: they are incapable of bringing benefit or harm for themselves, so how could they be arrogant?

translation: So I swear by the Lord of the Easts and the Wests that We are certainly able
sentence: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the Lord of the rising places of the sun and the moon. Indeed, Allah is the Capable.

translation: To bring better people than they in their place; and they will not be able to thwart Us.
sentence: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He is capable of destroying them and replacing them with others who obey Him; He is not incapable of doing so. Nor can He be overpowered when He intends to destroy them and replace them.

translation: So leave them to their vain disputes and amusement till they meet their day (of reckoning) promised them,
sentence: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! So leave them to dive into the falsehood and deviance they are already in, and to amuse themselves in their worldly lives, until they encounter the Day of Judgement that they have been promised in the Qur’ān.

translation: The day when they will come out of their graves in all haste as though rushing to their altars,
sentence: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when they shall leave their graves in a hurry, as if they are racing towards a banner.

translation: Eyes lowered, shame attending. That is the day they have been promised!
sentence: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Their eyes will be humiliated, and humiliation will envelop them. That is the day they were promised in the world, but they did not care about it.

translation: SENT NOAH to his people to warn them before the painful punishment came upon them.
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, I sent Noah to his people, inviting them so that he may warn them before a painful punishment afflicts them due to their state of ascribing partners to Allah.

translation: He said: "O my people, I warn you clearly
sentence: قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Noah said to his people, “O my people! Indeed, I am a clear warner for you of the punishment of Allah that awaits you if you do not repent to Him.”

translation: That you should worship God and fear Him, and follow me
sentence: أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And the gist of my warning to you is: “Worship Allah alone and do not ascribe any partners to Him; be mindful of Him by fulfilling His commands and refraining from the things He has not allowed, and obey me in whatever I instruct you to do.”

translation: That He may forgive some of your sins and prolong your term till an appointed time. Surely when God's appointed time is come it will not be put off, if only you knew!
sentence: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Indeed, if you do that, Allah will forgive your sins for you in relation to other than violating the rights of the people. He will also prolong the lifespan of your nations until a time fixed according to His knowledge, wherein you shall populate the earth as long as you remain steadfast on it. Indeed, when death comes, it does not delay. If you truly knew, you would hasten to bringing faith in Allah and repenting to Him from your states of ascribing partners to Him and of deviance.”

translation: He said: "O Lord, I called my people night and day,
sentence: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Noah said, “O my Lord! Indeed, I called my people to Your worship and oneness, continuously, day and night.”

translation: But the more I called, they only ran the farther away.
sentence: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “But my calling them only increased them in alienation and distanced them from what I called them towards.”

translation: And every time I called them that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears, and covered themselves with their garments, and became wayward, and behaved with downright insolence.
sentence: وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And whenever I called them towards that which meant forgiveness for their sins, i.e. worshipping You alone, obedience to You and Your Messenger, they blocked their ears with their fingers so that they could not hear my call. They also covered their faces with their clothes so that they could not see me, and they continued in their ascribing partners to you, showing arrogance in not accepting my call to them or submitting to it.”

translation: Then I called them loudly and more openly,
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O my Lord! I then invited them publicly.”

translation: And declared to them in public and in private,
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I invited them raising my voice, and I also invited them privately in a hushed tone. I used different methods of calling them.”

translation: And I told them: 'Ask your Lord to forgive you. He is verily forgiving.
sentence: فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then I said to them, “O my people! Seek the forgiveness of your Lord by turning to Him. Indeed, He, may He be glorified, is the oft-Forgiving of the sins of whichever of His servants repents to Him.”

translation: He will send you abundant rain from the sky,
sentence: يُرْسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Because if you do that, Allah will send down frequent rainfall for you, whenever you need it, so you will never face a drought.”

translation: And will give you increase of wealth and sons, and give you gardens and springs of water.
sentence: وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّٰتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَٰرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And He will grant you an abundance of wealth and offspring, make gardens grow for you from which you can consume fruits, and make rivers flow from which you can drink and irrigate your crops and livestock.”

translation: What has come upon you that you do not fear the majesty of God,
sentence: مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O my people! What is wrong with you that you do not fear the greatness of Allah, such that you disobey Him without any care?!”

translation: Knowing that He has created you by various stages?
sentence: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “While He created you in stages, one after the other: a drop of semen, then clotted blood, then a piece of flesh.”

translation: Do you not see how God has fashioned seven skies one above the other,
sentence: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٍ طِبَاقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Do you not see how Allah has created the seven heavens, one on top of the other?”

translation: And has placed the moon therein, an illumination, and has placed the sun, a lighted lamp?
sentence: وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And He made the moon a light for the people of the earth, in the nearest of the heavens, also making the sun illuminating.”

translation: God produced you from the earth like a vegetable growth;
sentence: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And Allah is the one who created you from the earth, by creating your father Adam from soil. Then, you are also nourished by whatever it grows for you.”

translation: He will then return you back to it, and bring you out again.
sentence: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Allah will then return you to it after your death, and then take you out of it again for the resurrection.”

translation: God has made the earth for you a spreading,
sentence: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And Allah also spread the earth out for you, ready for you to live on.”

translation: So that you may walk upon its spacious paths.'
sentence: لِّتَسْلُكُوا۟ مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Perhaps you may create wide paths from it, striving to make permissible earnings.”

translation: But they did not listen to me," Noah said, "and followed him whose wealth and children only added to his ruin.
sentence: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِى وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Noah said, “O my Lord! Indeed, my people have disobeyed me in what I have instructed them to do i.e. accepting Your oneness and worshipping You alone. The lowly among them have followed the nobles, whom You have favoured with wealth and offspring. Your favouring them has only increased them in their deviance.”

translation: And they contrived a plot of great magnitude,
sentence: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The elders among them hatched a great plot by inciting the lowly against Noah.

translation: And said: 'Do not abandon your gods, and do not abandon Wadda or Suwa', or Yaghuth, Ya'uq or Nasr.'
sentence: وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They said to their followers, “Do not leave the worship of your deities: do not leave the worship of your idols Wadd, Suwā‘, Yaghūth and Nasr.”

translation: And they misled many. So do not give the evil-doers increase but in error.
sentence: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِيرًا وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Verily, they have led the majority of people astray with these idols. O my Lord! Do not increase those who wrong themselves by persisting on disbelief and sins, except in further deviance from the truth.”

translation: They were drowned because of their habitual sinfulness, and sent to Hell, and did not find any helper other than God.
sentence: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا۟ فَأُدْخِلُوا۟ نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Due to the sins they committed, they were drowned by a flood in the world, and they were made to enter the hellfire immediately after their death. They did not find any helpers to save them from drowning or the hellfire.

translation: Noah said: "O Lord, do not leave a single habitation of unbelievers on the earth.
sentence: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And when Allah informed him that no one will ever bring faith from his people, except those had already brought faith, Noah said, “O my Lord! Do not leave any disbeliever walking or moving on earth.”

translation: If you leave them, they will lead Your creatures astray, and beget but iniquitous and ungrateful offspring.
sentence: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O my Lord! If you leave them and give them respite, they will lead your believing servants astray and will only give birth to more transgressors who will not obey You, or extreme ungrateful ones who will not show gratitude for Your favours.”

translation: O Lord, forgive me, my parents, and any one who enters my house as a believer, and all believing men and women, and do not give the evil-doers increase save in ruin.
sentence: رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِىَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًۢا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “O my Lord! Forgive my sins, forgive my parents, and forgive the one who enters my house as a believer. Also forgive the believing men and women, and do not increase those who wrong themselves by disbelief and sins except in destruction and loss.”

translation: SAY: "I HAVE been informed that a number of jinns had listened; then said: 'We have heard the wondrous Qur'an,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أُوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْءَانًا عَجَبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say, O Messenger, to your nation: Allah revealed to me that a group of Jinn listened to my recitation of the Qur’ān in Batn Nakhla. When they went back to their people they said to them: We have heard a recited speech that is impressive in its clarity and eloquence.

translation: Which guides to the right path; and we have come to believe in it, and will not associate any one with our Lord.
sentence: يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشْدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This speech that we heard guides to the correct belief, statements and actions, so we believed in it and we will not associate any partner with our Lord Who revealed it.

translation: Exalted is the glory of our Lord; He has neither wife nor son.
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We have believed that He - exalted be the grandeur and majesty of our Lord - has not taken any wife nor child as the idolaters say.

translation: Certainly the foolish among us say preposterous things of God.
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that Iblis made an errant statement about Allah by attributing a wife and child to Him, may He be glorified.

translation: We had in fact thought that men and jinns would never speak a lie about God,
sentence: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلْإِنسُ وَٱلْجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that we thought that the idolaters from among mankind and the jinn were not speaking lies when they claimed that He had a wife and child, so we accepted their statement blindly following them.

translation: But some men used to seek refuge with some jinns, and this increased their waywardness;
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ ٱلْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that in the period of ignorance, some men from mankind used to seek protection in the jinn when they came to a frightening place. One of them would say: I seek protection in the leader of this valley from the evil of the foolish ones of his people. As a result, human beings became more afraid and terrified of the jinn.

translation: So they began to think, even as you do, that God would not resurrect any one.
sentence: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا۟ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that humans thought as you did, O jinn, that Allah will not resurrect anyone after his death for the reckoning and recompense.

translation: We sought to pry into the secrets of the heavens, but found it full of fierce guards and shooting flames.
sentence: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدْنَٰهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that we sought the news of the heaven and we found the sky full of stern guards, who were the angels, who guarded it from the eavesdropping that we used to do, and full of flaming fires thrown at everyone who comes close to the sky.

translation: We sat in observatories to listen; but any one who listened found a shooting star in wait for him.
sentence: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ ٱلْءَانَ يَجِدْ لَهُۥ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that we in the past used to assume positions in the sky from where we could hear what the angels were deliberating, and then we would convey this to the fortune-tellers on earth. Now things have changed. Anyone of us who now tries to listen finds a flaming fire ready for him. When he goes near, it is released on him and he is burnt by it.

translation: We do not know if this means ill for the dwellers of the earth, or their Lord wishes guidance for them.
sentence: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِىٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that we do not know what is the cause of this stern guard, is it that evil is intended for those on earth, or does Allah intend good for them. News of the sky has been cut off from us.

translation: For some of us are upright and some otherwise: Surely we follow different ways.
sentence: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that we - the group of jinn-: some of us are Allah-conscious and righteous whilst some of us are disbelievers and sinners. We are of different types and of diverse persuasions.

translation: We realised that we could not weaken the power of God on earth, nor outpace Him by running away.
sentence: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُۥ هَرَبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that we are certain that we cannot escape Allah, may He be glorified, when He intends some matter for us. We will never be able to escape Him by fleeing because He surrounds us.

translation: So when we heard the guidance we believed in it; and he who believes in his Lord will neither fear loss nor force.
sentence: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ فَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that when we heard the Qur’ān that guides to what is most upright we had faith in it. Whoever has faith in his Lord will not fear any loss of his good deeds and nor any sin that will be added to his prior sins.

translation: Some of us have come to submission, and some of us are iniquitous.'" Those who have submitted have taken the right course;
sentence: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا۟ رَشَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that some of us submit and follow Allah by obeying Him, and some of us go astray from the path of moderation and steadfastness. Those who submit to Allah by following him and doing righteous actions, they are the ones who have sought after guidance and the right way.

translation: But those who are iniquitous will be fuel for Hell.
sentence: وَأَمَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا۟ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who go astray from the path of moderation and steadfastness, they will be firewood that will be used to light the fire of Hell together with other human beings like them.

translation: (Say): "If they keep to the right path We shall give them water in abundance to drink
sentence: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسْتَقَٰمُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Just as I revealed to him that a group of the jinn listened to him, I revealed to him that if human beings and the jinn remained steadfast on the path of Islam, and practiced on what it contained, then Allah would have given them plenty water to drink and provided them with various blessings.

translation: In order to try them through it. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, will be given increasing torment by Him."
sentence: لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: To test them in that, are they thankful for Allah’s favours or are they ungrateful for them? Whoever turns away from the Qur’ān and the admonitions it contains, His Lord will enter him into a difficult punishment that he will not be able to bear.

translation: All places of worship are for God; so do not invoke any one with God.
sentence: وَأَنَّ ٱلْمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that the mosques belong to Him (may He be glorified) and not to anyone else. So do not call on anyone together with Allah and become like the Jews and the Christians in their synagogues and churches.

translation: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).
sentence: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا۟ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And that when Allah’s servant, Muhammad (peace be on him) stood up to worship His Lord in Batn Nakhla, the jinn were almost piled on top of him because of the huge crowd when they heard him reciting the Qur’ān.

translation: Say: "I call on my Lord alone and I do not associate any one with Him."
sentence: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these idolaters: I only call unto my Lord alone and I do not associate anyone else as partner to Him in worship, whoever he may be.

translation: Say: "Neither is your loss within my power nor bringing you to guidance."
sentence: قُلْ إِنِّى لَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say to them: I do not have any power to ward off any harm that Allah has decreed for you, nor do I have any power to draw any benefit that Allah has withheld from you.

translation: Say: "No one can save me from God, nor can I find a place of refuge apart from Him,
sentence: قُلْ إِنِّى لَن يُجِيرَنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say to them: No one can save me from Allah if I go against Him, and I will never find any place of refuge to take refuge in besides Him.

translation: Unless I convey from God and deliver His message." For those who disobey God and His Apostle is the fire of Hell, where they will abide for ever;
sentence: إِلَّا بَلَٰغًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦ وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But that which is in my power is to convey to you what Allah has instructed me to convey to you, and His message that He sent with me to you. Whoever goes against Allah and His messenger, his fate is entry into the fire of Hell to remain their forever and never come out.

translation: Until they see what they are promised, when they will understand who is weaker in aid and poorer in numbers.
sentence: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The disbelievers will persist in their disbelief until when they see on the day of judgment the punishment that they were warned of in the world. At that time, they will come to know who has the weaker protector and they will come to know who has less helpers.

translation: Say: "I do not know if what is promised you is near, or if my Lord prolongs its term.
sentence: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَمَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Say to these idolaters who reject the resurrection: I do not know whether the punishment you are warned of is near, or whether it has a fixed time that only Allah knows.

translation: He is the knower of the Unknown, and He does not divulge His secret to any one
sentence: عَٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He (may He be glorified) is the knower of the Ghaib, all of it. Nothing of it is hidden from Him. He does not disclose His Ghaib to anyone, but keeps it in His exclusive knowledge.

translation: Other than an apostle He has chosen, when He makes a sentinel walk in front of him and a sentinel behind,
sentence: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسْلُكُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ رَصَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for a messenger whom He, may He be glorified, selects and then discloses to him what He wishes. He sends guards from the angels to go before the messenger and protect him so that no one besides the messenger gains access to this.

translation: So that He may know if they have delivered their Lord's messages. He comprehends all that has been given them, and keeps count of everything.
sentence: لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا۟ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عَدَدًۢا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This is done in the hope that the messenger may know that the messengers before him had conveyed the messages of their Lord that He had instructed them to convey because of the care that Allah gave to it. Allah’s knowledge surrounds whatever is with the angels and messengers. Nothing of that is hidden from Him. He has counted the number of everything, so that nothing is hidden from Him, may He be glorified.

translation: O YOU ENWRAPPED in the cloak (of Prophethood),
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُزَّمِّلُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O you wrapped up in your clothes (i.e. the Prophet (peace be upon him)).

translation: Keep watch all the night except some,
sentence: قُمِ ٱلَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Offer prayer at night except for a little part of it.

translation: A half of it or a little less
sentence: نِّصْفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pray for half of it if you wish, or pray for a little less than half until you reach one third.

translation: Or a little more, and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.
sentence: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَرْتِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or increase it until you reach two thirds. Make the Qur’ān clear when you recite it and recite it slowly.

translation: We shall soon entrust to you a message heavy (with solemnity).
sentence: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِى عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I am going to send down on you, O Messenger, the Qur’ān, which is a heavy word, due to the obligations, limits, provisions, etiquettes etc. that it contains.

translation: Surely in the watches of the night the soul is most receptive and words more telling.
sentence: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ هِىَ أَشَدُّ وَطْـًٔا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The hours of the night are more suited to the heart for recitation and more correct in speech.

translation: Indeed during the day you have a long schedule of occupations.
sentence: إِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In the day you are busy in your work, and are distracted from reciting the Qur’ān, so pray at night.

translation: But recite the name of your Lord withdrawing yourself from everything, devoting yourself exclusively to Him.
sentence: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Remember Allah with various forms of remembrance, and devote yourself to Him (may He be glorified) fully by making your worship solely for Him.

translation: He is the Lord of the East and the West. There is no god but He. So take Him alone as your protector.
sentence: رَّبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West. There is none deserving of worship besides Him. So take Him as a Trustee Whom you rely on in all your affairs.

translation: Bear with patience what they say, and gracefully come away from them.
sentence: وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Be patient over the mockery and abuse uttered by those who deny, and leave them in a manner that causes no harm.

translation: Leave those to Me who deny, the lovers of ease and comfort; and bear with them for a while.
sentence: وَذَرْنِى وَٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُو۟لِى ٱلنَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do not be concerned about the state of those who deny, those who enjoy the pleasures of the world. Leave them to Me and wait a little for them until their appointed time comes.

translation: Verily We shall have fetters with Us, and a roaring furnace,
sentence: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَآ أَنكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In the afterlife, I have heavy chains and a blazing fire.

translation: And food that will stick in the throat, and painful torment
sentence: وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And a food that chokes the throats because of its extreme bitterness, and a painful punishment, in addition to the above.

translation: On the day the earth and mountains will rock violently, and the mountains turn to a heap of poured-out sand.
sentence: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That punishment will occur to those who deny on the day when the earth and the mountains will shake and the mountains will become scattered flowing sand because of its extreme horror.

translation: We have sent an Apostle to you as a witness against you, as We had sent an apostle to the Pharaoh.
sentence: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have sent to you a messenger as a witness over your actions on the day of judgment just as I sent to Pharaoh a messenger, who was Moses, (peace be upon him).

translation: But the Pharaoh disobeyed the apostle; so We seized him with a grievous punishment.
sentence: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَٰهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But Pharaoh went against the messenger who was sent to him from his Lord, so I punished him with a severe punishment in the world by drowning and in the afterlife by the punishment of the fire. So you do not go against your messenger or you will be afflicted by what afflicted him.

translation: How then, if you disbelieve, will you preserve yourselves on the day which will even turn the children hoary?
sentence: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ ٱلْوِلْدَٰنَ شِيبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So how will you protect yourselves - if you reject Allah and deny His messenger - from a long, severe day that will make the head of young children white because of the severity of its horror and its length.

translation: The heavens itself will be rent asunder (on that day). His promise is bound to be fulfilled.
sentence: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرٌۢ بِهِۦ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَفْعُولًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The sky will split because of its horror. Allah’s promise will be inevitably fulfilled.

translation: Verily this is a reminder. So let him who desires take the way to his Lord.
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This admonition - containing an exposition of the horror and severity of the day of judgment - is a reminder that is of benefit to the believers. So whoever wishes to take a path that leads to His Lord let him do so.

translation: Your Lord surely knows that you are occupied with your devotions for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or one-third of it, as do many others with you. Yet God prescribes the measure of night and day. He knows you cannot calculate it, and so turns to you in benevolence. So recite as much of the Qur'an as you can easily. He knows some among you will be sick, and some will be travelling over the earth in search of the bounty of God, and some fighting in the way of God. So read as much from it as you can easily, and be firm in devotion, pay the zakat, and lend a goodly loan to God. And what you send for yourself of the good, you will find it with God better and greater in reward. So ask for God's forgiveness. Indeed God is forgiving and kind.
