sentence: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَىِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٌ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌۢ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Your Lord, O Messenger, knows that you sometimes spend less than two thirds of the night in prayer, sometimes you stand for half the night, sometimes a third, and a group of the believers stand with you. Allah determines the night and day and counts their hours. He (may He be glorified) knows that you are not able to count and keep a record of its hours, and thus standing for the most part of it seeking the required will be difficult for you. He therefore has accepted your repentance. So pray at night as much as is easy for you. Allah knows that some of you, O believers, may be ill and constrained by illness - others will be travelling seeking Allah’s provision, and others will be fighting the disbelievers seeking Allah’s pleasure and to promote Allah’s word. For these people standing in prayer at night is difficult, so pray at night as much as is easy for you and discharge the obligatory prayer in the most perfect manner. Give the charity of your wealth and spend from your wealth in Allah’s path. Whatever good you send forward for yourselves, you will find it to be better and greater in reward. Seek forgiveness from Allah. Allah Forgiving towards those of His servants who repent and He is merciful to them.

translation: O YOU ENFOLDED in your mantle (of reform),
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُدَّثِّرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O you who is covered with his clothes (this refers to the Prophet (peace be upon him)

translation: Arise and warn,
sentence: قُمْ فَأَنذِرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Arise and warn of Allah’s punishment.

translation: Glorify your Lord,
sentence: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Declare the greatness of your Lord.

translation: Purify your inner self,
sentence: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Purify yourself from sins and your clothes from impurities.

translation: And banish all trepidation.
sentence: وَٱلرُّجْزَ فَٱهْجُرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Keep away from the worship of idols.

translation: Do not bestow favours in expectation of return,
sentence: وَلَا تَمْنُن تَسْتَكْثِرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do not think that you have done a favour to your Lord by regarding your righteous actions to be plenty.

translation: And persevere in the way of your Lord.
sentence: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصْبِرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Be patient for Allah’s sake over the harm that you incur.

translation: For when the trumpet blows
sentence: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِى ٱلنَّاقُورِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the trumpet will be blown a second time.

translation: It will be a day of distress,
sentence: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That day will be a severe day.

translation: Dolorous for the unbelievers.
sentence: عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For those who reject Allah and His messengers it will not be easy.

translation: Leave him to Me whom I created alone,
sentence: ذَرْنِى وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Leave me, O Messenger, and the one whom I created alone in the womb of his mother without wealth or children (This refers to Walid bin Al Mughira).

translation: And gave him abundant wealth
sentence: وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُۥ مَالًا مَّمْدُودًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I gave him plenty wealth.

translation: And sons always present by his side,
sentence: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I gave him children who were present with him, who attended gatherings with him and who did not leave him on account of travel due to the abundance of his wealth.

translation: And made things easy for them.
sentence: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمْهِيدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I extended to him his livelihood, provision and children profusely.

translation: Yet he wants that I should give him more.
sentence: ثُمَّ يَطْمَعُ أَنْ أَزِيدَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then despite his denial of Me he desires that I give him more after I gave him all of that.

translation: Never. He is refractory of Our signs.
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِءَايَٰتِنَا عَنِيدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter is not as he thinks. He was opposed to My verses that I revealed to My messenger denying them.

translation: I shall inflict on him hardship,
sentence: سَأُرْهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will impose on him difficulty from a punishment that he will not be able to bear.

translation: For he had thought and calculated.
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This disbeliever whom I bestowed with those favours thought about what he should say in order to refute the Qur’ān, and planned this within himself.

translation: May he be accursed, how he planned!
sentence: فَقُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So may he be cursed and punished. How did he plan!

translation: May be then be accursed, how he plotted!
sentence: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Again, may he be cursed and punished. How did he plan!

translation: Then he looked around,
sentence: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then he reconsidered and carefully thought about what he should say.

translation: And frowned and puckered his brow,
sentence: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The he frowned and scowled when he did not find anything to challenge the Qur’ān with.

translation: Then turned his back and waxed proud,
sentence: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ وَٱسْتَكْبَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then he turned away from faith and was too proud to follow the Prophet (peace be upon him).

translation: And said: "This is nothing but the magic of old,
sentence: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He said: This what Muhammad brought is not Allah’s speech, but it is sorcery that he relates from others.

translation: Nothing more than the speech of a man!"
sentence: إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوْلُ ٱلْبَشَرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This is not Allah’s speech, but it is the speech of man.

translation: I will cast him into the fire of Hell.
sentence: سَأُصْلِيهِ سَقَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will enter this disbeliever into one of the levels of the Fire, which is Saqar, to suffer from its heat.

translation: What do you think Hell-fire is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What will tell you, O Muhammad, what Saqar is?!

translation: It leaves nothing, nor does it spare;
sentence: لَا تُبْقِى وَلَا تَذَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It does not spare any person that is punished in it except that it comes on him and does not leave him. Then he returns to how it was and it comes to him, again and again.

translation: It glows and burns the skin.
sentence: لَوَّاحَةٌ لِّلْبَشَرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It severely burns and alters skins.

translation: Over it are nineteen (guards).
sentence: عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There are nineteen angels over it who are its wardens.

translation: We have not appointed any one but angels as keepers of Hell, and their number that We have fixed is to make it a means of contention for disbelievers, so that those who were given the Book may be certain, and the faith of the believers may have greater increase, and the people of the Book and believers may not be deceived, and the sceptics and infidels may say: "What does God mean by this parable?" That is how God leads whosoever He will astray, and guides whosoever He will. None knows the armies of your Lord save Him self. This is no more than reminder for mankind.
sentence: وَمَا جَعَلْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةً وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَيَزْدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِيمَٰنًا وَلَا يَرْتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ وَٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًا كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ وَمَا هِىَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I did not make the wardens of the Fire except angels, so humans do not have the power to face them. Abu Jahl was lying when he and his people claimed that they have the ability to attack them and then they will come out of the Fire. I did not make this number of theirs except to test those who reject Allah, so that the Jews who were given the Torah and the Christians who were given the Gospel will become certain when the Qur’ān that confirms what is in their scriptures is revealed, so that the faith of the believers increases when the people of the scripture agree with them and the Jews, Christians and the believers do not have any doubt, and so that those who waver in faith and those who are disbelievers say: What does Allah intend by this strange number?! Just as those who deny this number are misguided and those who accept it are guided, Allah misguides whoever He wishes to misguide and He guides whoever He wishes to guide. No one knows the forces of your Lord, because of their huge number, besides Him, may He be glorified. So let Abu Jahl who, mockingly and dismissively, said, “Does Muhammad only have nineteen aides?!” know this. The Fire is only a reminder for human beings, through which they can come to know of Allah’s greatness, may He be glorified.

translation: I say the truth, and call the moon to witness,
sentence: كَلَّا وَٱلْقَمَرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The statement is not as claimed by some idolaters that he will suffice his companions against the wardens of Hell and take them out of it. Allah took an oath by the moon.

translation: And the night when on the wane,
sentence: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by the night when it departs.

translation: The morning when it is unveiled,
sentence: وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَآ أَسْفَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by the morning when it lights up.

translation: That (Hell) is surely one of the greater (signs),
sentence: إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى ٱلْكُبَرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The fire of Hell is one the great calamities.

translation: A warning for people --
sentence: نَذِيرًا لِّلْبَشَرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In order to strike terror and fear in people.

translation: Whoever of you desires to progress or lag behind.
sentence: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Whoever from amongst you, O people, wishes to go forward with faith in Allah and righteous actions, or to lag behind by disbelief and sins.

translation: Every soul is pledged to what it does,
sentence: كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Every soul will be taken to task for the actions that it did. Either its actions will destroy it or they will release and rescue it from destruction.

translation: Except those of the right hand
sentence: إِلَّآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْيَمِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for the believers, who wont be taken to task for their sins. Instead, these will be overlooked because of their righteous actions.

translation: Sitting in the gardens, asking
sentence: فِى جَنَّٰتٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the Day of Judgement, they will be in gardens asking one another.

translation: Of evil-doers:
sentence: عَنِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: About the disbelievers who destroyed themselves by the sins they committed.

translation: "What was it that brought you to Hell?"
sentence: مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِى سَقَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will say to them: What entered you into Hell?

translation: They will answer: "We did not fulfil our devotional obligations,
sentence: قَالُوا۟ لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The disbelievers will answer them saying: We were not of those who discharged the obligatory prayer in the worldly life.

translation: And did not feed the needy,
sentence: وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ ٱلْمِسْكِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We did not feed the poor from what Allah gave us.

translation: And plunged into useless things with those who were obstinate,
sentence: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلْخَآئِضِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We used to be with the people of falsehood and go wherever they go. We used to speak to the people of misguidance and deviation.

translation: And rejected the Day of Judgement as a lie
sentence: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We used to deny the day of recompense.

translation: Until the certainty (of death) had come upon us.
sentence: حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلْيَقِينُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We persisted in this denial until death came to us and prevented us from repenting.

translation: So, the intercession of intercessors will not avail them.
sentence: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمْ شَفَٰعَةُ ٱلشَّٰفِعِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the Day of Judgment, the mediation of intercessors from the angels, prophets and pious ones, will not benefit them, because the requirement for the acceptance of intercession is that the thing for which intercession is made must be approved.

translation: Why then do they turn away from the admonition
sentence: فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلتَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What has made these idolaters turn away from the Qur’ān?!

translation: As though they were frightened asses
sentence: كَأَنَّهُمْ حُمُرٌ مُّسْتَنفِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As if they, in their turning away from and aversion to it, are wild donkeys that are extremely resistant.

translation: Fleeing from a lion?
sentence: فَرَّتْ مِن قَسْوَرَةٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That have fled from a lion out of fear for it.

translation: In fact every one of them wants to be given open books (like the prophets).
sentence: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُّنَشَّرَةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Instead, each one of these idolaters wants for there to be an open book by his head side that tells him that Muhammad is a messenger from Allah. The reason for this is not the lack of proof or weakness of evidence. It is only obstinacy and pride.

translation: By no means. In fact they do not fear the Hereafter.
sentence: كَلَّا بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter is not like that. In fact, the reason for their persistence in their misguidance is that they do not have faith in the punishment of the afterlife, so they remained in their disbelief.

translation: Never so, as this is a reminder.
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذْكِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, this Qur’ān is an admonition and a reminder.

translation: Let him then who heeds remember it.
sentence: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Whoever wishes to read the Qur’ān and take lesson from it does so.

translation: But they will not remember except as God wills: He is worthy to be feared, and He is worthy of forgiving
sentence: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ هُوَ أَهْلُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: None takes lesson from it besides those whom Allah wills to take lesson. He (may He be glorified) is worthy of being mindful of by the fulfilment of His instructions and the avoidance of His prohibitions. He is worthy of forgiving the sins of His servants when they repent to Him.

translation: I CALL TO WITNESS the Day of Resurrection,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah took an oath by the Day of Judgement when people stand before the Lord of the worlds.

translation: And I call the reprehensive soul to witness:
sentence: وَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلنَّفْسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by the pure soul that reproaches its owner for falling short in righteous deeds and for doing wrong deeds. He took an oath by these two things that He will certainly resurrect people for reckoning and recompense.

translation: Does man think We shall not put his bones together?
sentence: أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does man think that I will not gather his bones to be resurrected after he dies?!

translation: Surely We are able to reform even his finger-tips.
sentence: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, I am able together with gathering them to restore his fingertips in a proportionate form just as they were.

translation: Yet man is sceptical of what is right before him.
sentence: بَلْ يُرِيدُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But man by his denial of the resurrection wants to continue sinning in the future unchecked.

translation: He asks: "When will the Day of Resurrection be?"
sentence: يَسْـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He skeptically asks about the Day of Judgement: When will it occur?

translation: Yet when the eyes are dazzled,
sentence: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلْبَصَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the sight is dazzled and astonished at the time when it sees what it used to deny.

translation: The moon eclipsed,
sentence: وَخَسَفَ ٱلْقَمَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the light of the moon disappears.

translation: And the sun and moon are conjoined,
sentence: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the mass of the sun and the moon are brought together.

translation: That day man will say: "Where can I find escape?"
sentence: يَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ ٱلْمَفَرُّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The sinning person will say on that day: Where is the escape?!

translation: Never so, for there will be no escape.
sentence: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There is no escape on that day and there is no place in which the sinner can take refuge nor any place that he can seek protection in.

translation: With your Lord alone will be the retreat on that day.
sentence: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمُسْتَقَرُّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The return and destination on that day will be to your Lord, O Messenger, for the reckoning and recompense.

translation: Then man will be told what he had sent ahead (of good) and what he had left behind.
sentence: يُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day man will be informed about the actions that he sent forward and those that he left behind.

translation: In fact man is a witness against himself,
sentence: بَلِ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Instead, man is a witness against himself as his limbs will testify against him in respect of the sins he committed.

translation: Whatever the excuses he may offer.
sentence: وَلَوْ أَلْقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Even if he brings excuses to argue on behalf of himself that he did not do any evil, these will not benefit him.

translation: Do not forestall (the revelation before its completion) by acting in haste.
sentence: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do not move your tongue, O Messenger, with the Qur’ān hastily for fear of its escaping from you.

translation: Surely its collection and recitation are Our responsibility.
sentence: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا جَمْعَهُۥ وَقُرْءَانَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is My duty to gather it in your chest and to establish its recitation on your tongue.

translation: So, as We recite it, follow its reading.
sentence: فَإِذَا قَرَأْنَٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعْ قُرْءَانَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When Gabriel has completed its recitation to you, then be attentive and listen to its being recited.

translation: The exposition of its meaning surely rests on Us.
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا بَيَانَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, it is My duty to explain it to you.

translation: But no. You love this transient life,
sentence: كَلَّا بَلْ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Nay, the matter is not as you claimed about the impossibility of resurrection. You know that the One Who was able to create you the first time is not unable to bring you back to life after you die. However, the reason for your denial of resurrection, is your love for the fleeting life of the world.

translation: And neglect the Hereafter.
sentence: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And your disregard for the life of the afterlife, the path of which is to carry out the acts of obedience that Allah has instructed you to and to leave the unlawful acts that He has prohibited you from.

translation: How many faces will be refulgent on that Day,
sentence: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاضِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The faces of the people of faith and fortune on that day will be radiant with light.

translation: Waiting for their Lord.
sentence: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Looking at their Lord with enjoyment.

translation: And how many faces on that Day will be woe-begone
sentence: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَاسِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The faces of the people of disbelief and wretchedness on that day will be gloomy.

translation: Fearing that a great disaster is going to befall them.
sentence: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفْعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will be sure that a great punishment and painful punishment is to come down on them.

translation: Never so, for when life withdraws into the clavicula,
sentence: كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِىَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter is not as the idolaters imagined - that they will not be punished when they die. When the soul of any one of them reaches the upper part of his chest.

translation: And it is asked: "Is there any reciter of charms and amulets?"
sentence: وَقِيلَ مَنْ رَاقٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And people say to one another: Who can heal this person, perhaps he can be cured?!

translation: He will then realise it is the parting,
sentence: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلْفِرَاقُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The person in agony will be certain at that time that this is the departure from the world by death.

translation: And anguish will be heaped upon anguish:
sentence: وَٱلْتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Difficulties will come together at the time when the world ends and the afterlife commences.

translation: To your Lord then will be the driving.
sentence: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمَسَاقُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When this occurs, the deceased will be driven to his Lord.

translation: For he neither believed nor prayed,
sentence: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The disbeliever did not accept what his messenger brought to him, nor did he pray to Allah, may He be glorified.

translation: But only disavowed and turned away;
sentence: وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Instead, he denied what his messenger brought to him and turned away from it.

translation: Then he strutted back to his people.
sentence: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then this disbeliever went to his family swaggering in his gait out of pride.

translation: Alas the woe for you, alas!
sentence: أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah thus warned the disbeliever that His punishment has come close to him.

translation: Alas, the woe for you!
sentence: ثُمَّ أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He then repeated the sentence by way of emphasis and stated: “Again, closer and closer it comes to you.”

translation: Does man think that he will be left alone to himself, free?
sentence: أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَن يُتْرَكَ سُدًى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does man think that Allah will leave him neglected without imposing any laws on him?

translation: Was he not an emitted drop of semen,
sentence: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِّن مَّنِىٍّ يُمْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Was this human being one day not a drop of sperm spilt into the womb.

translation: Then formed into an embryo? Then He fashioned, shaped and proportioned
sentence: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Thereafter he was a piece of coagulated blood. Then Allah created him and made his form proportionate.

translation: And assigned it sexes, male and female.
sentence: فَجَعَلَ مِنْهُ ٱلزَّوْجَيْنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then he made his species into two types: Male and female?!

translation: Cannot such as He bring the dead to life?
sentence: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحْۦِىَ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Is not the One Who created man from a drop, then a clot, able to give life once again to the dead for the reckoning and recompense?! Indeed, He is able to do so.

translation: WAS THERE NOT a time in the life of man when he was not even a mentionable thing?
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَٰنِ حِينٌ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًٔا مَّذْكُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A long period of time has passed over man when he was non-existent and there was no mention of him.

translation: Verily We created man from a sperm yoked (to the ovum) to bring out his real substance, then gave him hearing and sight.
sentence: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَٰهُ سَمِيعًۢا بَصِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I created man from a drop that was a mixture of the liquid of a man and a woman, to test him with the impositions I placed on him. I made him hearing and seeing to carry out the laws I imposed on him.

translation: We surely showed him the way that he may either be grateful or deny.
sentence: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I showed him, through the tongues of My messengers, the path of guidance and by that the path of misguidance became clear to him. Thereafter he is either guided to the straight path and becomes a believing servant that is thankful to Allah, or he is misled from it and becomes a disbelieving servant who rejects Allah’s signs.

translation: We have prepared for unbelievers chains and collars and a blazing fire.
sentence: إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغْلَٰلًا وَسَعِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: After Allah mentioned the two types, those who are guided and those astray, he mentioned the reward of each by saying: I have prepared for those who reject Allah and His messengers, chains by which they will be dragged into the fire, and iron collars that will be tied around their necks, and a blazing fire.

translation: Surely the devotees will drink cups flavoured with palm blossoms
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The believers who follow Allah will drink on the day of judgment from a filled cup of wine mixed with camphor because of its pleasant fragrance.

translation: From a spring of which the votaries of God will drink and make it flow in abundance.
sentence: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This drink that has been prepared for the people of obedience will be from a easily palatable, abundantly flowing spring which will not dry out. The servants of Allah will drink to their fill from it, and be able to cause it to flow and run wherever they wish.

translation: Those who fulfil their vows and fear the Day whose evil shall be diffused far and wide,
sentence: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسْتَطِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The attributes of the servants who will drink from it, are that they fulfil the acts of obedience to Allah they have imposed upon themselves, and they fear a day of widespread calamity: The Day of Judgement.

translation: And feed the needy for the love of Him, and the orphans and the captives,
sentence: وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They also feed food, despite being in the state of loving food due to being needy and desirous of it. They feed it to the poor, orphans and captives.

translation: (Saying): "We feed you for the sake of God, desiring neither recompense nor thanks.
sentence: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَآءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They conceal within themselves that they only feed them for the pleasure of Allah; not intending to receive any recompense from those whom they have fed, nor any praise.

translation: We fear the dismal day calamitous from our Lord."
sentence: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: We fear from our Lord a day on which the faces of the wretched will be gloomy due to its severity and horror.

translation: So God will protect them from the evil of that day, and grant them happiness and joy,
sentence: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Allah will protect them through His grace from the harm of that great day, and will give them beauty and light on their faces in their honour, together with placing happiness in their hearts.

translation: And reward them for their perseverence Paradise and silken robes,
sentence: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Allah will reward them due to their endurance upon acts of obedience, patience upon the decrees of Allah, and resolve from committing sins, with a Paradise in which they shall live in luxury, wearing clothes made of silk.

translation: Where they will recline on couches feeling neither heat of the sun nor intense cold.
sentence: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will be reclining in it on decorated couches. They will not see in this Paradise a sun to be inconvenienced by its rays, nor will they experience extreme cold; rather they will be in constant shade, without extreme heat or cold.

translation: The shadows will bend over them, and low will hang the clusters of grapes.
sentence: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Its shade will be near to them, and its fruits will be made subservient to whoever eats them, making them easy to access and eat, such that a person lying down, sitting or standing will be able to eat them.

translation: Passed round will be silver flagons and goblets made of glass,
sentence: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٍ مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا۠
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Servants will roam around them with silver utensils and clear glasses whenever they intend to drink.

translation: And crystal clear bottles of silver, of which they will determine the measure themselves.
sentence: قَوَارِيرَا۟ مِن فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In their clear colour, they will be like glass, yet they will be made of silver, and they will be measured to perfection: neither bigger or smaller than they intend.

translation: There will they drink a cup flavoured with ginger
sentence: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These honoured people will be given a glass of wine to drink, mixed with ginger.

translation: From a spring by the name of Ever-flowing-Salsabil.
sentence: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will also drink from a spring in Paradise named Salsabīl.

translation: And boys of everlasting youth will go about attending them. Looking at them you would think that they were pearls dispersed.
sentence: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَّنثُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And youthful children will roam around them in Paradise. When you see them you will think of them to be scattered pearls, because of the freshness in their faces, their beautiful complexions, their number and their distinction.

translation: When you look around, you will see delights and great dominion.
sentence: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When you see what is in Paradise, you will see undescribable luxury and a magnificent kingdom that is unparalleled.

translation: On their bodies will be garments of the finest green silk and brocade, and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give them a purest draught to drink.
sentence: عَٰلِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ وَحُلُّوٓا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Magnificent green clothes will adorn their upper bodies, made of fine silk and silk brocade. They will also be made to wear silver bracelets, and Allah will give them to drink, a drink free of any spoiling.

translation: "This in truth is your recompense, and acceptance of your endeavours."
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَآءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said to them in their honour: “Indeed, this luxury you have been given is a reward for you for your good deeds; your deeds were acceptable with Allah.”

translation: We have revealed the Qur'an to you gradually;
sentence: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَنزِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, I have revealed the Qur’ān to you in segments; I did not reveal it to you all at once.

translation: So wait for your Lord's command, and do not follow any sinner or disbeliever among them.
sentence: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ ءَاثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So be patient over what Allah decrees or legislates, and do not follow the sinner in the sin he calls towards, nor the disbeliever in the disbelief he invites towards.

translation: Meditate upon the name of your Lord morning and evening;
sentence: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And remember your Lord by performing the Fajr prayer at the starting of the day, and the Ẓuhr and ‘Aṣr prayers at its end.

translation: And bow in homage part of the night, and glorify Him far into the night.
sentence: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَٱسْجُدْ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And remember Him by performing the two prayers of the night: The Maghrib and ‘Ishā prayers, together with performing Tahajjud after them.

translation: Surely men love what hastes away and forget the grievous day (ahead).
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, these idolaters love the worldly life and are greedy for it, leaving behind them the Day of Judgement which is a burdensome day due to the difficulties and tests in it.

translation: We created them and fixed their bones and joints; and We could replace them when We like with others like them.
sentence: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَٰهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَآ أَسْرَهُمْ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَآ أَمْثَٰلَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I have created them and strengthened their creation by giving strength in their joints, limbs etc. And if I wanted to destroy them and replace them with people like them, I would have done so.

translation: This surely is a reminder: Therefore whosoever desires may take the way to his Lord.
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, this Sūrah is a piece of advice and a reminder; whoever wishes to take it as a path to the pleasure of his Lord should do so.

translation: But you will not desire except as God wills. Verily He is all-knowing and all-wise.
sentence: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You do not wish to take the path to the pleasure of Allah except that Allah also wishes that from you, because the matter is fully in His control. Indeed, Allah knows the requirements of His servants and what they do not require; He is wise in His creation, decree and legislation.

translation: He admits whosoever He will to His benevolence. But for the evil-doers He has prepared a painful punishment.
sentence: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۢا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He enters whichever of His servants He wishes into His mercy, granting them the ability to bring faith and do good deeds. He has also prepared for those who oppress themselves by disbelieving and committing sins, a painful punishment in the afterlife: the punishment of the hellfire.

translation: I CALL TO WITNESS those who are sent consecutively,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلْمُرْسَلَٰتِ عُرْفًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the constant winds, like the mane of a horse.

translation: And those that strike violently,
sentence: فَٱلْعَٰصِفَٰتِ عَصْفًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the severely blowing winds.

translation: And those that revive by quickening,
sentence: وَٱلنَّٰشِرَٰتِ نَشْرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And also on the winds that disperse the rain.

translation: And those that distinguish distinctly,
sentence: فَٱلْفَٰرِقَٰتِ فَرْقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the angels that descend with that which differentiates between truth and falsehood.

translation: And those that bring down the Reminder
sentence: فَٱلْمُلْقِيَٰتِ ذِكْرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the angels who descend bringing revelation.

translation: To end all argument or to warn.
sentence: عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They descend bringing revelation as a warning from Allah so that He is excused, and warning the people of the punishment of Allah.

translation: What is promised will surely come to pass.
sentence: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the resurrection, accounting and requital you have been promised is to happen, inevitably.

translation: When the stars are obliterated,
sentence: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When it happens, the stars will suddenly lose their shine, and their light will be extinguished.

translation: The heavens split asunder,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The sky will suddenly crack because of the angels descending from it.

translation: The mountains reduced to dust and blown away,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The mountains will be suddenly uprooted from their places, and will be made to break up into pieces until they become like dust particles.

translation: And when the time comes for raising the little girls (buried alive) --
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the Messengers will be gathered for a fixed time.

translation: For what day is that time fixed?
sentence: لِأَىِّ يَوْمٍ أُجِّلَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For a great day which has been delayed, so that they can testify against their nations.

translation: The Day of Judgement.
sentence: لِيَوْمِ ٱلْفَصْلِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For the day of separation between the servants, so that the true can be made clear from the false, and the fortunate from the wretched.

translation: How will you comprehend what the Day of Judgement is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What do you know of the day of separation?

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors who rejected whatever the Messengers brought from Allah.

translation: Have We not destroyed the earlier generations?
sentence: أَلَمْ نُهْلِكِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Did I not destroy the previous nations when they disbelieved in Allah and rejected their Messengers?

translation: So shall We make the later ones to follow them.
sentence: ثُمَّ نُتْبِعُهُمُ ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then I followed the rejectors up by sending the later ones into the world, and then destroyed them just as I destroyed those before them.

translation: That is what We shall do to those who are guilty of crime.
sentence: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Like My destruction of those nations, I will destroy the criminals who reject that which Muhammad (peace be upon him) has brought.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors of the warning of Allah of the punishment for the criminals.

translation: Did We not create you from contemptible water?
sentence: أَلَمْ نَخْلُقكُّم مِّن مَّآءٍ مَّهِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people! Did I not create you from a small amount of despised fluid, i.e. a drop of semen?

translation: Then We lodged you in a secure place (the womb)
sentence: فَجَعَلْنَٰهُ فِى قَرَارٍ مَّكِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I then put that contemptuous fluid into a safe place i.e. the woman’s womb.

translation: For a certain appointed time,
sentence: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For a known period of time, i.e. the duration of pregnancy.

translation: Then We facilitated (your birth). How well do We calculate!
sentence: فَقَدَرْنَا فَنِعْمَ ٱلْقَٰدِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I then decreed the attributes of that child, its fate, colour etc., so I am a greatly capable of all that.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors of the capability of Allah.

translation: Have We not made the earth a repository
sentence: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلْأَرْضَ كِفَاتًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Did I not make the earth capable of holding all the people?

translation: For the living and the dead,
sentence: أَحْيَآءً وَأَمْوَٰتًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It holds their living by letting them live and populate it, and their dead by allowing them to be buried in it.

translation: And placed in it lofty and broad stablisers, and gave you sweet water to drink?
sentence: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ شَٰمِخَٰتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَٰكُم مَّآءً فُرَاتًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I also placed high, rooted mountains on it that stop it from shaking. And O people! I provide you with sweet water to drink. So whoever created all that is not incapable of resurrecting you.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors of the favours of Allah.

translation: "Go to what you used to deny;
sentence: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will be said to those who rejected whatever their Messengers brought: “O rejectors! Walk to the punishment you used to reject.”

translation: Go to the shadow with three ramifications,
sentence: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِى ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Walk to the shadow of the smoke of the hellfire, which is split into three parts”

translation: Neither shady nor protecting against the blazing Fire.
sentence: لَّا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “There is no coolness of shade in it, nor does it stop the flares of the hellfire or its heat from reaching you.”

translation: It will throw out sparks as logs of wood
sentence: إِنَّهَا تَرْمِى بِشَرَرٍ كَٱلْقَصْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the hellfire spits out sparks, each spark like a palace in size.

translation: So like golden camels."
sentence: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَٰلَتٌ صُفْرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is as if the sparks that it spits out are black mountains in their darkness and size.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors who rejected whatever the Messengers brought from Allah.

translation: They will not be able to speak that day,
sentence: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This is a day on which they will not speak at all.

translation: Nor given leave to make excuses.
sentence: وَلَا يُؤْذَنُ لَهُمْ فَيَعْتَذِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Neither will they be given permission to present excuses to their Lord for their disbelief and evils.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors of the news of this day.

translation: That will be the Day of Reckoning. Gathered will be (you) and the earlier (generations).
sentence: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ جَمَعْنَٰكُمْ وَٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This is the day of separation between the creations; I have gathered you and the previous nations on one plain.

translation: So if you have any plot to devise against Me, then devise it.
sentence: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So if you have a plan that you may execute to save yourselves from My punishment, try it.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors of the day of separation.

translation: Those who take heed for themselves and fear God, will be amidst shade and springs of water,
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى ظِلَٰلٍ وَعُيُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, those who are mindful of their Lord by fulfilling His commands and refraining from the things he has not allowed, they will be in the extending shade of the trees of Paradise, and among sweet, flowing springs.

translation: And such fruits as they desire.
sentence: وَفَوَٰكِهَ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And among fruits they desire to eat.

translation: "Eat and drink with relish as reward for what you had done."
sentence: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And it will be said to them: “Eat from the good, and drink a pleasant, unspoiled drink in return for your good deeds in the world.”

translation: That is how We reward the good.
sentence: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Just as I have requited you with this requital, I requite all those who do good deeds.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors of whatever Allah has prepared for the Mindful.

translation: Eat and enjoy for a while: You are certainly sinners.
sentence: كُلُوا۟ وَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجْرِمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And it will be said to the rejectors: “Eat and enjoy the tasty things of life for a short time in the world; you are indeed, criminals due to your disbelief in Allah and rejection of His Messengers.”

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors of their requital on the day of recompense.

translation: When it is said to them: "Bow in homage," they do not bow.
sentence: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرْكَعُوا۟ لَا يَرْكَعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When these rejectors are told: “Perform prayer for Allah”, they do not pray to Him.

translation: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction, punishment and loss on that day will be for the rejectors who rejected whatever the Messengers brought from Allah.

translation: In what other lore after this will they then believe?
sentence: فَبِأَىِّ حَدِيثٍۭ بَعْدَهُۥ يُؤْمِنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when they do not bring faith in this Qur’ān that was revealed from their Lord, what other speech will they bring faith in?

translation: OF WHAT ARE they asking one another?
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What are these idolaters asking one another about, after Allah has sent His Messenger (peace be upon him) to them?

translation: (Is it) of the great announcement
sentence: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are asking each other about the great news. It is this Qur’ān that has been revealed to their Messenger, which contains the news of the resurrection.

translation: About which they have been differing?
sentence: ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This Qur’ān that they differ in how they should describe it: is it sorcery, poetry, fortune-telling or the tales of old?

translation: Indeed they will come to know soon;
sentence: كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter is not as they claim. These rejectors of the Qur’ān will soon know the evil outcome of their rejection.

translation: They will indeed come to know soon.
sentence: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, that will be reemphasised for them.

translation: Did We not make the earth a spreading,
sentence: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِهَٰدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Did I not make the earth spread out evenly for them so that it is fit for them to live on?

translation: The mountains tent-pins?
sentence: وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And did I not put mountains on it like pegs to stop it from shaking?

translation: We created you in pairs,
sentence: وَخَلَقْنَٰكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And O people! I created you of different types: some of you are males while others are females.

translation: And made sleep for you to rest,
sentence: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I made your sleep the end point of your activeness, so that you may rest.

translation: The night a covering,
sentence: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I made the night a cover for you with its darkness, like a garment that you cover your private parts with.

translation: And the day for seeking livelihood.
sentence: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I made the day a field for earning and finding provision.

translation: We raised over you several secure (skies),
sentence: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I made above you seven, solid skies, perfect in their creation.

translation: And placed a lamp therein brightly burning.
sentence: وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجًا وَهَّاجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I made the sun an extremely bright and hot lamp.

translation: And We sent down rain from water-laden clouds pouring in torrents
sentence: وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمُعْصِرَٰتِ مَآءً ثَجَّاجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I sent some clouds for which the time has come to pour down with abundant rain.

translation: That We may produce from it grain and vegetation,
sentence: لِّنُخْرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبًّا وَنَبَاتًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So that through it I can extract different types of grains and crops.

translation: And orchards full of trees and interlacing boughs.
sentence: وَجَنَّٰتٍ أَلْفَافًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And extract gardens that entwine with one another due to the closeness of the branches of their trees.

translation: Surely a time is fixed for the Day of Judgement.
sentence: إِنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَٰتًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: After Allah mentioned these blessings that prove His power, He followed it up with mention of the resurrection and the Day of Judgement, because the one who is capable of creating these blessings is also capable of resurrecting the dead and taking them to account. He says: Indeed, the day of separation between the creation was appointed and fixed on a time that will not change.

translation: The day the trumpet blast is sounded you will come in hordes;
sentence: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that day, the angel will blow into the horn the second time, upon which, O people, you shall come in groups.

translation: The heavens will be opened wide and turn into so many doors,
sentence: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَٰبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the sky will open up; it will have gaps like open doors.

translation: The mountains put in motion turning into a mirage.
sentence: وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the mountains will be made to move until they become like dispersed dust particles; becoming like a mirage.

translation: Certainly Hell lies in wait,
sentence: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, hell is watchful, lying in wait.

translation: The rebels' abode,
sentence: لِّلطَّٰغِينَ مَـَٔابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For the oppressors, as a point of return they will be made to return to.

translation: Where they will remain for aeons,
sentence: لَّٰبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحْقَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Wherein they shall stay for endless ages and years.

translation: Finding neither sleep nor any thing to drink
sentence: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will not experience cold breezes in it that will cool them from the heat of the blaze, nor will they taste any drink that they will enjoy.

translation: Except boiling water and benumbing cold:
sentence: إِلَّا حَمِيمًا وَغَسَّاقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will only taste extremely hot water, and the flowing pus of the people of hell.

translation: , A fitting reward.
sentence: جَزَآءً وِفَاقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As a requital in accordance to the disbelief and deviance they were on.

translation: They were those who did not expect a reckoning,
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in the world, they did not fear the Allah taking them to account in the afterlife, because they did not bring faith in the resurrection. So if they had feared the resurrection, they would have brought faith in Allah and performed good deeds.

translation: And rejected Our signs as lies.
sentence: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كِذَّابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they vehemently rejected My verses I revealed to My Messenger.

translation: We have kept account of everything in a book.
sentence: وَكُلَّ شَىْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَٰهُ كِتَٰبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I recorded and counted each of their deeds; they are all written in their books of deeds.

translation: So taste (the fruit of what you sowed), for We shall add nothing but torment,
sentence: فَذُوقُوا۟ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمْ إِلَّا عَذَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O transgressors! So endure this everlasting punishment; I will not increase you except in punishment upon your punishment.

translation: As for those who preserve themselves from evil and follow the straight path, there is attainment for them:
sentence: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, for those who are mindful of their Lord by fulfilling His commands and refraining from the things he has not allowed, there is a point of success they will succeed on, by achieving the Paradise they sought.

translation: Orchards and vineyards,
sentence: حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعْنَٰبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is full of gardens and grapevines.

translation: And graceful maidens of the same age,
sentence: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And women of similar ages.

translation: And flasks full and flowing.
sentence: وَكَأْسًا دِهَاقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And full glasses of wine.

translation: They will hear no blasphemies there or disavowals:
sentence: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّٰبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In Paradise, they will not hear any false speech, nor lies. Neither will they lie to one another.

translation: A recompense from your Lord, a sufficient gift,
sentence: جَزَآءً مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: All that will be from what Allah will give to them in graciousness and benevolence, and it will be sufficient for them.

translation: The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, most benevolent, to whom none may dare address a word.
sentence: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He is the Lord of the heavens, the earth and whatever is between them; the benevolent of the world and the afterlife. No one on earth or in the heavens is able to question Him except when He gives them permission.

translation: The day the Spirit takes its stand, with the angels ranged in rows. None will speak except who is permitted by Ar-Rahman and says what is right.
sentence: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفًّا لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when Gabriel and the angels will stand in rows, not speaking to intercede on behalf of anyone except whom the Benevolent grants them permission to intercede for, and has made a straight statement i.e. the statement of oneness of Allah.

translation: That day is certain. So whosoever likes may prepare a way to his Lord.
sentence: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلْحَقُّ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That which has been described to you is the day in which there is no doubt regarding its occurrence. So whoever wishes salvation on it from the punishment of Allah, he should take the path to it through performing good deeds that will please his Lord.

translation: We have indeed warned you of a calamity near at hand, a day when man will see what he had sent (of his deeds) ahead, and the unbeliever will say: "Woe alas. Ah would that I were dust!"
sentence: إِنَّآ أَنذَرْنَٰكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلْكَافِرُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى كُنتُ تُرَٰبًۢا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people! Indeed, I have warned you of an impending punishment which will occur on the day when a person will see what deeds he sent forth in the world, and the disbeliever will say, wishing safety from the punishment: “If only I had become dust like the animals!” when it is said to them on the Day of Judgement: “Become dust”.

translation: I CALL TO WITNESS those who dive and drag,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلنَّٰزِعَٰتِ غَرْقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the angels who pull out the souls of the disbelievers with severity and harshness.

translation: And those who undo the bonds gently,
sentence: وَٱلنَّٰشِطَٰتِ نَشْطًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the angels who gently remove the souls of the believers with ease and smoothness.

translation: And those who glide swimmingly,
sentence: وَٱلسَّٰبِحَٰتِ سَبْحًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He also takes an oath on the angels who float from the heavens to the earth, by the command of Allah.

translation: Then outpace the others swiftly
sentence: فَٱلسَّٰبِقَٰتِ سَبْقًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the angels who compete with one another to carry out the command of Allah.

translation: And direct affairs by command,
sentence: فَٱلْمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمْرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He also takes an oath on the angels who execute the decree of Allah that He has commanded them to, i.e. the angels appointed to the deeds of the servants. He takes an oath on all that, that He will definitely resurrect them for accounting and requital.

translation: The day the convulsive (first blast) shatters convulsively
sentence: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when the earth will tremble upon the first blowing of the horn.

translation: Followed by the second blast,
sentence: تَتْبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The second blow will follow it.

translation: Hearts will pound loudly on that day,
sentence: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The hearts of some people will be fearful on that day.

translation: Eyes be lowered in submission.
sentence: أَبْصَٰرُهَا خَٰشِعَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The effects of humiliation will be apparent on their faces.

translation: They say: "Shall we go back to our original state
sentence: يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِى ٱلْحَافِرَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They would say: “Will we be returned to life after we have died?”

translation: After having turned to carious bones?"
sentence: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَٰمًا نَّخِرَةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “When we will become decomposed, empty bones, will we be returned then?!”

translation: They say: "Then this returning will be a dead loss."
sentence: قَالُوا۟ تِلْكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They say: “If we are returned, that return will be a loss, and the person returning will be defrauded.”

translation: It will only be a single blast,
sentence: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter of the resurrection is easy. It will only be a single scream from the angel appointed to blow.

translation: And they will wake up suddenly.
sentence: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then suddenly, everyone will be alive on the face of the earth, after they were dead within it.

translation: Has the story of Moses come to you
sentence: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Has the news of Moses, his Lord and enemy, Pharaoh, come to you?

translation: When his Lord called to him in Tuwa's holy vale?
sentence: إِذْ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When his Lord may He be glorified called out to him at the blessed valley of Tuwa.

translation: "Go to the Pharaoh who has become refractory,
sentence: ٱذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Among the things He said to him was: “Go to Pharaoh; indeed, he has trespassed the limits of oppression and arrogance.”

translation: And say: 'Would you like to grow (in virtue)?
sentence: فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Then say to him: “O Pharaoh! Do you want to purify yourself from disbelief and sins?”

translation: Then I will guide you to your Lord that you may come to fear Him.'"
sentence: وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I will guide you to your Lord who has created you and provided for you so that you can fear Him and act according to His pleasure, together with refraining from things that cause His wrath.”

translation: So he showed him the greater sign;
sentence: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلْءَايَةَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Moses (peace be upon him) then showed him the great miracle that proved he was a Messenger from his Lord, i.e. the Hand and the Staff.

translation: But (the Pharaoh) disavowed and disobeyed.
sentence: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh did not do anything except reject these signs, and disobeyed the instruction Moses (peace be upon him) gave to him.

translation: Then he turned away, deliberating,
sentence: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He then turned away from bringing faith in what Moses had brought.

translation: And assembled (his council) and proclaimed,
sentence: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And turned his attention to mobilising his armies to overpower Moses. He called out to his people, saying:

translation: Saying: "I am alone your lord, the highest of them all."
sentence: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “I am your highest Lord; you are not to be obedient to anyone except me.”

translation: So God seized him for the punishment of the Hereafter and this world.
sentence: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ وَٱلْأُولَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Allah seized him and punished him in the world by drowning him in the sea, and He will punish him in the afterlife by entering him into the severest punishment.

translation: Truly there is a lesson in this for those who fear (the consequences).
sentence: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, in My punishing of Pharaoh in the world and the afterlife, there is admonition for the one who fears Allah, because it is he who benefits from the admonitions.

translation: Are you more difficult to create or the heavens? He built it,
sentence: ءَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بَنَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O rejectors of the resurrection! Is your origination, or the origination of the heavens that He has created, harder for Allah?

translation: Raised it high, proportioned it,
sentence: رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He raised the peak of the heaven vertically, and made it smooth: there is no break, crack or defect in it.

translation: Gave darkness to its night, and brightness to its day;
sentence: وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He darkened its night when the sun set, while manifesting its light when it rose.

translation: And afterwards spread out the earth.
sentence: وَٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَىٰهَآ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the earth after He created the heavens, He spread it out and placed within it its benefits.

translation: He brought out its water and its pastures from it,
sentence: أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرْعَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He extracted water from it in the form of flowing springs, and made plants grow on it which the livestock graze.

translation: And stabilized the mountains
sentence: وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَرْسَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He made the mountains stand firm on the earth.

translation: As convenience for you and your cattle.
sentence: مَتَٰعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَٰمِكُمْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people! All that is for your benefit, and for the benefit of your livestock. So whoever created all that, is not incapable of recreating you anew.

translation: When the great calamity comes,
sentence: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when the second blowing will come, which will cover everything with its terror, and the judgement will occur.

translation: The day when man remembers all that he had done,
sentence: يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when it will come, the human will remember what deeds he sent forth: whether good or bad.

translation: And Hell made visible to him who can see,
sentence: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And hell will be brought and unveiled clearly for all to see.

translation: Then he who had been rebellious
sentence: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the one who transgressed the limits into deviance.

translation: And who preferred the life of the world,
sentence: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And gave priority to the temporary worldly life over the everlasting afterlife.

translation: Will surely have Hell for his abode.
sentence: فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ هِىَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then indeed, the hellfire is his abode he will take shelter towards.

translation: But he who feared standing before his Lord, and restrained his self from vain desires,
sentence: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفْسَ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: & 41. And as for the one who feared his standing before his Lord and stopped himself from following his desires that were made impermissible by Allah, then Paradise is his abode he will take shelter towards.

translation: Will surely have Paradise for abode.
sentence: فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَنَّةَ هِىَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: & 41. And as for the one who feared his standing before his Lord and stopped himself from following his desires that were made impermissible by Allah, then Paradise is his abode he will take shelter towards.

translation: They ask you: "When will the Hour be? When is its time fixed?"
sentence: يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! These rejectors of the resurrection ask you: “When will the Hour occur?”

translation: What do you have to do with explaining it?
sentence: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكْرَىٰهَآ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You do not have any knowledge regarding it that you can mention to them; nor is it befitting of your duty to, because your duty is only to prepare for it.

translation: The extent of its knowledge goes to your Lord.
sentence: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَآ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The total knowledge of the Hour is with your Lord alone.

translation: Your duty is only to warn him who fears it.
sentence: إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You are only a warner to the one who fears the Hour, because he is the one who benefits from your warning.

translation: The day they see it, it will seem they had stayed in the world but only an evening or its turning into dawn.
sentence: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is as if on the day they see the Hour for themselves, they will not have remained in their worldly lives except for a single evening or morning.

translation: HE FROWNED AND turned away,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) frowned and turned away.

translation: Because a blind man came to him.
sentence: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Because of the arrival of ‘Abdullah ibn Umm Maktūm who came asking for guidance. He was blind, and had come when the Messenger (peace be upon him) was busy with the seniors of the idolaters, hoping they would be guided.

translation: What made you think that he will not grow in virtue,
sentence: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What do you know, maybe this blind man may be purified of his sins?

translation: Or be admonished, and the admonition profit him?
sentence: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or that he may take heed of the advices he hears from you and benefit from them?

translation: As for him who is not in want of any thing,
sentence: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَغْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for those who feel they have no need to bring faith in what you have brought, due to the wealth they possess.

translation: You pay full attention,
sentence: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You persevere behind them and are attentive to them.

translation: Though it is not your concern if he should not grow (in fulness).
sentence: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What blame will there be on you if he is not purified of his sins by not repenting to Allah?

translation: As for him who comes to you striving (after goodness),
sentence: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the one who comes to you running, searching for goodness.

translation: And is also fearful (of God),
sentence: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he fears his Lord.

translation: You neglect.
sentence: فَأَنتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You are preoccupied from him with others i.e. the senior idolaters.

translation: Assuredly this is a reminder
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It should not be like that; it is only admonition and a reminder for those who pay attention.

translation: For any one who desires to bear it in mind,
sentence: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So whoever wishes to remember Allah should remember Him, and take heed of what is in this Qur’ān.

translation: (Contained) in honoured pages,
sentence: فِى صُحُفٍ مُّكَرَّمَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Because this Qur’ān is in blessed scrolls, with the angels.

translation: Exalted and holy,
sentence: مَّرْفُوعَةٍ مُّطَهَّرَةٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are raised on a high place, pure; no dirt or filth reaches them.

translation: In the hands of scribes
sentence: بِأَيْدِى سَفَرَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they are in the hands of Messengers among the angels.

translation: Noble and pious.
sentence: كِرَامٍۭ بَرَرَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are honourable in the eyes of their Lord, frequent performers of goodness and obedience.

translation: Accursed is man. How ungrateful is he!
sentence: قُتِلَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَآ أَكْفَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The disbelieving human is cursed; how severe is his disbelief in Allah!

translation: Of what substance God created him?
sentence: مِنْ أَىِّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What substance did Allah create him from, that he has the right to display arrogance on earth and disbelieve in Him?!

translation: From a single sperm He created, then proportioned him,
sentence: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He created him from a small amount of fluid, and managed his creation in stages.

translation: Then made his passage easy (at birth);
sentence: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then after these stages, He made the exit from his mother’s belly easy for him.

translation: He will then send him to death and have him laid in the grave.
sentence: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقْبَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, after spending the amount of life decreed for him, Allah caused death upon him and made a grave for him wherein he remains until he is resurrected.

translation: Then He will raise him up again when He please.
sentence: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, when He wishes, He will resurrect him for accounting and requital.

translation: But no. He has not fulfilled what was enjoined on him.
sentence: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not like this disbeliever imagines: that he has fulfilled the rights of Allah upon him, because he has not fulfilled the obligatory actions Allah put upon him.

translation: Let man therefore consider (the sources of) his food.
sentence: فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So the human who disbelieves in Allah should look at the food he eats: how did he come to acquire it?

translation: We poured down rain abundantly,
sentence: أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا ٱلْمَآءَ صَبًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It originates from the rain descending from the sky with force and in abundance.

translation: Then We cracked the earth open under pressure (of germination)
sentence: ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ شَقًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, I split open the earth, so it springs forth with plants.

translation: And We made corn grow,
sentence: فَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I then make grains grow on it, i.e. wheat, corn etc.

translation: And grapes and herbage,
sentence: وَعِنَبًا وَقَضْبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I make fresh grapes and fodder grow on it, so it can be feed for your livestock.

translation: Olives and dates,
sentence: وَزَيْتُونًا وَنَخْلًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I also make olives and date palms grow on it.

translation: Orchards thick with trees,
sentence: وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلْبًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I also make abundant gardens and trees grow on it.

translation: And fruits and fodder:
sentence: وَفَٰكِهَةً وَأَبًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I make fruits grow on it, together with things your livestock graze.

translation: A provision for you and your cattle.
sentence: مَّتَٰعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَٰمِكُمْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For your benefit, and the benefit of your livestock.

translation: But when the great calamity comes
sentence: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when the great shriek will come that will deafen the ears i.e. the second blowing.

translation: Man will fly from his brother,
sentence: يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that day a person will run from his brother.

translation: Mother and father,
sentence: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he will run from his parents.

translation: As well as his wife and children.
sentence: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he will run from his wife and children.

translation: Each man will have enough cares that day.
sentence: لِكُلِّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Each one of them will be in a state where he will be preoccupied from them due to the extreme anxiety on that day.

translation: Many faces will that day be bright,
sentence: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُّسْفِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The faces of the fortunate ones that day will be bright.

translation: Laughing and full of joy,
sentence: ضَاحِكَةٌ مُّسْتَبْشِرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Laughing in happiness due to what Allah has prepared for them out of His mercy.

translation: And many will be dust-begrimed,
sentence: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the faces of the wretched people will have dust on them on that day.

translation: Covered with the blackness (of shame):
sentence: تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Darkness will come over them.

translation: They will be the unbelievers, transgressors.
sentence: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْكَفَرَةُ ٱلْفَجَرَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those described above in that state will be the ones who combined disbelief and transgression.

translation: WHEN THE SUN is folded up,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِذَا ٱلشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the mass of the sun is gathered and its light vanishes.

translation: The stars turn dim and scatter,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the stars fall one after the other and their light is taken away.

translation: The mountains made to move,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the mountains are moved from their places.

translation: The ten-month pregnant female camels are abandoned,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When pregnant she-camels, which were their most valuable wealth, are neglected by being abandoned by their owners.

translation: The wild beasts stampede on the run,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When wild animals are gathered with human beings on one plain.

translation: When the oceans surge and swell,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the seas are lit until they become a fire.

translation: When souls are reunited (with the bodies)
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ
