en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When souls are joined with their likeness. A sinner will be joined with a sinner and a pious person will be joined with a pious person.

translation: And the little girl buried alive is asked
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْمَوْءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the girl buried alive is asked by Allah.

translation: For what crime she was put to death;
sentence: بِأَىِّ ذَنۢبٍ قُتِلَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For what crime were you killed by the person who killed you?

translation: When the ledgers are laid open,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the servants’ books of deeds are spread open, so that each person can read his book of deeds.

translation: The curtain drawn back from the skies,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the sky is stripped like how the skin is stripped away from a sheep.

translation: When Hell is set ablaze,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the Fire is lit.

translation: And Paradise brought near,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When Paradise is brought near to those who are Mindful.

translation: (Then) every soul will know what it had prepared (for itself).
sentence: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّآ أَحْضَرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When that occurs, every soul will know what actions it sent forward for that day.

translation: So, I call the receding stars to witness,
sentence: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلْخُنَّسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah took an oath by the stars that are hidden until they emerge at night.

translation: The planets withdrawing into themselves,
sentence: ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْكُنَّسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That run in their orbits and disappear when dawn rises, like a gazelle that goes into its den i.e. its home.

translation: The closing night,
sentence: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by the first part of the night when it approaches, and the last part when it recedes.

translation: The rising dawn,
sentence: وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by the morning when its light emerges.

translation: That this is indeed the word of an honoured Messenger,
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Qur’ān that is revealed to Muhammad (peace be upon him) is Allah’s speech that was conveyed by a trusted angel, Gabriel (peace be upon him), whom Allah entrusted it to.

translation: Full of power, well-established (in position) with the Lord and Master of the Throne,
sentence: ذِى قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِى ٱلْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: One who possess strength and great rank in the sight of the Lord of the Throne, may He be glorified.

translation: Obeyed and worthy there of trust.
sentence: مُّطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He is obeyed by the inhabitants of the heavens and trusted in the revelation that he conveys.

translation: Your companion is not mad.
sentence: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجْنُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Muhammad (peace be upon him), who is in your company and whose intellect, trustworthiness and truthfulness you know, is not insane as you slanderously claim.

translation: He had surely seen Him on the clear horizon.
sentence: وَلَقَدْ رَءَاهُ بِٱلْأُفُقِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Your companion had seen Gabriel in the form that he was created in the clear horizon of the sky.

translation: He is not chary of making public what is unknown.
sentence: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Your companion is not miserly with you by not conveying what he was instructed to convey to you, nor does he take any reward like how fortune-tellers take.

translation: This is not the utterance of an accursed devil.
sentence: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَٰنٍ رَّجِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This Qur’ān is not the speech of a satan distanced from Allah’s mercy.

translation: So whither do you stray?
sentence: فَأَيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So which path will you tread to deny that it is from Allah after all these evidence?!

translation: This is a reminder for all the peoples of the world,
sentence: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Qur’ān is only a reminder and counsel to the jinn and mankind.

translation: For those of you who desire to walk the path that is straight,
sentence: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَسْتَقِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For those of you who wish to be steadfast on the path of truth.

translation: Though you cannot desire except as God will, the Lord of all the worlds.
sentence: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You can only will to remain steadfast or do anything else if Allah, the Lord of all created things, wills that.

translation: WHEN THE SKY is split asunder,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the sky will split apart because of the angels descending from it.

translation: And the stars dispersed,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the stars fall one after the other and are scattered.

translation: When the oceans begin to flow,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the seas are opened into one another and they merge.

translation: When the graves are overturned,
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the soil of graves is turned over to resurrect the dead in them.

translation: Each soul will know what it had sent ahead and what it had left behind.
sentence: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: At that time, every soul will know the actions it sent forward and those it left behind and did not do.

translation: O man, what seduced you from your munificent Lord
sentence: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O man who has rejected his Lord! What has made you go against the instruction of your Lord when He gave you respite and did not punish you quickly, as a favour from Him?!

translation: Who created you then formed your symmetry, then gave you right proportion,
sentence: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The One Who gave you existence after you were non-existent, and Who proportioned and balanced your limbs.

translation: Shaping you into any form He pleased?
sentence: فِىٓ أَىِّ صُورَةٍ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In whatever form He wished to create you, He created you. He favoured you as He did not create you in the form of a donkey, monkey, dog or other form.

translation: Even then you deny the Judgement.
sentence: كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O you who are deceived, the matter is not as you thought! In fact, you deny the day of recompense and do not work for it.

translation: Surely there are guardians over you,
sentence: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَٰفِظِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Over you are angels who record your deeds.

translation: Illustrious scribes
sentence: كِرَامًا كَٰتِبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Noble in Allah’s sight, scribes who write down your deeds.

translation: Who know what you do.
sentence: يَعْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They know of every action you do and they write it down.

translation: The pious will surely be in heaven,
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ لَفِى نَعِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who do abundant acts of good and obedience will be in everlasting bliss on the day of judgment.

translation: The wicked certainly in Hell:
sentence: وَإِنَّ ٱلْفُجَّارَ لَفِى جَحِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who committed iniquity will be in a fire that will be burned over them.

translation: They will burn in it on the Day of Judgement,
sentence: يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will enter it on the day of recompense and suffer from its heat.

translation: And will not be removed from it.
sentence: وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will never be absent from it. Instead they will remain in it forever.

translation: How can you comprehend what the Day of Judgement is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What will tell you what the day of justice is?

translation: How then can you comprehend what the Day of Judgement is?
sentence: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Again, what will tell you what the day of justice is?

translation: It is the day when no soul will have power to do the least for a soul, and God's alone will be done.
sentence: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِّنَفْسٍ شَيْـًٔا وَٱلْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلَّهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A day when no one will be able to benefit anyone. The entire matter on that day will belong to Allah alone, to deal as He wishes, and not to anyone besides Him.

translation: WOE TO THOSE who give short measure,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِّلْمُطَفِّفِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction and loss be for those who give short measure.

translation: Who insist on being given full when they take from others,
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They are the ones who, when they measure for themselves from others, they take their full right without any reduction.

translation: Whilst when they measure or weigh for them, give less.
sentence: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But when they measure or weigh for people they reduce the measurement and weight. This was the practice of the people of Madinah at the time the Prophet (peace be on him) migrated to them.

translation: Do they not think they will be raised (to life) again
sentence: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبْعُوثُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do these people who do this evil act not know that they will resurrected before Allah?!

translation: On a grievous day,
sentence: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For the reckoning and recompense on a day that is great because of the trials and horrors it contains.

translation: The day all mankind will stand before the Lord of all the worlds?
sentence: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The day when people will stand before the Lord of all creation, for the reckoning.

translation: Indeed the ledger of the wicked will be in (the lowest depths) Sijjin.
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter is not as you thought - that there is no resurrection after death. The book of the people of iniquity from amongst the disbelievers and hypocrites will be in loss in the lower earth.

translation: How will you comprehend what Sijjin is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What will tell you what Sijjin is?!

translation: It is a (repository of) distinctly written record.
sentence: كِتَٰبٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Their book is written and will not vanish. Nor will there be any increase or decrease in it.

translation: Ah the woe that day for those who deny,
sentence: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Destruction and loss on that day will be for those who deny.

translation: Who call the Day of judgement a lie!
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who deny the day of recompense in which Allah will give His servants the recompense of the actions they did in the world.

translation: None denies it but the sinful transgressors.
sentence: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: None denies that day except every person who transgresses Allah’s limits and commits abundant sins.

translation: When Our revelations are recited before him, he says: "These are fables of long ago."
sentence: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When My verses revealed to My messenger are recited to him, he says: These are stories of the earlier nations and are not from Allah.

translation: No. In fact what they have been doing has rusted their hearts.
sentence: كَلَّا بَلْ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter is not as these deniers thought. Instead, the sins they used to commit has dominated and covered their minds and they therefore have not seen the truth with their hearts.

translation: Therefore they will be screened off from their Lord that day,
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, they will be prevented from seeing their Lord on the day of judgment.

translation: Then they will indeed burn in Hell.
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُوا۟ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then they will enter the Fire, to suffer from its heat.

translation: They will then be told: "This is what you had denied."
sentence: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then on the Day of Judgement it will be said to them in rebuke and censure: This punishment that you received is what you used to deny in the world when your messenger told you about it.

translation: Surely the ledger of the pious will be in 'Illiyun (heights above the heights).
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The matter is not as you thought - that there will be no reckoning or recompense. The book of the people of obedience will be in Illiyyun.

translation: But how will you comprehend what 'Illiyun is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What will tell you what Illiyyun is?!

translation: It is a (repository of) distinctly written record
sentence: كِتَٰبٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Their book is written and will not vanish. Nor will there be any increase or decrease in it.

translation: Witnessed by those who are honoured.
sentence: يَشْهَدُهُ ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This book is witnessed by the angels brought near in every heaven.

translation: Verily the pious will be in heaven,
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ لَفِى نَعِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who do an abundance of good deeds will be in everlasting bliss on the day of judgment.

translation: On couches face to face.
sentence: عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On decorated couches looking at their Lord, and at everything delightful and pleasing to their souls.

translation: On their faces you will see the glow of beatitude.
sentence: تَعْرِفُ فِى وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: If you see them, you will see in their faces the effect of luxury; in their beauty and splendour.

translation: They will be served the choicest wine, sealed
sentence: يُسْقَوْنَ مِن رَّحِيقٍ مَّخْتُومٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Their servants will give them wine from sealed containers to drink.

translation: With a sealing of musk, which those who aspire for the best should desire, --
sentence: خِتَٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَٰفِسُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It will give off the fragrance of musk until its very end. For this noble reward the competitors must compete, by doing what pleases Allah and leaving what angers Him.

translation: Blended with the water of Tasnim, (heights ultimate of evolution),
sentence: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسْنِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This sealed drink will be mixed from the spring of Tasnim.

translation: A fountain from which only they who are honoured drink.
sentence: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This is a spring in the highest part of Paradise, from which those brought near will drink purely and the rest of the believers will drink from it mixed with other drinks.

translation: The sinners indeed laughed at believers
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who committed wrong by the disbelief they held used to mockingly laugh at those who had faith.

translation: And winked at one another as they passed by them;
sentence: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When they passed by the believers they would wink at one another in ridicule and amusement.

translation: And when they went back to their people turned to make fun of them;
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When they returned to their families they would go back happy with their acts of disbelief and ridicule of the believers.

translation: And when they saw them, they said: "They have indeed gone astray."
sentence: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When they saw the Muslims, they would say: These people are astray from the path of truth, as they abandoned the religion of their forefathers.

translation: But they were not Sent to be guardians over them!
sentence: وَمَآ أُرْسِلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ حَٰفِظِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah did not appoint them to guard their deeds so that they could make this statement of theirs.

translation: So, the believers will laugh at the infidels on that day,
sentence: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the Day of Judgment, those who have faith in Allah will laugh at the disbelievers just as the disbelievers used to laugh at them in the world.

translation: Regarding them from their cushioned seats.
sentence: عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On decorated couches they will look at the everlasting bliss that Allah prepared for them.

translation: Will not the infidels pay for what they had done?
sentence: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The disbelievers have been given the humiliating punishment as recompense of the actions they did in the world.

translation: WHEN THE SKY is cleft asunder,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the sky ruptures because of the angels descending from it.

translation: And hearkens to its Lord and is dutiful,
sentence: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And listens submissively to its Lord, as it rightly should.

translation: When the earth is stretched out taut
sentence: وَإِذَا ٱلْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the earth is stretched by Allah as leather is stretched.

translation: And throws out whatever it contains and is empty,
sentence: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And throws out the treasures and the dead in it and becomes rid of them.

translation: And hearkens to its Lord and is dutiful,
sentence: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And listens submissively to its Lord, as it rightly should.

translation: O man, you have to strive and go on striving towards your Lord, then will you meet Him.
sentence: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O man, you are either doing good or evil and you will meet it on the Day of Judgment, so that Allah can give you the recompense for that.

translation: And he who is given his ledger in his right hand
sentence: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Since Allah mentioned man’s action in brief, he details the condition of those who did action on the day of judgment by saying: As for him who is given his book of deeds in his right hand.

translation: Will have an easy reckoning,
sentence: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He will have an easy reckoning by Allah and his actions will be presented to Him without his being taken to task.

translation: And will return to his people full of joy.
sentence: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ مَسْرُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he will return to his family delighted.

translation: But he who is given his ledger from behind his back
sentence: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهْرِهِۦ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for him who is given his book in his left hand behind his back.

translation: Will pray for death,
sentence: فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُوا۟ ثُبُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He will call out for destruction to himself.

translation: But will be roasted in the fire.
sentence: وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he will enter the fire of Hell to suffer from its heat.

translation: He lived rejoicing among his people,
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِىٓ أَهْلِهِۦ مَسْرُورًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In the world he was amongst his family rejoicing with his acts of disbelief and sins.

translation: Never thinking he will return.
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He thought that he will not come back to life after death.

translation: Why not? His Lord was always watching him.
sentence: بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, Allah will bring him back to life just as He created him the first time. His Lord was watchful of his condition. Nothing of that was hidden from Him and He will give him the recompense for his actions.

translation: So indeed I call to witness the evening twilight,
sentence: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah took an oath by the redness that is in the horizon after the sun sets.

translation: And the night and all it gathers,
sentence: وَٱلَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He took an oath by the night and what is gathered therein.

translation: And the moon when at the full,
sentence: وَٱلْقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the moon when it comes together and is complete becoming a full moon.

translation: That you will climb from stage to stage.
sentence: لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You, O man, will mount one state after another from a drop, then a clot, then a piece of flesh, then life, then death and then resurrection.

translation: So, wherefore do they not believe?
sentence: فَمَا لَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What is the matter with these disbelievers who do not have faith in Allah and the last day?!

translation: And when the Qur'an is recited to them do not bow in adoration?
sentence: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the Qur’ān is recited to them, they do not prostrate to their Lord?!

translation: In fact the unbelievers disavow.
sentence: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يُكَذِّبُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In fact, those who disbelieve reject what their messengers brought to them.

translation: But God knows what they harbour in their breasts.
sentence: وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah knows well what is contained in their hearts. Nothing of their actions is hidden from Him.

translation: So give them news of painful punishment,
sentence: فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Tell them, O Messenger, about a painful punishment that awaits them.

translation: Except those who believe and do the right: For them there is reward unending.
sentence: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except those who have faith in Allah and do good deeds, for them is a reward that will never terminate: Paradise.

translation: I CALL TO witness the sky (bespangled) with the signs of the Zodiac,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْبُرُوجِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah took an oath by the sky that contains the phases of the sun, moon etc.

translation: And the promised day,
sentence: وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْمَوْعُودِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by the day of judgment in which He promised to gather all creation.

translation: And the witness and the witnessed,
sentence: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by every witness, like the prophet who is a witness over his nation, and every thing witnessed, like the nation that is a witness over its prophet.

translation: That accursed are the men of the trench
sentence: قُتِلَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْأُخْدُودِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who made a huge crevice in the ground are cursed.

translation: Full of fire fed by faggots,
sentence: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلْوَقُودِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In which they lit a fire and threw the believers into it alive.

translation: As they sat around it
sentence: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: While they sat around that crevice filled with fire.

translation: Witnessing what they had done to the believers!
sentence: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They were witnesses to the torture and ill-treatment they meted out to the believers, as they were present there.

translation: They had no other reason for hating them except that they believed in God the mighty, worthy of praise,
sentence: وَمَا نَقَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These disbelievers found no fault in the believers except that they had faith in Allah, the Mighty, Whom none can overpower, the One Praised in everything.

translation: Whose kingdom spreads over the heavens and the earth. God is witness over everything.
sentence: ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The One to Whom alone belongs control of the heavens and control of the earth. He is aware of everything. No affair of His servants is hidden from Him.

translation: Surely for those who persecute believers, men and women, and do not repent afterwards, is the punishment of Hell, and the punishment of burning.
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا۟ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا۟ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who tortured the believing men and women with the fire in order to turn them away from having faith in Allah alone, and then did not repent to Allah from their sins, for them on the day of judgment is the punishment of Hell and for them is the punishment of the Fire that will burn them, as a recompense for their burning the believers in the fire.

translation: Surely for those who believe and do the right are gardens with rivers running by. That is the greatest success.
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who have faith in Allah and do good deeds, for them will be gardens under whose palaces and trees rivers flow. That reward, which is prepared for them, is the supreme success that no other success comes close to.

translation: The grip of your Lord is severe indeed!
sentence: إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The seizure of your Lord, O Messenger, of the wrongdoer - even if He gives his respite for a while - is forceful.

translation: It is verily He who initiates and repeats.
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ يُبْدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He begins the creation and the punishment and repeats them.

translation: He is the forgiving and the loving,
sentence: وَهُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلْوَدُودُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He is Forgiving of the sins of His servants who repent and He loves His allies who are Mindful.

translation: The Lord of the glorious Throne,
sentence: ذُو ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْمَجِيدُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Possessor of the Noble Throne.

translation: Who does as He pleases.
sentence: فَعَّالٌ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Doer of the what He wills such as pardoning the sins of whoever He wills and punishing whoever He wills. There is none that can compel Him, may He be glorified.

translation: Has the story of the hordes
sentence: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلْجُنُودِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Has the news of the forces who enlisted to combat and be an obstacle to the truth reached you, O Messenger?!

translation: Of Pharaoh and Thamud come to you?
sentence: فِرْعَوْنَ وَثَمُودَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pharaoh, and the Thamud, the people of Salih (peace be upon him).

translation: Yet the infidels persist in denial.
sentence: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى تَكْذِيبٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The obstacle to the faith of these people is not that the incidents of the destruction of the nations who denied did not come to them. Instead, they deny what their messengers brought to them due to following desires.

translation: But God surrounds them from all sides.
sentence: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَآئِهِم مُّحِيطٌۢ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah surrounds and keeps a record of their actions. Nothing of that misses him and He will give them the recompense for the same.

translation: This is indeed the glorious Qur'an
sentence: بَلْ هُوَ قُرْءَانٌ مَّجِيدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Qur’ān is neither poetry nor rhyme as the deniers claim. Instead, it is a noble Qur’ān.

translation: (Preserved) on the guarded tablet.
sentence: فِى لَوْحٍ مَّحْفُوظٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In a tablet that is protected against alteration and distortion, and decrease and increase.

translation: I CALL TO witness the heavens and the night Star --
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah took an oath by the sky and He took an oath by the star that knocks at night.

translation: How will you comprehend what the night star is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What will tell you the status of this great star?!

translation: It is the star that shines with a piercing brightness --
sentence: ٱلنَّجْمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is the star that pierces the sky with its glowing light.

translation: That over each soul there is a guardian.
sentence: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: There is no soul except that Allah has assigned to it an angel to record its deeds for the reckoning on the day of judgment.

translation: Let man consider what he was made of:
sentence: فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So let man reflect over what Allah created him from, so that Allah’s power and man’s inability becomes clear to him.

translation: He was created of spurting water
sentence: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٍ دَافِقٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah created him from a spurting liquid that is split into the womb.

translation: Issuing from (the pelvis) between the backbone and the ribs.
sentence: يَخْرُجُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ ٱلصُّلْبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This liquid emerges from between the spinal column of a man and the bones of the chest.

translation: God has certainly power to bring him back (from the dead).
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِۦ لَقَادِرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He, may He be glorified - since He created him from that despised liquid - has the power to bring him back to life after death for the reckoning and recompense.

translation: The day all secrets are examined
sentence: يَوْمَ تُبْلَى ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when secrets will be tried and the intentions, beliefs etc. that the hearts conceal will be exposed, and the righteous will be distinguished from the corrupt.

translation: He will have no strength or helper.
sentence: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that day man will not have any power to protect himself from Allah’s punishment, nor any helper to assist him.

translation: So I call to witness the rain-producing sky,
sentence: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجْعِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah took an oath by the sky that contains rain, because it comes down from its direction time after time.

translation: And the earth which opens up (with verdure),
sentence: وَٱلْأَرْضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدْعِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He took an oath by the earth that cracks open to reveal the plants, fruit and trees in it.

translation: That this (Qur'an) is a decisive word
sentence: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلٌ فَصْلٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This Qur’ān that is revealed to Muhammad (peace be upon him) is a word that separates truth from falsehood, and fact from lie.

translation: And no trifle.
sentence: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلْهَزْلِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not a game and falsehood, but it is serious and the truth.

translation: They are hatching up a plot,
sentence: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who deny what their messenger brought to them plot and scheme to reject and refute his call.

translation: But I too am devising a plan.
sentence: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I too plot and scheme to make the religion victorious and to disprove falsehood.

translation: So bear with unbelievers with patience, and give them respite for a while.
sentence: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ أَمْهِلْهُمْ رُوَيْدًۢا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So give respite, O Messenger, to these disbelievers. Give them respite for a short while, and do not seek to hasten their punishment and destruction.

translation: GLORIFY THE NAME of your Lord, most high,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ سَبِّحِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلْأَعْلَى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Declare the transcendence of your Lord Who is High above His creation, by uttering His Name when you remember and revere Him.

translation: Who creates and proportions,
sentence: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The One Who created man in due proportion and balanced his stature.

translation: Who determines and directs,
sentence: وَٱلَّذِى قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The One Who determined for all created things their species, types and attributes and Who guided every creation to what is appropriate and suitable for it.

translation: Who brings out the pastures
sentence: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَخْرَجَ ٱلْمَرْعَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The One Who brought out from the earth what your animals graze on.

translation: Then reduces them to rusty rubbish.
sentence: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَآءً أَحْوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The He made it into dry blackish straw after it had been green and fresh.

translation: We shall make you recite (the Qur'an) so that you will not forget it,
sentence: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will teach you, O Messenger, the Qur’ān, and gather it in your chest so you do not forget it. So do not race with Gabriel in the recitation as you used to do with the desire that you do not forget it.

translation: Unless God may please. He knows the visible and knows what is hidden.
sentence: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for what Allah wishes you to forget for some reason. He (may He be glorified) knows what is made public and what is hidden. Nothing of that is hidden from Him.

translation: We shall take you slowly towards ease.
sentence: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will make it easy for you to do actions that please Allah and enter you into Paradise.

translation: So remind them if reminder is profitable:
sentence: فَذَكِّرْ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So give counsel to people with the Qur’ān that I reveal to you and remind them as long as the reminder is heard.

translation: Those who fear will understand.
sentence: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who fears Allah will pay heed to your counsel, because he is the one who benefits from counsel.

translation: Only the wretch will turn aside,
sentence: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلْأَشْقَى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The disbeliever will keep away and alienate himself from the counsel, because he is the most wretched person in the afterlife as he will enter the Fire.

translation: Who will burn in the terrible Fire,
sentence: ٱلَّذِى يَصْلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who will enter the great Fire of the afterlife to suffer and bear its heat forever.

translation: In which he will neither die nor live.
sentence: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then he will remain forever in the Fire without dying therein and being relieved of the punishment he suffers from, and without living a good and decent life.

translation: Surely he will succeed who grows in goodness,
sentence: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who purified himself from idolatry and sins has attained the objective.

translation: And recites the name of his Lord and serves with devotion.
sentence: وَذَكَرَ ٱسْمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Who remembered his Lord by the various forms of remembrance that He ordained. Who discharged the prayer in the required manner.

translation: But no, you prefer the life of the world,
sentence: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But, you give preference to the worldly life and prefer it over the afterlife despite the huge disparity between them.

translation: Though the life to come is better and abiding.
sentence: وَٱلْءَاخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Hereafter is indeed, better and superior to the world and the enjoyments and pleasures it contains, and it is more lasting, because the bliss it contains does not ever end.

translation: This is surely in the earlier Books,
sentence: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِى ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These instructions and stories that I mentioned to you are in the scriptures revealed before you.

translation: The Books of Abraham and Moses.
sentence: صُحُفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These are the scriptures revealed to Abraham and Moses (peace be upon them).

translation: HAS NEWS OF the Overpowering Event reached you?
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلْغَٰشِيَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Has the news of the day of judgment that will overwhelm people with its horrors come to you, O Messenger?!

translation: Many faces will be contrite on that day,
sentence: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَٰشِعَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: People on the day of judgment will either be wretched or fortunate. The faces of the wretched will be humiliated and downcast.

translation: Labouring, wearied out,
sentence: عَامِلَةٌ نَّاصِبَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Tired and strained due to the chains that they will be dragged by and the shackles that they will be tied with.

translation: Burning in the scorching fire,
sentence: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those faces will enter a hot fire to suffer from its heat.

translation: Given water from the boiling spring to drink.
sentence: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ ءَانِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will be given to drink from a spring with extremely hot water.

translation: They will have no food except bitter thorn,
sentence: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They will not have any food to nourish them besides the worst and most rotten type of food from a plant that is called shibriq, which becomes poisonous when it becomes dry.

translation: Neither nourishing nor banishing hunger.
sentence: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِن جُوعٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It does not nourish the one who eats it nor does it satiate his hunger.

translation: Many faces will be joyous on that day,
sentence: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاعِمَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The faces of the fortunate on that day will display luxury, delight and happiness, because of the bliss they received.

translation: Well-pleased with their endeavour,
sentence: لِّسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Pleased with the righteous actions they did in the world, as they had found the reward of their actions stored up and multiplied.

translation: In the high empyrean,
sentence: فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In a Paradise elevated in position and rank.

translation: Never hearing idle talk.
sentence: لَّا تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لَٰغِيَةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In Paradise they will not hear any word of falsehood and futility, let alone hearing any prohibited word.

translation: There is a stream of running water in it;
sentence: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In this Paradise there are flowing springs that they will make flow and direct however they wish.

translation: And within it are couches placed on high,
sentence: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَّرْفُوعَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In it are high couches.

translation: Goblets set,
sentence: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَّوْضُوعَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And cups laid out and ready for drinking.

translation: Cushions arranged,
sentence: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In it are cushions packed closely to one another.

translation: And rich carpets spread.
sentence: وَزَرَابِىُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In it are carpets spread out here and there.

translation: Do they not then ponder how the clouds were formed;
sentence: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: After Allah mentioned the disparity between the states of the wretched and the fortunate in the afterlife, He directed the sight of the disbelievers to what will show them the power of the Creator and the beauty of His creation, so that they can use this as evidence for faith in order to enter Paradise and become of the fortunate, by saying: Do they not look with reflection at the camels, how Allah created them and subjugated them to human beings?!

translation: And the heavens, how it was raised high;
sentence: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And at the sky, how He raised it so that it became a protected ceiling above them, that does not fall on them?!

translation: And the mountains, how they were fixed;
sentence: وَإِلَى ٱلْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And at the mountains, how He erected them and used them to make the earth stable so that it does not shake with the people?!

translation: And the earth, how it was spread out?
sentence: وَإِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And at the earth, how He spread it out, and made it suitable for people to settle on?!

translation: Remind them; you are surely a reminder.
sentence: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: After He directed them to look at those things that show His Power, He directed His messenger, saying: So counsel, O Messenger, these people and warn them of Allah’s punishment. You are but one who reminds. You are only required to remind them. Guiding them to faith is in Allah's hands alone.

translation: You are not a warden over them,
sentence: لَّسْتَ عَلَيْهِم بِمُصَيْطِرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You have not been given control over them so that you can compel them to have faith.

translation: Other than him who turns his back and denies,
sentence: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But, those of them who turn away from faith and reject Allah and His messenger.

translation: In which case he will be punished by God with the severest punishment.
sentence: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَكْبَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah will punish them on the Day of Judgement with the greatest punishment by entering them into Hell to remain there forever.

translation: To Us is surely their returning;
sentence: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَآ إِيَابَهُمْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: To Me alone is their return after their death.

translation: Ours is surely then to reckon with them.
sentence: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُم
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then it is My duty alone to call them to account for their actions. This is not for you or anyone besides you.

translation: I CALL TO witness the dawn
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلْفَجْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah may He be glorified takes an oath on the dawn.

translation: And the Ten Nights,
sentence: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He takes an oath on the first ten nights of Dhul-Ḥijjah.

translation: The multiple and the one,
sentence: وَٱلشَّفْعِ وَٱلْوَتْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He also takes an oath on the odd and even of things.

translation: The night as it advances,
sentence: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He takes an oath on the night when it arrives, continues and goes away. The complement of these oaths is: you will definitely be requited for your actions.

translation: Is there not an evidence in this for those who have sense?
sentence: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In any of the aforementioned, is there any oath that benefits the intelligent one?

translation: Have you not seen what your Lord did to the 'Ad
sentence: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Do you not see what your Lord did with the ‘Ād i.e. the people of Hud, when they rejected their Messenger?

translation: Of Eram with lofty pillars (erected as signposts in the desert),
sentence: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلْعِمَادِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The tribe of ‘Ād that traced to its forefather, the tall Iram.

translation: The like of whom were never created in the realm;
sentence: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَٰدِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The likes of which Allah never created in the cities.

translation: And with Thamud who carved rocks in the valley;
sentence: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُوا۟ ٱلصَّخْرَ بِٱلْوَادِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And do you not see what your Lord did with the Thamūd i.e. the tribe of Saleh, who would carve the stones of the mountains, making houses out of them.

translation: And the mighty Pharaoh
sentence: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِى ٱلْأَوْتَادِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And do you not see what your Lord did to Pharaoh, who had pegs with which he punished the people?

translation: Who terrorised the region,
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْبِلَٰدِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: All these people transgressed the limit in tyranny and oppression; each of them transgressed it in his land.

translation: And multiplied corruption.
sentence: فَأَكْثَرُوا۟ فِيهَا ٱلْفَسَادَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They caused an abundance of corruption due to spreading disbelief and sins.

translation: So your Lord poured a scourge of punishment over them.
sentence: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Allah made them suffer His severe punishment, and annihilated them off the earth.

translation: Your Lord is certainly in wait.
sentence: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلْمِرْصَادِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, your Lord watches over and observes the actions of the people, so that He can requite whoever does good with Paradise, and whoever does evil with the hellfire.

translation: As for man, whenever his Lord tries him and then is gracious and provides good things for him, he says: "My Lord has been gracious to me."
sentence: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Because the nations Allah destroyed were blessed with power and strength, Allah explains that blessing them with such is not proof of His being pleased with them. He says: As for the human, it is in his nature that when he is tested by his Lord and He favours him by blessing him with wealth, honour and offspring, he thinks that it is because of his nobility in the eyes of Allah. He says: “My Lord has favoured me because of me being worthy of being favoured.”

translation: But when He tries him by restraining his means, he says: "My Lord despises me."
sentence: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَٰنَنِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And as for when He tests him by restricting his sustenance, he thinks it is because of his insignificance in the eyes of his Lord. So he says: “My Lord has disgraced me.”

translation: No. In fact you are not generous to the orphans,
sentence: كَلَّا بَل لَّا تُكْرِمُونَ ٱلْيَتِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Never! It is not as this human thinks, that favouring is proof of Allah being pleased with His servant, and that misfortune is proof of the servant’s insignificance in the eyes of his Lord. Rather, the reality is that you do not show generosity towards the orphan from the sustenance Allah has provided you with.

translation: Nor do you urge one another to feed the poor,
sentence: وَلَا تَحَٰٓضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Neither do any of you encourage the other in feeding the poor person who cannot find anything to consume.

translation: And you devour (others') inheritance greedily,
sentence: وَتَأْكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكْلًا لَّمًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You relentlessly devour the rights of the weak, i.e. the women and orphans, without consideration for its permissibility.

translation: And love wealth with all your heart.
sentence: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلْمَالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And you intensely love wealth, being miserly in spending it in the path of Allah, due to your greed of it.

translation: Surely when We pound the earth to powder grounded, pounded to dust,
sentence: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: These actions are not befitting of you. Remember when the earth will be moved vigorously and shaken.

translation: And comes your Lord, and angels row on row,
sentence: وَجَآءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلْمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And your Lord will come, O Messenger, to pass judgement between His servants, and the angels will also come arranged in rows.

translation: And Hell is brought near, that day will man remember, but of what avail will then remembering be?
sentence: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And on that day, hell will be brought with it having seventy thousand reins, each rein being pulled by seventy thousand angels. On that day, the human will remember his shortcomings in the rights of Allah, but that remembrance on that day will not benefit him in the slightest, because it will be a Day of Requital, not action!

translation: He will say: "Alas the woe! Would that I had sent ahead something in my life."
sentence: يَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He will say out of intense regret: “If only I had sent forth good deeds for my life Hereafter, which is the real life.”

translation: None can punish as He will punish on that day,
sentence: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that day no one will penalise like the penalising of Allah, because the penalising of Allah is most severe and lasting.

translation: And none can bind as He will bind.
sentence: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Neither will anyone bind in chains like His binding of the disbelievers in chains.

translation: O you tranquil soul,
sentence: يَٰٓأَيَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفْسُ ٱلْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: After Allah mentioned the requital of the disbelievers, He mentions the requital of the believers. He says: As for the soul of the believer, it will be told at the time of death and on the Day of Judgement: “O the soul contented with faith and good deeds!”

translation: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and well-pleasing Him.
sentence: ٱرْجِعِىٓ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَّرْضِيَّةً
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Return to your Lord, pleased with Him because of the abundant reward you will receive, and with Him may He be glorified being pleased with you because of your good deeds.”

translation: "Enter then among My votaries,
sentence: فَٱدْخُلِى فِى عِبَٰدِى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “Now enter along with My pious servants.”

translation: Enter then My garden."
sentence: وَٱدْخُلِى جَنَّتِى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And enter with them into My Paradise, which I have prepared for them.”

translation: I CALL THIS earth to witness --
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the sacred city i.e. Makkah Al-Mukarramah

translation: And you are free to live upon it, --
sentence: وَأَنتَ حِلٌّۢ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! It is permissible for you to do whatever you wish on the Day of the Conquest of Makkah, from capital punishment to those whom are deserving of it, to taking captive whomsoever deserves it.

translation: And the parent and the offspring,
sentence: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Allah takes an oath on the father of humanity, also taking an oath on the offspring reproduced from him.

translation: That We created man in toil and trouble.
sentence: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ فِى كَبَدٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, I have created the human in tiredness and difficulty, because of the severities he experiences in the world.

translation: Does he think that no one has power over him?
sentence: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does the human think that when he sins, no one is in a position to be able to do anything to him, nor take retribution from him, even if it is his Lord who created him?

translation: He says: "I have wasted a great deal of wealth."
sentence: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُّبَدًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He says: “I spent a lot of wealth, heaped up.”

translation: Does he think that no one sees him?
sentence: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّمْ يَرَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does this person boastful over the wealth he has spent think that Allah does not see him? And that He will not take him to account over his wealth: how he earned it and where he spent it?

translation: Did We not give him two eyes,
sentence: أَلَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عَيْنَيْنِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Did I not create eyes for him with which he can see?

translation: One tongue, and two lips,
sentence: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And a tongue and lips with which he can speak?

translation: And showed him two highways (of good and evil)?
sentence: وَهَدَيْنَٰهُ ٱلنَّجْدَيْنِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I made the paths of goodness and evils known to him.

translation: But he could not scale the steep ascent.
sentence: فَلَا ٱقْتَحَمَ ٱلْعَقَبَةَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He will be required to cross the valley that separates him from Paradise, which he will cross.

translation: How will you comprehend what the Steep ascent is? --
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْعَقَبَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Do you know what the valley is that he has to cross, in order to enter Paradise?

translation: To free a neck (from the burden of debt or slavery),
sentence: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is to free a male or female slave.

translation: Or to feed in times of famine
sentence: أَوْ إِطْعَٰمٌ فِى يَوْمٍ ذِى مَسْغَبَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or to feed on a day of drought, in which food is scarce.

translation: The orphan near in relationship,
sentence: يَتِيمًا ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A child who has lost his father, whom he is related to.

translation: Or the poor in distress;
sentence: أَوْ مِسْكِينًا ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or a poor person who has no possessions.

translation: And to be of those who believe, and urge upon one another to persevere, and urge upon each other to be kind.
sentence: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then he is required to be from those who have faith in Allah and advise each other to remain steadfast on act of obedience and refraining from sins, and bearing patience over difficulties, together with advising one another to show mercy to the servants of Allah.

translation: They are the people of the right hand (and will succeed).
sentence: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَيْمَنَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those are the people of the right.

translation: But those who deny Our revelations are the people of the left hand:
sentence: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for those who disbelieve in My verses that were revealed to My Messenger, they are the people of the left.

translation: The Fire will vault them over.
sentence: عَلَيْهِمْ نَارٌ مُّؤْصَدَةٌۢ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: A closed fire will be set upon them on the Day of Judgement, with which they will be punished.

translation: I CALL TO witness the sun and his early morning splendour,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلشَّمْسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the sun and its rising after breaking onto the eastern horizon.

translation: And the moon as she follows in his wake,
sentence: وَٱلْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He also takes an oath on the moon when it follows the sun after it has set.

translation: The day when it reveals his radiance,
sentence: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah also takes an oath on the day when it reveals whatever is on the face of the earth through its light.

translation: The night when it covers him over,
sentence: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the night when it covers the face of the earth, darkening it.

translation: The heavens and its architecture,
sentence: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He takes an oath on the sky, taking an oath on its perfect creation.

translation: The earth and its spreading out,
sentence: وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He also takes an oath on the earth: the way it has been spread so that people can live on it.

translation: The soul and how it was integrated
sentence: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He also takes an oath on each soul, with Allah having created it equally.

translation: And given the faculty of knowing what is disruptive and what is intrinsic to it.
sentence: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then He made it understand - without teaching it - what was evil so it could be abstained from, and what was good so it could be implemented.

translation: He who nourishes it will surely be successful,
sentence: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, the one who has purified his soul by adorning it with virtuous characteristics and freeing it from evil traits, has succeeded.

translation: And he who confines it will surely come to grief.
sentence: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And verily the one who has secretly thrust his soul into sins and disobedience, has lost.

translation: The Thamud denied (the truth) in their perverseness
sentence: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِطَغْوَىٰهَآ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: After Allah mentions the loss of the one who thrust his soul secretly into sins, He mentions the Thamūd as an example of that, saying: The Thamūd rejected their Prophet Saleh due to their transgressing the limits in committing sins and disobedience.

translation: When among them the great wretch arose,
sentence: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشْقَىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the most wretched among them stood up after his people has appointed him for the task.

translation: And the apostle of God had to tell them: "This is God's she-camel, let her drink."
sentence: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقْيَٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Messenger of Allah Saleh (peace be upon him) said to them: “Leave the camel of Allah alone; let it drink on its day and do not pursue it intending evil.”

translation: But they called him a liar and hamstrung her. So God obliterated them for their crime, and (destroyed) all of them alike.
sentence: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمْ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: But they rejected their Messenger with regards to the camel, and so the most wretched among them killed it with the consent of his people. Therefore, they were all guilty of the crime and so Allah enveloped them into His punishment and destroyed them by a shriek due to their sins. He made them equal in the punishment that He destroyed them with.

translation: He does not fear the consequence.
sentence: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقْبَٰهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah set the punishment that destroyed them, upon them, without Him, may He be glorified, fearing any reproach over His actions.

translation: I CALL THE night to witness when it covers over,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the night when it covers whatever is between the heavens and the earth with its darkness.

translation: And the day when it shines in all its glory,
sentence: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And Allah takes an oath on the day when it becomes clear and visible.

translation: And Him who created the male and female,
sentence: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He takes an oath on His creating the two genders: The male and female.

translation: That your endeavour is for different ends.
sentence: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people! Your actions are different: some are good, which are the causes of entering Paradise, while others are evil, which are the causes of entering the hellfire.

translation: Yet he who gives to others and has fear,
sentence: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the one who gives whatever is necessary for him to spend, i.e. Zakat, financial support and repatriation, and is mindful of that which Allah has prohibited him from.

translation: And affirms goodness,
sentence: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلْحُسْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And he believes in the substitute Allah has promised him.

translation: We shall ease the way of fortune for him.
sentence: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I shall soon make performing good deeds and spending in My path easy for him.

translation: But he who does not give and is unconcerned,
sentence: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسْتَغْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And as for the one who is miserly with his wealth and does not spend it in the avenues necessary for him to spend in, thinking himself to be in no need of Allah and not asking Allah for any of His grace.

translation: And rejects goodness,
sentence: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلْحُسْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Whilst rejecting the substitute and reward Allah has promised him if he spends his wealth in His path.

translation: For him We shall ease the way of adversity,
sentence: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will soon make performing evil deeds easy for him, and make difficult doing good.

translation: And his riches will not avail him when he falls headlong (into the Abyss).
sentence: وَمَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His wealth that he is miserly with will not benefit him at all when he dies and enters the hellfire.

translation: It is indeed for Us to show the way,
sentence: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا لَلْهُدَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, it is My responsibility to make the path of truth clear from the path of falsehood.

translation: And to Us belong the End and the Beginning.
sentence: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلْءَاخِرَةَ وَٱلْأُولَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, the afterlife and the worldly life belongs to Me; I do whatever I want with it. That is not the case with anyone else.

translation: So, I warn you of the blazing Fire.
sentence: فَأَنذَرْتُكُمْ نَارًا تَلَظَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So O people! If you disobey Me, I warn you of the hellfire which is being kindled.

translation: No one will burn in it but the most wretched,
sentence: لَا يَصْلَىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلْأَشْقَى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: None will suffer the heat of this fire except the most wretched, i.e. the disbeliever.

translation: Who denied (the truth) and turned away.
sentence: ٱلَّذِى كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who rejected whatever the Messenger (peace be upon him) brought, and turned away from fulfilling the command of Allah.

translation: But save him who fears
sentence: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلْأَتْقَى
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The most Allah-conscious of the people will be distanced from it, i.e. Abu Bakr.

translation: And gives of his wealth that he may grow in virtue,
sentence: ٱلَّذِى يُؤْتِى مَالَهُۥ يَتَزَكَّىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who spends his wealth in righteous avenues, to purify himself of sins.

translation: And is under no one's obligation to return his favour,
sentence: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He does not spend whatever wealth he spends, to repay any favour done to him by anyone.

translation: Other than seeking the glory of his Lord, most high,
sentence: إِلَّا ٱبْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Through his spending, he only intends the pleasure of his Lord who is High above His creation.

translation: Will surely be gratified.
sentence: وَلَسَوْفَ يَرْضَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, soon, he will be pleased with the generous reward Allah will grant him.

translation: I CALL TO witness the early hours of morning,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلضُّحَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the beginning of the day.

translation: And the night when dark and still,
sentence: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He takes an oath on the night when it darkens and people cease to move in it.

translation: Your Lord has neither left you, nor despises you.
sentence: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Your Lord has not left you, nor has he begun to hate you, as the idolaters claimed when there was a break in the revelation.

translation: What is to come is better for you than what has gone before;
sentence: وَلَلْءَاخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the abode of the afterlife is better for you than the worldly one, because of the everlasting bounties that it has.

translation: For your Lord will certainly give you, and you will be content.
sentence: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Very soon He will grant you an abundant reward, and your nation also, until you become content with what He has granted you and your nation.

translation: Did He not find you an orphan and take care of you?
sentence: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَـَٔاوَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, He found you at a time when you were a child whose father had passed away, and so He made a place of refuge for you by causing your grandfather Abdul Muttalib to become fond of you, and then your uncle Abu Talib.

translation: Did He not find you perplexed, and show you the way?
sentence: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلًّا فَهَدَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He found you in a state where you did not know what revelation or faith was, and so He taught you about that which you did not know.

translation: Did He not find you poor and enrich you?
sentence: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He found you poor, so He made you self-sufficient.

translation: So do not oppress the orphan,
sentence: فَأَمَّا ٱلْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Therefore, do not treat badly the one who has lost his father in childhood, nor look down upon him.

translation: And do not drive the beggar away,
sentence: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّآئِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And do not rebuke the needy beggar.

translation: And keep recounting the favours of your Lord.
sentence: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And be grateful for the favours of Allah upon you, and talk about them.

translation: HAVE WE NOT opened up your breast
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, Allah has opened up your heart for you and made receiving revelation beloved to you.

translation: And removed your burden
sentence: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنكَ وِزْرَكَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I have removed sin from you.

translation: Which had left you devoid of hope,
sentence: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: That which was burdening you to the extent that it almost broke your back.

translation: And exalted your fame?
sentence: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And I elevated for you your mention, so you are now remembered in the call to prayer, and the call preceding the prayer, and at other times.

translation: Surely with hardship there is ease.
sentence: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, with difficulty and constraint, comes ease and options.

translation: With hardship indeed there is ease.
sentence: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, with difficulty and constraint, comes ease and options; when you know that well, the troubling of your people will not terrify you and will not stop you from calling towards Allah.

translation: So when you are free work diligently,
sentence: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَٱنصَبْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when you finish your work and complete it, strive in the worship of your Lord.

translation: And turn to your Lord with all your love.
sentence: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرْغَب
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And divert your passion and resolve towards Allah alone.

translation: I CALL TO witness the Fig and the Olive,
sentence: بِّسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلتِّينِ وَٱلزَّيْتُونِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the fig and the place it grows, and the olive and the place it grows: the land of Palestine where Jesus (peace be upon him) was sent as a Messenger.

translation: The Mount Sinai,
sentence: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He takes an oath on Mount Sinai, near where Allah conversed intimately with Moses (peace be upon him).

translation: And this Soil Secure,
sentence: وَهَٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ ٱلْأَمِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He takes an oath on Makkah, the sacred city which gives sanctuary to whoever enters it, and in which Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent as a Messenger.

translation: That We created man of finest possibilities,
sentence: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ فِىٓ أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Verily, I have created the human in the most balanced of ways and the best appearance.

translation: Then brought him down to the lowest of the low,
sentence: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَٰهُ أَسْفَلَ سَٰفِلِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then I return him to old age and childishness in the world, so he cannot benefit fully from his body, when he ruins his nature and goes towards the hellfire.

translation: Except those who believe and do the right, for whom there is reward undiminished.
sentence: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for those who have faith in Allah and do good deeds, because they, despite growing old, will get an everlasting reward i.e. Paradise, because they kept their nature pure.

translation: Who should then make you deny the Judgement after this?
sentence: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So O human! What causes you to reject the Day of Requital, after you have seen the many signs of His power?

translation: Is not God the most equitable of all judges?
sentence: أَلَيْسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحْكَمِ ٱلْحَٰكِمِينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Is Allah not the most just and fair of judges by having appointed the Day of Judgement for requital? Is it comprehendible that Allah leaves His servants in vain, without judging between them, by not requiting the doer of good for his good, and the evil-doer for his evil?

translation: READ IN THE name of your Lord who created,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱقْرَأْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Read what Allah reveals to you, starting with the name of your Lord who created the creation.

translation: Created man from an embryo;
sentence: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِنْ عَلَقٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He created the human from a clot of congealed blood, after it had been a drop of semen.

translation: Read, for your Lord is most beneficent,
sentence: ٱقْرَأْ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْأَكْرَمُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Read what Allah reveals to you. Your Lord is the most Kind; no kind person can come to His kindness, because He has abundant generosity and goodness.

translation: Who taught by the pen,
sentence: ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَ بِٱلْقَلَمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who taught to write, and the revelation, through the pen.

translation: Taught man what he did not know.
sentence: عَلَّمَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He taught the human that which he did not know.

translation: And yet, but yet man is rebellious,
sentence: كَلَّآ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ لَيَطْغَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Truly, indeed, the transgressing human i.e. Abu Jahl, has crossed the limit in overstepping the limits of Allah.

translation: For he thinks he is sufficient in himself.
sentence: أَن رَّءَاهُ ٱسْتَغْنَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Just because he has seen him showing no need of the prestige and wealth he possesses.

translation: Surely your returning is to your Lord.
sentence: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلرُّجْعَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O human! Indeed, to your Lord is the return on the Day of Judgement, where He will requite each person with what he deserves.

translation: Have you seen him who restrains
sentence: أَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى يَنْهَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Have you seen anything more shocking than the matter of Abu Jahl, who prevented.

translation: A votary when he turns to his devotions?
sentence: عَبْدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He prevented My servant Muhammad (peace be upon him) when he performed prayer near the Ka‘bah.

translation: Have you thought, if he had been on guidance
sentence: أَرَءَيْتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What do you think will happen, if this person who has been prevented, is following guidance and foresight from his Lord?

translation: Or had enjoined piety, (it would have been better)?
sentence: أَوْ أَمَرَ بِٱلتَّقْوَىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Or that he instructs the people to be mindful of Allah by fulfilling His commands and refrain from the things he has not allowed; can such a person be prevented?

translation: Have you thought that if he denies and turns away,
sentence: أَرَءَيْتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What do you think will happen if this preventer rejected whatever the Messenger brought and turned away from it? Does he not fear Allah?

translation: Does he not know that God sees?
sentence: أَلَمْ يَعْلَم بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرَىٰ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does the preventer of this servant from prayer not know that Allah sees whatever he does, and that nothing is hidden from Him?

translation: And yet indeed if he does not desist We shall drag him by the forelock,
sentence: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not as this ignorant person imagines; if he does not stop causing harm to My servant and rejecting him, I will definitely seize him and drag him violently by the top of his head, towards the hellfire.

translation: By the lying, the sinful forelock.
sentence: نَاصِيَةٍ كَٰذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The owner of that forehead is a liar in speech and erroneous in action.

translation: So let him call his associates,
sentence: فَلْيَدْعُ نَادِيَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So when he is seized by his forehead towards the hellfire, let him call out to his companions and associates asking for their help to save him from the punishment.

translation: We shall call the guards of Hell.
sentence: سَنَدْعُ ٱلزَّبَانِيَةَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I will call upon the gatekeepers of hell: the fierce angels who do not disobey My command when I command them, and do whatever they are commanded to do. It will then be seen which of the two parties are stronger and more capable.

translation: Beware! Do not obey him, but bow in adoration and draw near (to your Lord).
sentence: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعْهُ وَٱسْجُدْ وَٱقْتَرِب
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not as this oppressor thinks: that he can cause any harm to you. So do not follow him in command or prohibition; rather, prostrate to Allah and draw closer to Him through acts of obedience, because that is how you can draw closer to Him.

translation: TRULY WE REVEALED it on the Night of Determination.
sentence: بِّسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِنَّآ أَنزَلْنَٰهُ فِى لَيْلَةِ ٱلْقَدْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, I revealed the Qur’ān at once to the heaven nearest to the world, just as I started off revealing it to Muhammad (peace be upon him), on the Night of Decree in the month of Ramadan.

translation: How will you know what the Night of Determination is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ ٱلْقَدْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Prophet! Do you know what goodness and blessings lie in this night?

translation: Better is the Night of Determination than a thousand months.
sentence: لَيْلَةُ ٱلْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This night is a night of great goodness; it is better than a thousand months for the one who stands in prayer during it, whilst having faith and hoping for reward.

translation: On (this night) the angels and grace descend by the dispensation of their Lord, for settling all affairs.
sentence: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The angels and Gabriel (peace be upon him) descend during it with the permission of their Lord (may He be glorified), bringing every matter Allah has decreed to happen that year, whether it be sustenance, deaths, births or anything else He has decreed.

translation: It is peace till the dawning of the day.
sentence: سَلَٰمٌ هِىَ حَتَّىٰ مَطْلَعِ ٱلْفَجْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This whole blessed night contains goodness, right from its beginning until its end, with the breaking of dawn.

translation: THOSE AMONG THE people of the Book who disbelieve, and the idolaters, would not have been freed (from false beliefs) until the clear proof came to them --
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ لَمْ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who disbelieved, from the Jews, the Christians and the idolaters, are not going to break their consensus and agreement on disbelief, until a clear proof and manifest evidence comes to them.

translation: An Apostle from God, reading out hallowed pages
sentence: رَسُولٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتْلُوا۟ صُحُفًا مُّطَهَّرَةً
