en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: This clear proof and manifest evidence is a Messenger from Allah whom He has sent, and who recites pure scriptures, only the purest of beings may touch them.

translation: Containing firm decrees.
sentence: فِيهَا كُتُبٌ قَيِّمَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: In those scriptures is true information and fair rulings, which guide the people towards that in which lies their righteousness and decency.

translation: The people of the Book were not divided among themselves till after the clear proof had come to them.
sentence: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The Jews who were given the Torah and the Christians who were given the Gospel, did not disagree except after Allah sent His Prophet to them. There were some who became Muslims, and others who persisted in their disbelief despite knowing of the truth of their Prophet.

translation: They were commanded only to serve God with all-exclusive faith in Him, to be upright, and to fulfil their devotional obligations, and to give zakat; for this is the even way.
sentence: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓا۟ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلْقَيِّمَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The criminality and stubbornness of the Jews and the Christians is evident, in that they have not been commanded in this Qur’ān, except to do those very things they have been commanded to do in both their books, i.e. worshipping Allah alone, refraining from ascribing partners to Him, establishing prayer and giving in Zakat. So whatever they have been commanded to do, is actually the straight religion in which there is no deviance.

translation: Surely the unbelievers among the people of the Book and the idolaters, will abide in the fire of Hell. They are the worst of creatures.
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ فِى نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, those who disbelieved - from the Jews, the Christians and the idolaters - will enter into hell on the Day of Judgement, wherein they shall remain forever. They are the worst of the creation because of their disbelief in Allah and rejection of His Messenger.

translation: But those who believe and do the right are surely the best of created beings,
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, those who have faith in Allah and do good deeds, they are the ones who are the best of creation.

translation: Whose reward is with their Lord -- gardens of Eden with rivers flowing by, where they will abide for ever, God pleased with their service, they with obedience to Him. This (awaits) him who stands in awe of his Lord.
sentence: جَزَآؤُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّٰتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا رَّضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِىَ رَبَّهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Their reward with their Lord (may He be glorified) is gardens under the trees and palaces of which rivers flow, and wherein they shall remain forever. Allah is pleased with them because of them bringing faith in Him and obeying Him, and they are also pleased with Him because of Him giving them His mercy. This mercy can be acquired by the one who fears his Lord, and so fulfils His command and refrains from the thing He has not allowed.

translation: WHEN THE WORLD is shaken up by its cataclysm,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: When the earth will be shaken vigorously, which will happen to it on the Day of Judgement.

translation: And the earth throws out its burdens,
sentence: وَأَخْرَجَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the earth will remove everything from within itself, i.e. the dead and other things.

translation: And man enquires: "What has come over it?"
sentence: وَقَالَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَا لَهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the human will say, confused: “What is the matter with the earth, that it is moving and shaking?”

translation: That day it will narrate its annals,
sentence: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخْبَارَهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that great day, the earth will inform regarding the good and evil deeds that were committed upon it.

translation: For your Lord will have commanded it.
sentence: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوْحَىٰ لَهَا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Because Allah will have taught it and commanded it to do so.

translation: That day people will proceed separately to be shown their deeds.
sentence: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِّيُرَوْا۟ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On that great day on which the earth will quake, the humans will come to of the place of reckoning in groups, to see the deeds they committed in the world.

translation: Whosoever has done even an atom's weight of good will behold it;
sentence: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So whoever did a good or righteous deed equal to the weight of a small ant, will see it in front of him.

translation: And whosoever has done even an atom's weight of evil will behold that.
sentence: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And whoever did an evil deed equal to that, will see that in front of him also.

translation: I CALL TO witness the chargers, snorting, rushing to battle before the others,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلْعَٰدِيَٰتِ ضَبْحًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah takes an oath on the horses that run so hard that their breath can be heard.

translation: Then those striking sparks of fire,
sentence: فَٱلْمُورِيَٰتِ قَدْحًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the horses who, when their shoes strike the stones with force, sparks fly.

translation: Then those charging in the morning
sentence: فَٱلْمُغِيرَٰتِ صُبْحًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And He also takes an oath on the horses that raid the enemy at dawn.

translation: Raising clouds of dust,
sentence: فَأَثَرْنَ بِهِۦ نَقْعًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And unsettle the dust by their running.

translation: Penetrating deep into the armies,
sentence: فَوَسَطْنَ بِهِۦ جَمْعًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They then take their riders collectively into the midst of the enemy.

translation: That man is ungrateful to his Lord
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ لِرَبِّهِۦ لَكَنُودٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the human is hesitant of the goodness his Lord intends from him.

translation: And is himself witness to it,
sentence: وَإِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, he is witness to the goodness he is hesitant in giving; he cannot deny it because of its clarity.

translation: And is intractable in his love of worldly goods.
sentence: وَإِنَّهُۥ لِحُبِّ ٱلْخَيْرِ لَشَدِيدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And indeed, he is miserly with his wealth due to his extreme love for it.

translation: Does he not know when the contents of the graves are laid bare
sentence: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِى ٱلْقُبُورِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Does this human, deceived by the worldly life, not know that when Allah will resurrect the dead from their graves and take them out of the earth to take them to account and requite them, that the matter will not be as he imagines?

translation: And the secrets of the hearts exposed,
sentence: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِى ٱلصُّدُورِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the intentions, beliefs etc. within the hearts will be made clear and apparent.

translation: Surely their Lord will be aware of their (deeds).
sentence: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّخَبِيرٌۢ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, their Lord will be aware of every matter of theirs on that day; none of the affairs of His servants will be hidden from Him, and He will requite them for that.

translation: THE STARTLING CALAMITY.
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱلْقَارِعَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The hour that strikes the hearts of people because of the severity of its horrors.

translation: What is the startling calamity?
sentence: مَا ٱلْقَارِعَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: What is this hour that strikes the hearts of people because of the severity of its horrors?

translation: How will you comprehend what the startling calamity is? --
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْقَارِعَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! And what do you know of this hour that strikes the hearts of people because of the severity of its horrors? It is the Day of Judgement.

translation: A Day on which human beings would be like so many scattered moths,
sentence: يَوْمَ يَكُونُ ٱلنَّاسُ كَٱلْفَرَاشِ ٱلْمَبْثُوثِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the day when the hearts of people will be struck, they will be like locusts, dispersed here and there.

translation: The mountains like the tufts of carded wool.
sentence: وَتَكُونُ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَٱلْعِهْنِ ٱلْمَنفُوشِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And the mountains will be like carded wool, in the way they will move from their places with force.

translation: Then he whose deeds shall weigh heavier in the scale
sentence: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: As for the one whose good deeds will outweigh his evil deeds.

translation: Will have a tranquil life;
sentence: فَهُوَ فِى عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He will live a contented life which he will achieve in Paradise.

translation: But he whose deeds are lighter in the balance
sentence: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And as for the one whose evil deeds outweigh his good deeds.

translation: Will have the Abyss for abode.
sentence: فَأُمُّهُۥ هَاوِيَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: His abode and permanent resting place will be hell on the Day of Judgement.

translation: How will you comprehend what that is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا هِيَهْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What do you know what that is?

translation: It is the scorching fire.
sentence: نَارٌ حَامِيَةٌۢ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is the intensely hot hellfire.

translation: THE AVARICE OF plenitude keeps you occupied
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ أَلْهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O people! Boasting with one another over wealth and offspring has preoccupied you from the obedience of Allah.

translation: Till you reach the grave.
sentence: حَتَّىٰ زُرْتُمُ ٱلْمَقَابِرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Until you die and enter your graves.

translation: But you will come to know soon; --
sentence: كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not befitting that boasting with one another over that preoccupies you from the obedience of Allah; you will soon know the consequence of that preoccupation.

translation: Indeed you will come to know soon.
sentence: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You will surely realise its outcome.

translation: And yet if you knew with positive knowledge
sentence: كَلَّا لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عِلْمَ ٱلْيَقِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Truly, if you were to know with certainty that you are to be resurrected to Allah, and that He will requite you for your actions, you would not become preoccupied with boasting with one another over wealth and offspring.

translation: You have indeed to behold Hell;
sentence: لَتَرَوُنَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: By Allah! You will definitely witness the hellfire on the Day of Judgement.

translation: Then you will see it with the eye of certainty.
sentence: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيْنَ ٱلْيَقِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then, you will definitely see it in a way you will become undoubtedly convinced.

translation: Then on that day you will surely be asked about the verity of pleasures.
sentence: ثُمَّ لَتُسْـَٔلُنَّ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَنِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then Allah will surely ask you on that day regarding the health, wealth etc. that He favoured you with.

translation: TIME AND AGE are witness
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلْعَصْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah may He be glorified takes an oath on time.

translation: Man is certainly loss,
sentence: إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ لَفِى خُسْرٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, the human is in great loss and destruction.

translation: Except those who believe, and do good and enjoin truth on one another, and enjoin one another to bear with fortitude (the trials that befall).
sentence: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Except for those who have faith in Allah and His Messenger, perform good deeds, and encourage each other to follow the truth and remain steadfast upon it. Those who have these qualities are the ones who are successful in the world and the afterlife.

translation: WOE TO EVERY slanderer, back-biter,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٍ لُّمَزَةٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Evil consequences and a severe punishment awaits the one who frequently backbites the people and taunts them.

translation: Who amasses wealth and hordes it.
sentence: ٱلَّذِى جَمَعَ مَالًا وَعَدَّدَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one whose only concern is to amass wealth and count it; he has no other concern.

translation: Does he think his wealth will abide for ever with him?
sentence: يَحْسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُۥٓ أَخْلَدَهُۥ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He thinks that the wealth of his he amasses will save him from death, and that he will remain forever in this worldly life.

translation: By no means. He will be thrown into Hutama.
sentence: كَلَّا لَيُنۢبَذَنَّ فِى ٱلْحُطَمَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is not as this ignorant one thinks; he will surely be thrown into the fire of hell that crushes and breaks everything that is thrown into it, due to its immense strength.

translation: How will you comprehend what Hutama is?
sentence: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْحُطَمَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! What do you know of this fire that smashes everything that is thrown into it?

translation: It is the fire kindled by God
sentence: نَارُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمُوقَدَةُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, it is the blazing fire of Allah.

translation: Which penetrates the hearts
sentence: ٱلَّتِى تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى ٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The fire that penetrates the bodies of the people until it reaches their hearts.

translation: (And) vaults them over
sentence: إِنَّهَا عَلَيْهِم مُّؤْصَدَةٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, it will close up around those that will be punished with it.

translation: In extending columns.
sentence: فِى عَمَدٍ مُّمَدَّدَةٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: For a prolonged, lengthy period of time, so long that they will never leave it.

translation: HAVE YOU NOT seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephants?
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْفِيلِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Do you not know how your Lord dealt with Abraha and his people: the people of the elephant, when they intended to demolish the Ka‘bah?

translation: Did He not make their plan go wrong,
sentence: أَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ كَيْدَهُمْ فِى تَضْلِيلٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah made their evil plot to destroy it in vain; they did not achieve what they desired in trying to turn the people away from the Ka‘bah. They did not succeed in the slightest.

translation: And sent hordes of chargers flying against them,
sentence: وَأَرْسَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ طَيْرًا أَبَابِيلَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Allah sent birds upon them, who came to them in flocks upon flocks.

translation: (While) you were pelting them with stones of porphyritic lava,
sentence: تَرْمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٍ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They pelted them with stones of clay.

translation: And turned them into pastured fields of corn?
sentence: فَجَعَلَهُمْ كَعَصْفٍ مَّأْكُولٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So Allah made them like the leaves of crops that have been eaten and trampled upon by livestock.

translation: SINCE THE QURAISH have been united,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ لِإِيلَٰفِ قُرَيْشٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Because of the habit of the Quraysh and their acquaintance.

translation: United to fit out caravans winter and summer,
sentence: إِۦلَٰفِهِمْ رِحْلَةَ ٱلشِّتَآءِ وَٱلصَّيْفِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: With travelling in the winter towards Yemen, and in the summer towards the Levant, in security.

translation: Let them worship the Lord of this House,
sentence: فَلْيَعْبُدُوا۟ رَبَّ هَٰذَا ٱلْبَيْتِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: They should worship Allah alone, who is the Lord of this sacred house. He is the one who has made these journeys easy for them. They should not ascribe any partners to Him.

translation: Who provided them against destitution and gave them security against fear.
sentence: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who has fed them from hunger, and given them security from fear by placing reverence of the Ḥaram and its inhabitants in their hearts.

translation: HAVE YOU SEEN him who denies the Day of Judgement?
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ أَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى يُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Do you recognise the one who rejects the requital on the Day of Judgement?

translation: It is he who pushes the orphan away,
sentence: فَذَٰلِكَ ٱلَّذِى يَدُعُّ ٱلْيَتِيمَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: It is the one who harshly turns away the orphan when in need.

translation: And does not induce others to feed the needy.
sentence: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He does not encourage himself nor others in feeding the poor.

translation: Woe to those who pray
sentence: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْمُصَلِّينَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So destruction and punishment be upon those who perform prayer.

translation: But who are oblivious of their moral duties,
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَن صَلَاتِهِمْ سَاهُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who are heedless of their prayer; they do not care about it such that its time expires.

translation: Who dissimulate
sentence: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ يُرَآءُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Those who show off by their prayer and good deeds, not being sincere in doing deeds for Allah.

translation: And withhold things of common use (from others).
sentence: وَيَمْنَعُونَ ٱلْمَاعُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And they refrain from helping others with things in which there is no difficulty helping in.

translation: HAVE SURELY given you pre-eminence (in numbers and following);
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِنَّآ أَعْطَيْنَٰكَ ٱلْكَوْثَرَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! Indeed, I have granted you abundant goodness, from which is the river of Kawthar in Paradise.

translation: So serve your Lord with full dedication and sacrifice.
sentence: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَٱنْحَرْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: So be grateful to Allah for this blessing, by performing prayer for Him alone and offering sacrifice for Him, as opposed to the offerings of sacrifice the idolaters do for their idols.

translation: It is surely your opponents whose line will come to end.
sentence: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ ٱلْأَبْتَرُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Indeed, your hater is cut off from every goodness, and will be forgotten. If remembered, he will be remembered negatively.

translation: SAY: "O YOU unbelievers,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ قُلْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say, O Messenger: O those who disbelieve in Allah!

translation: I do not worship what you worship,
sentence: لَآ أَعْبُدُ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: I do not and will not worship the idols you worship.

translation: Nor do you worship who I worship,
sentence: وَلَآ أَنتُمْ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعْبُدُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Nor are you going to worship what I worship, i.e. Allah alone.

translation: Nor will I worship what you worship,
sentence: وَلَآ أَنَا۠ عَابِدٌ مَّا عَبَدتُّمْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Nor am I going to worship the idols you worship.

translation: Nor will you worship who I worship:
sentence: وَلَآ أَنتُمْ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعْبُدُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Nor are you going to worship what I worship, i.e. Allah alone.

translation: To you your way, to me my way
sentence: لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِىَ دِينِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: You have your religion you thought up for yourselves, and I have my religion that Allah revealed to me.

translation: WHEN THE HELP of God arrives and victory,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِذَا جَآءَ نَصْرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْفَتْحُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: O Messenger! When the help of Allah arrives for your religion, He honours it, and Makkah is liberated.

translation: And you see men enter God's discipline horde on horde,
sentence: وَرَأَيْتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِى دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And you see the people entering into Islam in delegations upon delegations.

translation: Then glorify your Lord and seek His forgiveness. Verily He is relenting.
sentence: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْهُ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابًۢا
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Then know that is a sign of the nearing of the end of your duty you were sent to fulfil. So glorify your Lord together with praising Him, to show gratitude to Him for the favours of help and victory, and seek His forgiveness, because indeed, He is the Forgiving, who accepts the repentance of His servants and forgives them.

translation: DESTROYED WILL BE the hands of Abu Lahab, and he himself will perish.
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ تَبَّتْ يَدَآ أَبِى لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Both hands of the uncle of the Prophet (peace be upon him): Abū Lahab son of ‘Abdul Muṭṭalib have lost because of the loss of his actions; he used to harm the Prophet (peace be upon him). His efforts are in vain.

translation: Of no avail shall be his wealth, nor what he has acquired.
sentence: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: How much can his wealth and his children benefit him? They cannot defend him against the punishment, nor bring any mercy to him.

translation: He will be roasted in the fire,
sentence: سَيَصْلَىٰ نَارًا ذَاتَ لَهَبٍ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: On the Day of Judgement, he will soon enter the flaring hellfire and suffer its heat.

translation: And his wife, the portress of fire wood,
sentence: وَٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ حَمَّالَةَ ٱلْحَطَبِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: And his wife Umm Jamīl who would also harm the Prophet (peace be upon him) by throwing thorns into his path, will also enter it.

translation: Will have a strap of fibre rope around her neck.
sentence: فِى جِيدِهَا حَبْلٌ مِّن مَّسَدٍۭ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Around her neck will be tightly bound a rope with which she will be dragged into the hellfire.

translation: SAY: "HE IS God the one the most unique,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ قُلْ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say, O Messenger: He is Allah who is alone in being a deity. There is no deity except Him.

translation: God the immanently indispensable.
sentence: ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: He is the master to whom belongs all sovereignty and perfect, beautiful qualities. The one to whom all creation turn to.

translation: He has begotten no one, and is begotten of none.
sentence: لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: The one who did not give birth to anyone, nor did anyone give birth to Him. So He has no offspring - may He be glorified - nor any parent.

translation: There is no one comparable to Him."
sentence: وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌۢ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Nor does He have any equal from His creation.

translation: SAY: "I SEEK refuge with the Lord of rising day
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْفَلَقِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say, O Messenger: “I seek refuge in the Lord of the morning and I seek His protection.”

translation: From the evil of what He has created,
sentence: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “From the evils of the harms of all creation.”

translation: And the evil of evening darkness when it overspreads,
sentence: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And I seek refuge in Allah from the evils that appear in the night, i.e. harmful creatures and bandits.”

translation: From the evil of sorceresses who blow incantations on knots,
sentence: وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّٰثَٰتِ فِى ٱلْعُقَدِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And I seek His refuge from the evils of the sorceresses who blow onto knots.”

translation: From the evil of the envier when he envies.
sentence: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And I seek His refuge from the evil of the jealous one when he acts out his jealousy.”

translation: SAY: "I SEEK refuge with the Lord of men,
sentence: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: Say, O Messenger: “I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind and seek His protection.”

translation: The King of men,
sentence: مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “The King of the people, who does whatever He wishes with them. They do not have any real king other than Him.”

translation: The God of men,
sentence: إِلَٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “He is their rightful deity; they do not have any rightful deity except Him.”

translation: From the evil of him who breathes temptations into the minds of men,
sentence: مِن شَرِّ ٱلْوَسْوَاسِ ٱلْخَنَّاسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “From the evils of Satan who whispers to the human when he is neglectful of the remembrance of Allah, or delays in it when he remembers.”

translation: Who suggests evil thoughts to the hearts of men --
sentence: ٱلَّذِى يُوَسْوِسُ فِى صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “He whispers to the hearts of people.”

translation: From among the jinns and men.
sentence: مِنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ
en-tafsir-mokhtasar-html: “And he could be from the humankind or from the Jinn.”
